What I could salvage was good. The batter doesn't stick to the hot dog and the dog sticks in the deep fryer when you try to take it out.
I deleted the butter and used olive oil and boneless, skinless chicken breasts.  This is absolutely fabulous and very easy to make!

Very tasty! I had a shiny silver loaf pan and a dark black loaf pan, the darker one took only 45mins, but the shiny took the full 1hour. My 5 year old loves it, and that's what is the most important!!

This is FANTASTIC!!!

I am mailing this out TONIGHT!!! - for starters.
JackieBlue, Excellent recipe! Made all 12 and froze some for later. SO EASY! THNX.

I love these cookies and everywhere I take them they are a big hit!  I tend to take them places often because they are so fast and easy to make.  They are so sweet, I never frost them.  I've used a variety of cake flavors and they all turn out great!

This was surprisingly very  good!  I used only ricotta cheese because I had no cottage cheese and I also crumbled some tofu into it to make it more nutritous.  Next time, I will try the eggplant like the others suggested. Also to  make it easier next time I will just use spaghetti sauce rather than making my own sauce.  I used one layer of ground turkey on bottom, then zucchini, then cheese mixture, zucchini, and then mozarella cheese and used a 9 x 13 dish.
i cant believe no one has rated these yet  i had both fruits in freezer  cause canning in winter is alot more fun than summer lol and these were great thanks for posting dee

Haven't made the bars as directed, but I use the crumb mixture as a topper for my crisps--apple, quince, blackberry, peach... It is AWESOME!  I add cinnamon and/or ginger to the mix depending on the fruit I use:  I mix the fruit with a little flour, sugar, and spices, then bake it for 20-30 minutes (depending on the fruit--quince takes longer), then add the topping and return it to the oven for another 20-30 mins.
Thanks a bunch!

I modified it for the stovetop.  YUM!  This one is going in my recipe box.  My picky little girls ate it all!
Thanks for a great and simple recipe!!

This dish was awesome. I spread a tsp of olive oil in a pan then laid out 4 boneless, skinless fillets of whitefish. I mixed up the spices as stated and sprinkled evenly over the fish then I flipped them over and repeated with the same amount of spices. I put the pan in the fridge for an hour, added 1/4 cup white wine and baked uncovered for 25 minutes. I let the fish sit for several minutes then I sprinkled 3 tsps of lemon juice over the fish. DELISH!
Great scones! They didn't take that long to make either - I was an hour from when I started until we were eating them for breakfast!

Nice recipe Doreen! I followed the recipe but because I was only making two slices of toast for breakfast just grilled the capsicum under a sandwich press (skin down) and did the toast the same way but made into fingers with the crust intact. I took the photograph before adding the lime, it made a great start to the day! It would also be a good picnic / camping type dish that you could spread just before eating.

This punch is absolutely wonderful! Simple to make with easy to find ingredients. A good recipe for anytime of year. The champagne gives the punch just the right amount of "kick" without being too overwhelming.

These muffins surprised me! You're right - they do have a nice flavor despite their lack of flavorings. The flavor isn't too strong, so these are great as an accompaniment to a meal, but these aren't by any means bland either!
I loved these!  Such a simple recipe and so much flavor.  Thanks for sharing.
Very light and tasty.  Added raisins to mine.  Forgot to brush the tops with egg and water mixture but they still came out lightly browned and delicious looking.

I for some reason had trouble with these, they wouldn't rise properly and I had trouble with the dough. Im thinking that the mild wasn't warm enought for the yeast to propertly rise. I will have to try again but next time I may dissolve the yeast in the milk/sugar mixture and let it proof and see if that changes things.  I make breads and rolls all the time.  The color was beautiful the glaze made them very pretty, the cooking time was perfect and the fact that they didnt rise my rolls were a bit smaller which of course was ok for as large of a dinner as I made.  Thanks for posting and I will try again with a few changes to see if that makes any diffrence
This recipe serves 4.This is a very stiff dough. I needed a floured surface to roll out. Good taste.

These are awesome, they taste just like the ones you buy at the fair! My husband and my son loved them as well. This does make a lot of funnel cakes so I would recommend cutting the recipe in half unless you have a lot of big eaters!

Thank you so much for sharing Tonkcats. Your instructions were easy to follow, resulting in a sauce that was beautiful, flavourful, thick and velvety. A perfect setting for my jumbo shrimp and fresh linguini.
This was so easy to make, and so good! I was looking for something sweet as usual, and this was perfect!  This makes so much, its still in the fridge, and I've already made seconds, and thirds, lol!

Interesting flavor.   I kept thinking about that mock apple pie with the crackers when eating this although the taste is more like pecan pie if I had to take a guess.   Probably won't be making this again.
This was a big hit with my friends.   Nice warming drink on a winter's evening.

I am giving this 5 stars, everyone here loved the texture and flavor of this salad, even DH who hates cucumbers raved about this.

Hope you don't mind the corrected measurements submitted.

I had to make a substitution because I couldn't find sambal oelek, and ordinary soy had to do for the ketjap manis (I added a bit of extra sugar to compensate).  But the end result was scrumptious.  After our meal Mr B informed me that he doesn't like peanut butter; but funnily enough he had a clean plate at the end!
This recipe is truly as good as Olive Garden.  I have made this recipe several times and it's a hit.  Very easy to make!!!!  A must the next time you feel like soup.

MMMMMM Mouthwateringly delicious!!!!!
  Followed recipe to the letter and it came out simply scrumptious!!!
 Will be making this again for sure!!
   
   Thanx for posting!!!  
    Debbie  :)

These are good. I've made this using chocolate cake mix{Duncan Hines} and it was a blast! That led me on to trying these using strawberry cake mix - another good success! My family has enjoyed quite a few of these cookies in the past and they can vouch for the taste ;) A nice keeper with minimum ingredients, this does make for a nice treat when the sweet tooth bites.

I made these for my son's school ( Cookies w/ santa) tonight. Neede something super easy,cheap & fast. I used strawberry & chocolate chips.(they tasted like cherry cordials) I had a hard time geting the chips in as it was thick.The first batch wouldn't bake,so I made smaller ones, cooked 8 min and left on the sheet to cool.Thanks for sharing.

These were yummy.  I used yellow cake mix and sprinkled a few chocolate chips in--mmm, mmm, good!  They came out REALLY big---this recipe makes about 15 large cookies. They weren't SPECTACULAR...but still great for a good snack. :-)

I must say that these are awesome! Addictive! My 13 year old daughter (Cheyenne) made these today all by herself - yes they are SO easy to make...She used simple yellow cake mix, but they are truly the most moist and delicious cookie I've ever tasted! Can't wait to try this with other flavors of cake mix - like Devil's food or German chocolate or strawberry...The possibilities are endless! Thank you so much for posting this easy and delicious recipe!!! (I posted pictures, but it was AFTER I came home from work, so more than half of the batches had already been devoured by my kids and their friends!) TY -- Stacy :) â€” Jun 24, 2005

UPDATE:  Cheyenne made more of these wonderful cookies - this time she used chocolate cake mix and added some M & M's to the top!  Excellent!  Chewy on the inside, yet slightly crisp on the outside...She's now thinking of all the possibilities to "embellish" this recipe, like adding nuts or white chocolate chips, etc...Posted the chocolate pictures too!  Thanks again!  :)

Excellant

I did try with a variation:  I added 4 skinless/boneless chicken breast(marinated in italian dressing) and baked @350 degrees about 30 minutes.  When these were cooked I cut into approx 1 inch pieces and added with 2 heads of tender-crisp broccoli crowns.  Delicious!
excellent, quick & easy

i thought they came out great, i actually doubled the recipe so my sauce was fine. i have to say (reguarding others comments) i used your recipe as a general guide, everyone's taste are different, but compared to buying a can of sauce (which i normally do) this was great. some people are better off sticking to canned foods while others should experiment.
GREAT RECIPE...
Thanks
I make these all the time. My Family loves them!! I used a chocolate cake mix and chocolate chips. They were awesome.

Sorry these came out pretty thin & not to good for me for some reason-could be because I tried to do some substitutions with the only ingredients I had on  hand-don't want to discourage anyone from trying this recipe but just be warned to try to follow the ingredient list provided!
this was a family  delight, we subsituted in saugage and ricotta cheese... no complaints from my family; simple but unique, definitely will make again
Excellent.  I loved the flavor, and the taste.  I omitted the cauliflower and added extra tomatoes - perfect!  Thank you!

I LOVED this recipe! I was looking for a guacamole recipe that was simple, easy and didn't use onion (allergy). Except for a little addition of chili powder and cayenne pepper, the recipe was followed and it was AMAZING! thanks for posting!!!!

Very easy to make. The texture is a litte more cake-like maybe because of the oats and butter quantity. They weren't too sweet. Next time I'll use a bit more cinnamon and pat them out a little thicker. I think I made them too thin. Nice recipe Nancy. I will make these again.
All I can say is YUMMY!!! My kids who don't like zucchini loved it.  I prefer this over regular lasagna...my hubby said he liked it alot but would not go that far. He is a lasagna lover.
This was great the wife Is a excellent cook. This Is a keeper for usWe love It.
I made this for my parent's 20th wedding anniversary. It was easy, easy, easy; and they loved it! I tasted some too, and it was fabulous. Very classy.
This recipe is from the Starbucks Recipe book, and is very, very good. It is all over the Internet, and is one of the traditional coffee frappÃ© from many traditional cookbooks.
Very easy to make and tasty!
I made this like a grilled cheese sandwich and LOVED it!  What a nice change to the same old tuna sand.  Thanks for sharing this!!

Yummy! I used fat free hot dogs, egg beaters, lowfat cheese, left out the butter & just sauted the veggies in chicken broth. You couldn't really taste the cheese -- I might use less or even leave it out. Thanks -- we liked the recipe a lot!
This is a terrific recipe. We loved the bits of salt pork as a garnish. Just great the way it is! Thanks

This was excellent!  I used haddock and tilapia (I preferred the haddock).  My husband was skeptical at first but said it was delicious.  I used Miracle Whip because I like that little zing and I will definitely make this again.
This was the first time I had ever had Yorkshire pudding.  It was so easy to make!  I loved it.  Even my picky eater husband loved it!  I will definitely make this again!
I really liked this recipe. Will make again, especially during the hot summer months.

My muffins turned out just great....nice & light but moist.  I scaled the recipe to make 12 mini ones.  I used oil for the fat, and added in some crushed pineapple that I had in the fridge and a little cinnamon.  'Very good' were the comments from family.  I will use this recipe often because of the many options it gives.  Thanks for posting a 'keeper' for me.:)
Great easy salsa. Didnt have olive so used corn oil. Tasted so good, I couldnt wait for chill time, so it can taste even better when the flavors mix. Cumin makes it wonderful.
This was VERY delicious... the only thing I'd say is that the sauce is a little thin.  Maybe use less water and/or more tomato sauce.  We enjoyed it -- thanks!
Pretty good. A little on the mild side.
I really wanted to give this a higher rating but it was too sour, It needed more sugar. Thank you for posting the recipe anyways.

Absolutely fabulous!!  This was my first time making Yorkshire Pudding and it was a great success!  Whole family loved it!!  Will make again..and again!!
Thanks for the GREAT recipe, and history lesson!
This was a good dish with coconut ginger rice and plum sauce. It wasn't too hard to make, either! I only had sweetened coconut flakes and I'm curious to taste it when it's not so sweet.

There is a recipe for this type of meatball & sauce dish on the back of the Heinz Chili Sauce bottle, the meatballs are baked & the sauce poured over the top after baking. Seems they are alot easier to make.

Used to eat this at Famous as a kid.  Loved it but the old lady watresses would only serve kids if they were with an adult.  I found out over the years alot of us as kids couldn't get served at Famous.

This is one of my favorites and have used it very often.  My familt loves when I make them.  Today, for Easter I substituted the Cheese for chedder and added about 2 cups of sour cream to the potatoes.  More calories but oh-well!!
Pretty good, did the job. Very quick and easy, especially after a cake mix sale at walmart :)
absolutely delicious.  A big hit and easy to make.

Very good recipe.  Very filling and fairly easy to make.  However it was little too tangy for me probably cuz of lot of tomatos and tomato juice.  Next time i think i will skip on the tomato juice and add more water instead and add some salt also.

This makes a perfect amount for our large family (9), with leftovers for another meal.  I can't believe it!  Everyone loved this soup. That in itself is a miracle! My 3 year old said she liked the "pickles" in it (zucchini). :-)

The only thing I did differently was to adjust the amount of the vegetables to our liking and add a touch of salt.  Very, very good!

This is delicious. It tastes just like the Minestrone at my favorite Italian restaurant, Sergio's. It does make A LOT of soup, so next time I think I might half the recipe - there will still be some left to freeze! I skipped the spinach b/c I can't stand cooked spinach. This was still outstanding! I did add quite a bit of salt and a garlic-wine seasoning I have. Topped with tons of fresh-grated parmesan and some warm sourdough bread. Heaven in a bowl!

This soup was fantastic.  I made it for my grandmother, who is VERY PICKY!  She loved it and asked for the recipe.  The only things I changed were...Doubling the garlic, omitting the spinach, not adding any water or wine(I like my soups alittle on the thick side)and I simmered this soup for about 1 1/2 to 2 hrs.  It was great...Better than any restaurant I have been to.
Great recipe. I followed it exactly, except I added a small amount of crumbled hot Italian sausage to give it a little bit of a kick. It was delicious. Thanks Joy, I will be making this often.
Made this for my family on Super Bowl Sunday.  A big hit by everyone....great flavor and so easy.
This recipe is excellent... it is very plentiful and hearty...it is the only minestrone recipe I use now...thanks for sharing it.

I picked this recipe in the Bargain Basement Game.  I couldn't find pineapple pudding so I used French Vanilla.  It's yummy!  Be sure you keep and eye on the icing while it's cooking so it doesn't burn tho.
This is an excellent recipe, the soup was delicious!  My teenage son ate it for breakfast, lunch and dinner.  I put the Italian sausage in as suggested, which made it nice and hearty.
I had lots of compliments for this dish... Delicious, make it again.  A nice change from steamed zucchini.

This was good but not special, I used cod, sorry but I probably won't make it again, it did not seem to have a lot of taste. I added cayenne pepper and some cumin, to give it a little kick, also used just one tablespoon of oil and followed the rest exactly.  Maybe more seasoning would help the flavour.

I feel like I am walking down memory lane. My great grandmother used to make these for ANZAC day.  ANZAC day wouldn't be the same with out these bikkies. many thank as I have been trying to find a recipe that I can use so that my kids can have the same experience as I did!  Lest We Forget
This is definitely not a recipe suitable for the addition of coconut milk. Cook is as is and enjoy it.  I did and my guests enjoyed it immensely

Hi,
Professional Vegan Pastry Chef here weighing in on this sugar issue.

Evaporated Cane Juice like Organic Florida Crystals would be the best choice for Vegan-Calcium Carbonate free sugar in this recipe. 

Please do not use honey which turns toxic at high temperatures.

Chef Kent

This is fabulous!  I am trying to cut fat and carbs, and this fit the bill.  I miss pasta, and this is very close to it.  I used ground sirloin to lower the fat content and used green onions since regular onions are banned on my diet.  This was not difficult to make...I will make it again. Thanks for a great recipe!
totally mouth watering. i used fresh broccoli and seseme oil instead of peanut. I also added some strips of onion and capsicum and some chopped celery as well. I will be making this one again .
Wonderful! Loved the play of flavors in the 'stuffing.' Different than many of the Dolmades I have had at various greek places; but really really delicious!! Well worth the time to make!
this was wonderful warm with cream for sweets tonight. i left out the peacans as my family doesnt appreciate nuts but they really loved this pie/cake  many thanks for a delious recipe
a wonderful hearty meal which is what i was looking for. my family loved it, the youngest didnt like the onion but the rest of the family loved this dish thank you

We really enjoyed these potatoes. I didnt peel them and my DH put them on the grill to cook in a glass casserole dish. Added some onion that had to be used but these potatoes would be great without them too.
I use this recipe for our little community center lunch occassionally and it goes over very well. Thanks for a great easy and delicious dessert
This is YUMMY!!! This is my new 'Go to" dish for pot lucks!  Thanks for sharing.  I didn't change a thing and I loved it microwaved the next day, although there wasn't much left!

I love Olive Garden's pasta fagoli.  This is tastes just like it only better.  I made a half a batch, which was huge.  It went so fast, I wish I had made the full recipe.  It is even better the next day.
This makes a really easy and great side dish....I'm planning on substituting broccoli and chedder for the spinach and jack cheese the next time...just for variety.   Thanks for sharing.
Made this to take camping this weekend. Taste great and easy to make. Thanks!

Yumm, this is fantastic.  Only change we made was to put all of the crust ingredients in the bread machine and that worked out great.  We used half whole wheat and half white flour.  That seems to be a perfect mix.  Used half of the dough for a pizza and the other half a couple days later for calzones.  The sauce was great.  We used wine and added a dash of garlic powder.  Topped the pizza with veggie pepperoni, onions, baked garlic, spinach and cheese.  Next time I think that we will cook the crust a few minutes before topping it.  Thanks for sharing this recipe- this is the best completly home made pizza we have made.  Will make again for sure.

This is great!  I made it for my youngest daughter who does not like veggies so I thought I could sneak some into her diet this way.  I baked it in a 9x13 pan (for about 40 minutes) and I'm thinking of telling my eldest daughter that they're brownies b/c I think they have a very similar taste.  What a great find!  Thanks!

These potatoes were great!  I have eaten Greek potatoes at a couple of restaurants before and I loved them.  I was glad to find this recipe.  The only change I made was that I used dried herbs because I didn't have the fresh ones.
I followed the recipe exactly and the flavor was great.  The sauce kept seperating despite my best efforts to keep it together, but I loved it nonetheless.  Thanks for sharing!

I made it 3 days ago, through circumstances I was unable to retieve it from my bread machine for 2 days... it was still terrific.  Made it again this morning with a little more toated oats... hubby is eating it right now with a big smile on his face.

Excellent! Had to make some comfort food for my Dutch roommate and they were delicious! I'm new to this cooking nonsense so I had a few probems with "wire rack." Also didn't have an accurate way of measuring grams, but I winged it and they came out great! One thing though, DON'T wait too long before piping the filling in... my first batch deflated. Still tasted great though.

I used the sauce recipe this weekend with some changes to suit our tastes and it was to die for! I added 1/2 cup more water, 2 TLB. more parm, omitted the sugar and added 1 tsp. each dried thyme and basil.  It made enough to do two pizzas and since I was only making one, I was able to freeze the other half of the sauce for next time.  This was a great sauce and tasted totally authentic.  Thanks so much!

Our neighbor brought us a bunch of fresh rhubarb. We turned right to zaar for a recipe!! My hubby picked this one out and made it for us (Minus the cinnamon). Turned out delicious - very easy to make!

This is a great starter recipe much healthier than the commercial brands which are mostly salt.  I did need to adjust the spice content for our tastebuds, adding oregano and garlic and increasing the cumin & cayenne.  Thank you WildlifeDi for sharing the recipe.
Someone posted a review under my name!  I never made these no did I give them a poor rating, I am sure they are delicious.  So sorry!
This is an awesome recipe!  I made it for a carry in at work and was a little worried wether or not it would serve 10 people (5 being men).  It was plenty and they loved it!
No problems.  Lighter than I expected, recipe fed 2 with room for eggs.

Good sauce, but I do not recommend grated cheese from a jar.  Go with the real cheese.
I used this sauce on linguini with shrimp and mushrooms.  Very good.
Excellent and easy to make. I used walnuts instead and added them to my salad.
These were wonderful!  I made these for Mother's Day and everyone loved them.  I omitted the chives/onions, but kept everything else the same.  Thanks!

oooh my goodness, so good, so easy. my ds loves these. i haven't made them w/out wheat germ, i have also tried many other suggestions, like adding blueberries. next time i might even try chocolate chips. i am not one to stray from a great recipe but this one allows me to be a little adventurous while confident it will be good.
My family loves this recipe everytime I make it! I like it better than Olive Garden's.

I used a l3 x 9 pan and increased all ingredients by 1 l/2.It was perfect without doubling up the sugar as some have suggested. 
This turned out just wonderful.I served it with vanilla ice cream while it was still warm.
I was worried that the rhubarb would be tough but it was just super - much tastier than apple cobbler. 
I used tub type margarine  (not diet) with good results. 
This recipe will be used over and over again!!!

Wonderful, wonderful sauce.  Use it with grilled chicken or garlic sautee shrimp.  Using the fresh cheese (buy in bulk & freeze 1 c in baggies-huge savings!)significantly enhances the flavor.  Very fattening, but worth every delightful bite!  As good as ANY restaurant!
Excellent!  And so easy to make!  I used fresh spinach and grated cheese.  The leftovers are great cold too.  Definately a keeper!

Very quick and tasty! I used saithe fillets. (Saithe cooks quite quickly - mine were done in just over 15 minutes) The spices were subtle - you couldn't really tell which spices had gone into the mixture but the overall flavour was lovely. Thanks for sharing!
Delicious, thick and rich...  and so easy
This is so easy to make and so good.  I get nothing but compliments when I make it.  In fact I get special requests to make it.  Dana

This was wonderfull for a picnic, love the lemony/garlic flavour. I also stuffed a walla walla quartered onion in the cavity which turned out delicious to eat! and I sprayed the whole bird with veggies spray just before putting it in the oven. I did find I had to cook it for about 1 hour and 10 minutes, actually I did it for the 45 minutes and when I went to cut it up found it quite pink near the bone, so cut it up and returned it to the oven for another 20 minutes, perfect.
Thanks for sharing I will doit again.

My 9 and 4 year olds said it was the best salmon they had had yet.  I didn't have any sesame seeds this time but marinaded overnight with the addition of some freshly roasted garlic cloves- beautiful!

This was a great recipe.  We used our food processor to blend everything except for the spinach and artichokes.  It came out great!  Better than Applebee's.  It was also great reheated.  Will definately make again.
Yum Will! I used a little extra garlic and didn't find it too strong, however I do like garlic a lot. I had served with chicken parmigiana instead of pasta (sorry!).

Great potato recipe--instead of boiling and chopping up the potatoes, I baked them and cut them horizontally into circles.  Then I placed them on a greased cookie sheet, brushed them with olive oil and a little bit of salt and broiled them until the skins were crispy.  I served them with the sauce as listed in the recipe, which I made early and let sit for a while so the flavors could meld.
I made these with fried chicken, green beans and biscuits... thank you!! :)

Excellent flavor. Mine were a tad bit dry so I needed to add a little more milk. Not the recipies fault I may have just measured my flour a little off. Didn't have any maple syrup so had to setle for Mrs. Butterworth's Syrup, still excellent though. I doubled the batch for our large family. I dropped the batter by rounded Tablespoons and it made 30 fritters
We really enjoyed these enchiladas. Instead of black beans I used a can of mexican dark red beans and shredded the chicken instead of cutting into bite size pieces. So easy to make!

My family loved this!! We much prefer cooked pudding over instant, and "made from scratch" pudding is even better. It cooked up thick and creamy, with a light chocolate taste. I did have to cook it about 35-40 minutes before it came to a boil, but that could have been due to my stove's "low" setting being lower than most. Also, this seemed to make a lot of dry mix, so I 1/4 the dry ingredients because I didn't want to make that much. I really liked the fact that you can make up a batch of the dry ingredients ahead of time to make when needed. Thank you for this wonderful recipe...it is definitely a keeper.
These are the biscuits  I have always eaten.  They are very delicious!  Thanks for posting this recipe.
I love this recipe and my family loves the pie, so I've been making it often. It's just like one my sister made years ago. Excellent!
This has to be the easiest recipe I have ever tried.  Its surprisingly good and I'm not a huge fan of Ramen.

What a great low-cal, low-fat recipe! I used tilapia filets and, like Joanne, breaded both sides of the filets and gave the tops a quick spritz with cooking spray. They were excellent- I served them with Jeanette G's Buttery Dill Potatoes(#62530) and Merlot's Marinated Coleslaw(#31664)for a delicious dinner. Thanks for posting this, Carole!
One of my favorite salads!  We always make this with a pack of taco seasoning added to the beans, and to make it quicker use canned tomatoes and a bag of salad.
This was good, but with all of the other strong flavors, I couldn't taste any bourbon at all. I think next time I will increase the amount of bourbon in the recipe.
Lovely recipe....As I was putting it in the oven I thought it might be a bit bland, so I sprinkled some mixed herbs over the top...next time I will mix them in before I put the topping on.
Great flavor, and very easy roast!

Made this for a memorial day get together...very good!  I used bulk parmesaen cheese grated in the food processor and then added all the other ingredients except the artichoke hearts and spinach and let it rip!  I chopped the artichoke hearts up into small pieces and also chopped the spinach up smaller.  It was so yummy and it went great with assorted crackers.  It reheated very well, in fact the flavors intensified upon reheating.  Thanks for sharing a great recipe.
These muffins were excellent, I added 1/2 cup of chopped dates and 1/2 tsp of cinnamon. My family really enjoyed them and asked that I make them again. Thanks for the recipe
Great flavor and texture and easy to make. Made it twice in a week. Kids loved it too.
This was so good.  My husband who doesn't like rhubarb liked this.  Sweet & tart & crunchy.  Will make this again.
Excellent......really enjoyed this! Easy to make too.
This is a fantastic recipe!  I served it over noodles with fresh Italian bread.  Next time I will make it using hot sausage.  Thanks for a great recipe Zaney1

This smelled so good cooking.  I cooked it at work right in my nesco.  The smelled went through out the building.  I made one small change and used great northern beans instead of the garbonzo beans (had the northern on hand).  Followed everything else to a tee.  Thank you so much for sharing this recipe.  It is a keeper
Loved these enchiladas!  Great tasting sauce and excellent filling.  Even my picky husband liked them!

These were quite tasty, however the flour tortillas came out very soggy.  I will try these again, perhaps thickening the sauce and using a smaller amount of sauce for baking.  A good start to a recipe though.

one word......


  Tasty!!!!!!

Wonderful!  I really loved the cucumber sauce.  It was quick and easy and really made the dish.  Even my picky eater said "These are good!".  Will definitely make these again.  Thanks for a great dish.
I grew up in Hawaii then moved away for college, and I have missed haupia SO MUCH. This is exactly how I remember it.

i made this, in search of the "perfect cornbread" to serve with everything.  this recipe was very easy to follow, and turned out beautiful results.  the bread was moist and tasty.  i served it with country style butter beans and bacon.
Perfect! I made it in four grab-it bowls and baked them for 45 minutes.

This recipe saved the day!  Didn't have time to run out to the store to buy candy for our daughter's 3rd b-day party, went onto recipezaar.com and found this one!  Oh my goodness....how awesome!  These lollipops taste just like the ones you buy at high end stores. I added 10 drops of red food coloring, and 5 drops of cherry flavor and they taste just like jolly ranchers!!! Thank you sooooooo much for sharing this family recipe!!  Will DEFINATELY make again and again.

My boys looked at these and said "is there squash in here?"....ooohhh they are getting better about finding those hidden vegetables.  BUT they loved them and I had no leftovers....Thanks for a great recipe!

got my daughter, and beautiful grand daughter, here from PA ad I knew Kate loved funnel cake.
Got the recipe, made it, and ate it, in less then 30 mins, and guess what?
I am a funnel cake CHEF big time.(according to Kate :)

GREAT PIE AND VERY EASY!

I sprinkled a little bit of cinnamon and sugar on top of the second one I made for a little different taste.

THANKS FOR SHARING!
Rather involved, but well-worth the effort.  Excellent dish.  Full flavored taste of the middle east.
This is so delicious and simple to make that it's a tragedy it should be so high in fat. Else I would eat it everyday. Had it fettucine and garlic shrimp. Great recipe.

I tried this recipe over the weekend. I thought I had some cornmeal but when I opened the bag, I wasn't sure if it was still good. So since I already had the recipe started I just added some extra flour.  Needless to say, the puffs were pretty doughy on the inside. Maybe it would be better with the cornmeal. I may try again another time.

A big hit at a poolside Father's Day gathering - everyone commented on what a nice change it was from traditional tomato salsa.  I added half a jalapeno (they were pretty mild, I could have used a whole one) and a few shakes of Crystal hot sauce.  I thought this would be delicious wrapped inside soft taco shells with some lettuce and/or refried beans so we'll try it that way next time.  Thanks for a keeper!
I instead used a can of drained black beans and tortilla chips rather than Fritos.  Also added some ground beef seasoned with taco seasoning.  It turned out great and was easy to make.  Thanks!

The cake is very tart and the listed ingredients for the glaze are wrong for sure! The way the recipe says to make the glaze it comes out super runny and so tart you can't eat it, I kept adding powdered sugar to it to try to thicken it, and it never set up enough. I like lemon cake and minus the glaze it wasn't to bad, if I do make this again I will do some major doctoring to the recipe!

I made these on Father's Day to accompany our dinner.  Unfortunately, these muffins didn't pass the mustard...I tried them the next day, cold, to see if that would improve the taste, but they were still very bland.  My family couldn't taste that good cheddar zip or the pepper at all.  I'm sorry, but I will definitely not be making these again.  They do get an extra star for being easy and looking nice, though.

Good, lowfat, quick dessert. I would suggest cutting the tortillas into one-inch square pieces, the long strips I made for lattice tops were hard to serve and eat. Tortillas get nice and crispy on top. Couldn't taste the ginger, so it could easily be omitted. The cooking time was a bit short for me: the peaches weren't soft enough and the liquid didn't thicken up, but the top tortilla strips would have burned if I'd cooked it any longer. Would suggest another frozen fruit like blackberries, canned peaches or precooking the fruit part before adding the top layer of tortilla strips. A nice healthy and light dessert. Thanks for sharing the recipe!

I will definitely try this one.  I am of Greek descent and it is very similar to the one my mother used to make.  I have actually been in that restaurant about two years ago.  Great food.  In fact, some of my relatives are named Papas with one "p".  Thanks for sharing.

I made this last night and it was very, very good! I bought three fillets and doubled the recipe. I marinaded the fillets for 2 hours and them I grilled them on Low for 5 minutes on one side with skin side down, then I took a spatula and turned the fillets without the skin and put them back on the skin for five more minutes. Then I put more marinade and a sprinkle of sesame on each fillet before serving (without the skin). Easy and Yummy!

Wonderful! A little more on the Miracle Whip side of the mayo spectrum, but just fantastic for veganizing my recipes. I blended it for forever in the food processor and the texture is spot-on. Thank you!

I made this last night and it was GREAT.  Noone knew it was tofu until after I told them.
I doubled the tofu and parmesan mix, because I like that layer thicker and I also added one sliced zucchini in with the mushrooms.
Thank you very much. =)

A friend gave me some fresh out of the garden yellow squash. I used some in a casserole but had 3 left over so I tried my hand at this. I'm normally pretty impaired when it comes to frying. Don't know why but I've just never had much luck...until now. These turned out beautifully. Nice and crisp but not at all greasy. I love that the batter was light enough to still be able to taste the squash. Followed the recipe exactly and cannot wait to make this again. Thanks for the great recipe!
good stuff.dee

These cookies are fabulous!  I used strawberry cake mix and added mini chocolate chip cookies.  I also topped with powdered sugar while they were cooling.  Delicious!  I will make them again for Valentine's Day.
What a great recipe!  Inexpensive and EASY!!  My favorite is a chocolate cake with peanut butter chips.  Yum!
Oh my!  I used chocolate cake mix with chopped pecans and butterscotch chips, and then butter cake mix with chopped pecans.  These are the best!
I have tasted these made from an Angel Food cake mix...simply "heavenly!"
Very tasty if you make strawberry cookies (1 tsp. of dough each)then make sandwich cookies with jam.
Very good when in a bind for time or ingredients but can't beat real homemade cookies!
Perfect!  Tasted just like my favorite salsa at the La Casita restaurant chain. My only change was a little extra onion.  Will make a triple batch next time!
I agree with the others, this was very good!  It was easy to prepare, and we enjoyed it very much.  Thanks for posting your recipe, we will enjoy it again :)
My mother used to make this when I was small...I have looked all over for a recipe that tasted like hers...this is it!  What would I do without Recipezaar...
Very good, quick and easy.  I used lunch meat ham and added onions for some crunch.  Will make often for casual brunch

This is a great recipe. I disagree with members saying  make them with store bought meatballs unless your in a hurry. This recipe is much better, the meatballs are tender and your guests will see you took the time to make homemade.
It was delicious!  Tastes like a drink I had at Starbucks one time that costs $4. Now I can have it anytime I want!  Thank you!!  I used sugar free syrup to lower the calories.

This made very good, crunchy crisp biscotti, perfect with coffee. They are not real sweet cookies, which is how I prefer them. Because of the limits of my oven, I baked the biscotti in two 9-inch long loaf pans, which I had greased and floured. The dough was pretty sticky, but since I didn't attempt to form it there was no problem. My short loaves baked in the 30 minutes given, I then sliced them and baked again as the recipe states. My yield was 35 biscotti after trimming the ends of the loaves. I haven't used the chocolate, and probably would reduce the amount if I did. Thank you for sharing this recipe.

Made this with fresh squash from our garden. Soaking in buttermilk was a new step for me when preparing fried squash. The squash were crispy and had a nice flavor. 

Thanks M. Messer. 

Bullwinkle

All I can say is "WOW".  This was wonderful.  Followed the recipe, but instead of fresh tomatoes, used one can of diced tomatoes and 1/2 jar of spaghetti sauce instead of tomato paste.  This is a keeper!!

I would probably call these fritters more than puffs, but they were delicious no matter what you call them! I loved them on their own, but I also tried this mixture as a batter for deep-fried zucchini and it is great for that, too. The main key there is not to put too much batter on the zucchini because the corn flavor can kind of overpower the zucchini.
I added vanilla and a splash of lemon juice to mine. came out a bit too watery - but was okay. I baked mine in the oven, and finished them off under the broiler. yum.

I LOVE these cookies. This is exactly the same recipe as my mom's...I request these every year for Christmas. Note -- these go stale very quickly, so you may want to halve the recipe if you're not going to eat them all right away.

This was the pie that almost never was.  I had a really off day with the crust, and was able to squeak out just one.  Openfaced, it still came out absolutely perfect!  I love that the blueberries stay whole, and the lemon peel really make this outstanding.  I also added some ground cardamom, brushed the bottom crust with egg white, and added a dash of corn starch.

I made this for my Bunco group and it was a big hit.  Everyone wanted the recipe.  I left out the Tabasco sauce and added the pasta before serving and it turned out great!  I even froze the leftovers....can't wait to eat it again!!  It was delicious!!
I love this casserole!  I left it in a little longer to brown it well.  We all loved it!  It was an easy recipe to prepare.  Thanks Mr. Bill.

My grandkids loved this recipe, so will rate it high.  My 30 year old mixer (olive green..lol) quit working while making the frosting.  My husband helped me to get it mixed up.  Anyway, every one loved it..thanks for sharing.
best i've tasted since my mum's.To improve taste use a free range egg, you'll be surprised what a difference it makes!!
Very easy. The classic fish chowder recipe. I bought a bag of assorted seafood pieces in St Johns ,NB on a tour and made this on a hotplate. Yummmm!!! Use butter instead of margarine.

I made the sauce only, first for pizza quesadillas for lunch and spaghetti sauce for dinner (thinned out with water). I was in a hurry and this fit the bill. Thanks Marg.

Roxygirl

A  great tasting recipe  that reminded me of the blueberry grunt my dad   makes.

Thanks  alot.

This is a fine way to use fresh zucchini & herbs straight from the garden. I made two substitutions to cover ingredients I didn't have on hand. First, I used ricotta instead of cottage cheese. Second, I didn't have ground beef, so I used 8 oz. (weighed after baking) of Asian Style Savory Baked Tofu (#81284). I wasn't sure how this would turn out, but the flavors of the marinated, baked tofu worked very well in the zucchini lasagna. We loved this one, and I'll be making a double batch next week.
Just had to add- as honey is an animal product, check first whether the person you are making it for eats honey as many don't.

The first time I had enchiladas was at a restaurant.  I was hooked and then so very glad to find your recipe.  I think I am addicted to them and your recipe will be the only one I use.  So very good. Thank you for posting it.

This was great!  I ended up using "fake" maple syrup as that is all that I had available.  I also marinated it for about 5 hours and cooked the salmon on tinfoil on the grill. My husband loved it and I loved it for how easy it was to make!

Looking for ways to use up all my summer squash, i tried these..oh my, sooo good !!!i couldnt stop eating them. I served them with a curry dipping sauce. They would make fantastic appetizers with a little green salad. I will be making these all summer long. thanks for a great recipe.

This was very good! I didn't have regular butter so subbed with Molly McButter, it worked great! I used FF Sour cream and only about 1/2 cup FF cheddar cheese. I too added some Garlic! These potatoes  were very yummy and did not taste like they were good for you! Thanks

OH my word, this was soooooo GOOD! I had to make quite a few adaptions/substitutions, though. I used a can of spaghetti sauce instead of making the sauce as indicated. I also shredded the zucchini (I have an old-fashioned grater that makes 1/2 wide shreds). I used an entire large zucchini that got overgrown in the garden. I baked it in a 9 x 13 pan. It was a bit runny, so next time I think I would put a bit of flour in with the zucchini shreds. I also microwaved the shreds instead of boiling them. I would also put some crushed garlic in with it while it cooks. All in all, this is a great recipe and will be a summer staple on our dining table.
I tried this years ago when I first started getting TOH magazine. It's a really nice comfort food-type dish!
Loved it! Made it with the leftover Armenian cucumbers we got from our local farmer's market. Perfect food for this heatwave!

I LOVE this cake! I made a few adjustments such as, I used 1 cup Splenda and 1 1/4 c sugar, I used 3/4 c canol oil instead of butter and 1 cup of chocolate chips instead of walnuts. For a frosting, I used 1/2 can of chocolate frosting beat with 1/2 pkg of cream cheese. I didn't have round pans so used two 9"x13" pans instead. I made it for a family dinner and baked and froze them three days ahead of time. On the day of the dinner I defrosted one and frosted it. It was absolutely fantastic. Rich and moist. The kids didn't have any idea there was zucchini in it, they just knew it was great and ate it up! Thank you for this wonderful recipe.
We really enjoyed this soup. I added a dash of cayenne like some of the other reviewers suggested.  I also used a dried dill mix from Pampered Chef that contained garlic as well.
i also used cookie cutters and they were kinda small so i got 24 delicious minibiscuits!

This is more a zucchini cake than anything else. Good taste! I made this twice and both times it stuck to the bottom of my loaf pans, and I greased the heck out of them to prevent sticking.  Don't know why it did that, but oh well.  The kids snitched slices all day long both times I made it and it was gone before I knew it. I added some chocolate chips to one batch and I think I like it best that way...chocoholic that I am.

This recipe is Delicious!!  I made it in crockpot and home smelled great all day!  I used jar spaghetti sauce, Italian sesoning instead of the oregano and Tabasco sauce.  It's easy and inexpensive to make.  The veggies are tender.  Even using half recipe made enough for hubby & me, son and family and neighbor who mows yard for us.Am going to make 1/4 or 1/3 recipe next time.  All that is needed are some breadsticks.  We have this soup about once a week!  Thanks Nancy for great idea!
Great meatballs!  I love serving them over rice with a green veggy on the side.  Thanks!
This was so delicious and authentic - a perfect St. Patty's Day meal - I served with Irish Soda bread.  The flavors were warm and comforting, just like any good stew should be!  A keeper!!!

Made this last summer and everyone loved it.  Cut oil content to 1/2 cup and substituted 1/2 cup applesauce.  Also used Splenda in place of sugar to make healthy enough for visiting diabetic.  Just waiting for someone to give me some zucchini, so I can make again.
This was very easy to make, although I cooked my pumpkin a little differently.I peeled and chunked it up like apples and then cooked it until done. Then followed directions from then on.
This was great,very simple and wonderful flavor.My oven was full so I simmered it on the stove.Turned out great.

I used 1/2 tsp fresh grated ginger in place of ground, and 3 cloves of garlic minced in place of powder, and this was fantastic.  I can't see why people would used ground/powdered spices here when the fresh tastes so much better.

I made this recipe with the exact ingredients and it was tasty, authentic. However because of the high oil content I went and modified it by adding 1 cup of water and some lemon squirt and one minced calamata olive and some more salt.  I then used egg beater and mixed it together .. still the same taste but a little lighter..
fabulous!the real macoy!

Extremely good and easy to make.  Have shared recipe with all of my family and everyone loves it.  I add a little cream cheese to make it stick to the noodles better, but it's great without.  I make this with Louisiana style blackened chicken breasts #66857.  They are amazing together!!  Thank you for sharing a recipe for one of my favorite foods.  This is better than any restaurant!!

This recipe is delicious! The muffins I made turned out moist. I altered the recipe to make it a little more healthy. I substituted 1/2c. unsweetened applesauce and 1/2c. coconut oil for the vegetable oil. I also, cut the sugar to 1 cup. 1/2c. was granular sugar, the other half was brown rice sugar. The last alteration was to substitute 1 cup whole wheat flour for the all-purpose flour. The mini-muffins cooked 12 minutes @ 350 degrees and the regular size muffins baked about 15-16 minutes at the same temperature. It will be hard to keep these muffins around. They are so good!

Very nice frittata recipe. It has all kinds of possibilities and variations that can be made. Thanks for a good breakfast or lunch recipe. I served it with fresh bread and watermelon. Carole in Orlando

My family thought this was a nice refreshing summer drink. It got very frothy after adding the club soda, which was kind of cool. I thought it was just this side of being sweet enough and ended up adding a little bit more sugar. Thanks.

Made for "HEADS UP! You ZWTII players who miss your teammates....... Event" I was lucky to have Dreamgoddess as a fellow "Cavorting Chef" on the ZWT II. We had a blast! This recipe is appropriately named because it was Fantastic! I used freshly shredded romano cheese and an extra clove of garlic. Wow-did this smell good baking! DH is working and DS is out so I enjoyed this as my dinner tonight. Thanks for posting :) Nick's Mom

This is absolutely delicious.  I loved it.  I had to cook mine about 15 minutes longer than noted.  I think because I had these HUGE farm fresh eggs with double yolks - so it was more liquidy. But it came out very moist - just right. For me this made one large loaf and one small loaf.  (Guess which one I kept for myself?)  This is a keeper.  Thanks, No Spam

I like this recipe with papergodess' recommendation for the crockpot! The first batch, though, I wasn't happy with the peels even after the food processor. The next batch I peeled , and even though I left out the cinnamon stick, ROSY is nice. Mine, like always,even after lemon juice to try and stop it, turned way too dark for me. But that's just me, my husband cares not what the color is! I'm making another batch tonight!
We enjoyed this cookie, but would not rate it among the top ten.  The cookies were a little too sweet.  If I made them again I would add more pecans and use less sugar.

This is the closest thing to Dunkin Donuts blueberry muffins that I've ever tasted! I used half cake flour and half regular white flour and it turned out fluffy and wonderful. (Make sure your cloves are finely ground, though.)

These were really good! I was surprised how moist they were. My family is very picky - they don't like apricots, nuts or chunks, so I pureed the cots and left out the nuts and the sugar on top. I froze them and took them to a family reunion so everyone could taste one - all were pleasantly surprised! Thanks a bunch for a nice change in a muffin.
Now, this is the recipe I had been searching for. It is the real deal.  It smells wonderful and tastes great.
Super!!!!

I loved this!  I too used bottled sauce and, instead of ground beef, used cooked vegetarian sausage (that I had already cooked up with onions).  I also used low fat ricotta instead of the cottage cheese as I finished off the cottage cheese last night!  While the kids were only so-so about this, they are not huge lasagna fans.  Dh and I loved it.  It was easy to put together (my 4 year old and I put it together while dh and my 6 year old were at karate) and I love getting the extra servings of veggies in!
I thought this was really really good!  It was simple to make, and the bacon was a nice addition.  Thanks for posting your recipe :)
This recipe made a really good crunchy coating for fish.  I used Old Bay seasoning because I had no lemon rind, and it was still good.  Thanks, Carole Reu, for a good alternative to frying!!

yummy yummy!!! I couldn't keep my fingers out of the mayo mixture. I also added a touch of dry sherry, all I had. I have been looking for something like this for ages, and now i can have my fix anytime. It's so simple i'm suprised i never thought of it. Thank you very much for posting, will be making again and again. Foodlover1

This has a very creamy texture with a rich flavor. I sometimes leave out the spinach to save time and it still tastes great! This goes awesome with garlic bread or tortilla chips too. Friends can't get enough of it and are always requesting this recipe!
Great taste!  I cut the salt down to about a 1/2 of a teaspoon and there was no problem with excessive saltiness.  I used butter flavored shortening, and the result was amazing.

These hash browns are to die for!!!  I am on a very low carb diet and just one bite and I kept eating them against my will!  Spicy enough that my husband liked them and not so spicy that my little boy scarfed them down as well.  VERY GOOD RECIPE!!!!

Everyone who tried this salsa, including myself, liked it, so it must be pretty good.  I used one large jalepeno, which added plenty of heat, because I don't like for the heat to overpower the flavor in salsa.  Also, I used 1 tbsp of dried cilantro, instead of 2 tbsp chopped cilantro. The combination of flavors was very nice.

Oh my God....I have died and gone to Nirvana! This was wonderful and I can't wait to try this out on company. I used modifications as one of the members had suggested with mushrooms, olives and ground turkey.

Great biscuits! I used a 2 1/2 inch cutter, so I got about 6 biscuits out of the dough. They were soft and buttery. I also took a little of the shortening out, and added butter. Soft and melt in your mouth!I brushed butter over the tops right before they came out of the oven, so they browned up nicely. This recipe is a keeper! Thanks so much!
It was a piece of cake to make it, and even my kids loved it!!!!

This recipe has been tasted and approved by my scottish mother in law and she actually wanted the recipe! Which is a lot said, because she is very proud for the recipe she has been using for umpteen years. Me myself am more fond of sweeter tasting cookies and would increase the amount of sugar or sprinkle some extra on top. Very good, buttery and crumbly.
A Very good Salsa recipe, had everything on hand, only added extra olive oil. Followed recipe exactly as stated, Thank you.
I absolutely loved this recipe. I'm a vegetarian so I left out the meat but it was excellent! Will definitely make again. supposed to cook the zucchini. I ended up steaming it,
A quick recipe which doesn't taste too bad. If you're on a budget this is a decent variation to top-o-ramen.

These were really great. Like all the other reviewers, I found them delightfully simple to make, quick, and the result was absolutely DELICIOUS! Gooey, chocolate-y, and decadent! Everyone in my family loved these. Thanks for the recipe!
This was fantastic!! Tasted just like the stuff I always order from restaurants!! I've already made it 3 times, and I just found this recipe a week ago. Thanks!!!!!

I made this with a banana I had to use. I didn't have enough milk, so I replaced half with chocolate soy milk. I also mixed in some chocolate powder to give it even more chocolate flavor. The muffins rose nicely and had a great banana-chocolate taste.
this was GREAT! the best funnel cake recipe i've used. as long as you use a blender to mix the batter everything will turn out great.
Loved the recipe and have made it many times, however I found I had to bake it about 50 minutes in order for it to set properly.  Was too runny at 35 mins.  But easy and delicious!
This dip is wonderful!  I will for sure be making this recipe again.
Thank you for this really good recipe. It's so good that you don't even realize that you're eating zucchini.

This recipe reminded me of "sloppy joes."  It was good if you like that sort of thing.  My husband and son LOVED it, but my daughter and I had other opinions.  But please if you like "sloppy joes" this is the recipe for you!!
Just what I was looking for, and thanks for the very exac and detailed instructions

This reminded me of the Korean BBQ ribs I've made in the past.  I added about a teaspoon of minced ginger as well and cut back on the sesame oil as I find that to be too strong for me.  This was a very flavorful marinade and very easy recipe.  I used the cross cut beef ribs that you can find in some stores out here in CA.  It could be used on other beef cuts such as a thin cut round steak or sirloin if someone doesn't want to mess with ribs.  I served it with jasmine rice and a green salad.
Easy & delicious!!! Nice & moist. this was a hit with everybody.  Thank you!

Thanks for the zucchini Mel! I made these cookies with some of it and they were good. I did have to add some additional flour because the dough seemed thin enough to be cake batter. The flavour of the spices really added something special and these were extra soft which DH loves. Thanks again :)

This recipe was great! I found it to be a tad lighter than the fair recipe which we loved because my family likes to eat on the healthier side. I had two of them and so did my husband! This is definetely a family fun favorite from now on. Thanks for the recipe!

I thoroughly enjoyed this with black bean tacos. The combination of sweet, spicy, crunchy, and juicy was really nice. It was a bit of a bother to roast the onion and garlic, but I think that roasting improved the flavor of the salsa. Thanks for sharing!

These turned out good even though I ended up using olive oil in place of the vegetable shortening (I was all out of shortening). I was surprised at how well they turned out. I did decrease the salt to just a pinch. A nice change from my usual biscuit recipe.

I followed the recipe exactly, the batter did not stick to the tomatoes for some reason & by the time the little bit of batter that did stick was "golden brown" the tomatoes were so mushy that they had to go in the garbage. Would not attempt to make these again.
This was one of two punches I made for a wedding.  This was by far the favorite.  People were begging for more.  It did take longer than 3 hours to thaw out to a nice slush though.

Not that you need another 5 star review but here it goes.  This was so good.  My friends and I get together and play cards and I made this for our last get together.  So easy to make and yet so amazing to eat.  Wow.  Thanks for the great recipe.

This recipe made a very tasty pie and was so easy to follow. I omitted the lemon rind since I didn't have any, but I can imagine how much tastier it would be with the addition. I also forgot to add the margarine before baking, but didn't seem to notice a difference. I used Most Incredible NO FAIL PIE CRUST for the crust and it was the perfect combination!

I'm giving this full marks because it tastes so good, even though my first attempt at making it had some problems.  Having recently moved to a higher altitude (about 4500 feet) I didn't properly adjust the recipe and it fell somewhat.   I also used a gluten-free flour, since we're starting to suspect my DH is somewhat gluten intolerant.

This came in handy! I used it for Deb's Recipe's Southwestern Lasagna. I had scaled the recipe down to make toughly 2 tablespoons. Next time I'll make more than neede so that I can adjust the flavor. I eneding up adding a teaspoon cornstarch to my meat to thicken it up, too. I know most commercial packets contain a thickener.
Thanks WildlifeDi for posting. 

Roxygirl

very good! I added a tablespoon of cocoa for an extra chocolatey flavor.  I had to cook for about and hour and 15 minutes, but thats not unusual with my oven.  It might be a good ida to grease ANd dust your baking dish with flour or cocoa, as I had some sticking problems.

Great recipe.  Very moist. I substituted the 1 cup oil for 1 cup unsweetened apple sauce.  Used 1 cup of sugar instead of 2 cups. I squeezed out the bulk of the water from the zucchini. Lined my loaf/baking pans with parchment paper (hanging over the top edge) so I could easily lift out the bread.  Next time I will add one cup of crumbled chocolate to recipe for more flavour.
this cake was alright, but i found it very dry, and flavourless [i even added a little extra vanilla]. i dont know if i'll make it again.
I've made this several times with a bottom round roast and it always turns out tender and delicious. I never use 3 T of oil though -- 1/2 T does the job well.

We used this as a guide and changed the amounts to our taste.  Used serrano peppers instead of jalapenos.  Perfect!  I even used some as a garnish on hot dogs.  This one is going to my 
cookbook.
These are just like what we call scones in australia and I found it an easy receipe Thanks

Love all kinds of English Trifle.  The last 2 that Julesong sent in are fabulous.  I rate them both 5****
Gail from Hamilton

This is an excellent recipe.  I have made it both with the spinich and with chopped broccoli. I did substitute cheddar cheese as suggested for the broccoli and it was just as good. Even people who aren't crazy about spinich, really like this dish.  This is a nice side dish to serve for any occasion.  Thanks for sharing a wonderful recipe.
This was really really yummy!!!
Really good! Though I might prefer a bit more lentils and less cauliflower florets. But anyways... the taste is great!

This was an easy and tasty recipe to prepare.  Amazingly enough my kids even ate without any complaints and coaxing and they've been going through a picky about food period  right now.  We don't eat a whole lot of salmon but this was VERY good- I loved the sauce!
Great recipe - lots of flavor and easy to prepare.  I used instant brown rice and will definitely make this one again.  Thanks Cindy!

I make the meat (minced lamb) version of this recipe and everyone loves it. Don;t be put off by the author saying that it is involved....it's not the most time consuming thing I have cooked, and if you make enough you can have some the next day for lunch!

This crab dip was an absolute hit
I made this for a barbaque this labor day it was so easy and fast to prepare.  I subsituted the dry  mustard for regular mustard and I used garlic powder instead of garlic salt I also added extra cheese and crab meat was a hit everone wanted this recipe. I want to say thanks for making me look so good.

Excellent!  A super, savory quiche and better than if there had been a crust.  I substituted skim milk with a little butter for the half-n-half and had no problems.  Don't forget to grease the pie plate first.
I have made this Rhubarb Crunch for a very long time. Its a 5 star recipe in my book. My recipe does have 1 cup of sugar also. Other then that the recipe is the same.

These rolls were good!  I, too, was looking for a way to use up cucumbers that didn't involve a salad.  I had regular sour cream and a regular package of chives and they worked just fine.  They were very tasty but didn't rise to a normal "fluffy" roll texture.  We ended up eating them with the Potato-Mushroom Chowder (26739) and my dh is still raving about this meal.  We found that you had to eat them quickly because they went hard within 2 - 3 days so seal tightly.  Thanks for a wonderfully different recipe!

Very yummy! I doubled the recipe, and added a bag of semi-sweet chocolate chips, it made 4 loaves... although I think next time I'll make muffins out of it because the loaves don't rise very much, so they look anemic. That said- whoever won't eat them for looks- GOOD! because that leaves more for me! ;) I used the Mazola Pure cooking spray to grease the pans and I had no problem with sticking. This is good stuff! Thanks for the post itsjustme!

I think the lemon made this dish taste very authentic, much like my favorite all organic mediterranean restaurant. adding 1/4 cup yogurt to the food processor is supposed to make this dish even tastier although I haven't tried that yet

I have resisted the temptation to make an alfredo sauce in the past because I was a little afraid I would skrew it up somehow, but this was excellent.  I poured it atop angel hair noodles and topped that with some chicken I cooked up in a frying pan.  Very good recipe, and easy.
YUM!  This recipe makes for a lot of good eats!  It baked up nicely and tasted great!  There isn't a thing I'd change about this keeper!  Thanks so much for posting your recipe, it was really good :)

Five stars, one word... DELICIOUS.
Thanks!!
These are the best muffins I have ever made.  I did a double batch, I used two peeled Granny Smith apples and I threw in a half-cup of raisins and a little brown sugar.  Everyone loves them.
These were great little muffins but they could use a little more apple in them.  Very tasty.  Thanks for posting.
wonderful muffin! I love the cinnamon with bits of apple. This recipe is very easy to prepare. I used heart healthy Bisquick and Splenda. Thank you for sharing.

Super easy, full of flavor. It's the perfect amount of cinnamon flavor. I combined the dry ingredients, then added the wet ones & apples. They baked perfectly in 16 minutes. I think I would increase the chopped apple to a full cup, though. 3/4 cup is about half a small apple; I used Gala. Thanks - I will make these again .
My 9-year old daughter picked this recipe to make for breakfast this morning.  It was easy for her to make since it didn't have a lot of ingredients.  She liked them very much.

My family raved about this lasagna. My husband continues to put in requests for this one! Both my boys (6&4) asked for seconds. This ones a keeper:)I took the lid off the crockpot for the last half hour which gave a little bit of a cruchy layer.
I rated this 3-stars based on the 3-star meaning of 'liked it'.  It's easy to put together and is a somewhat fancier way to serve sloppy joes.

my husband liked this recipe.  i on the otherhand, did not.  it was bitter and i'm sure it had to do with the stout.  when i make this next time for him, i'll be cutting way back on the stout.  i, too, added potatoes which makes the stew heartier plus cut the thyme and rosemary ingredients in half.  in addition, served with big chunks of italian bread and a side salad.

Wonderful recipe! It was done in 20 minutes, no joke. Great flavor, inexpensive ingredients, and versitile enough to use as a light meal or a side dish. I've made it a few times, each with success:
-I prepared it just as posted and it was fantastic. 
-For a vegan alteration: I doubled the amount of tomatoes and olives (using kalamata in addition to the green). We didn't even miss the feta, but I found that it could be sprinkled over or mixed into the salad at the time of serving and it was even more delicious.
Thanks so much!
I made this wonderful bread this afternoon and it is the BOMB!  I like it just the way it is!  Thanks for the great recipe!  I'll be making several and putting them in the freezer!
I am just not a big fan of this.  Everything came out just great, and my kids ate this up.  I might try adding a little garlic next time.
Excellent Hash Browns! These turned out great and tasted even better! Thanks Malarkey Test....

This is one of my vegetarian daughter's favourite meal in restaurant's. .Now we can have it whenever we like. Red wine gives an even richer flavour and I think it definately benefits from the Worcestershire sauce idea.

What an awesome recipe.If you are looking for a low carb meal this is one you should definitely try.
My 6 yr. old  daughter just loved it. We used yellow zucchini from our garden instead of green, and it was fabulous. This dish is also very easy to make. Thank you so much for this great recipe.
These were soo good! I added some baking spice to the base and topping to give it an extra kick. I used margarine to make them vegan. These will be inhaled quite quickly.

I cant believe that I didn't already review this as I have made it successfully three times now.  I used 385 ml carnation milk, 2 1/4 cups brown sugr...and followed the directions....it was bubbly around the edges but same jiggily accross whole pie.  I did make this in a round  pizza deep dish pan,  but if using a tart pan with removeable bottom I would suggest placing on a cookie sheet also.  I used my sweet short cheesecake crust....Yummy smooth, not runny works out perfectly...also left out at room temperature for days and crust dosent get soggy, and still great.... This is almost like butter tarts or pecan pie filling... only no raisins or nuts...

These are so simple to make!  My son helped me and was beaming with pride when they came out of the oven.  They tasted great too!  We used Devil's Food cake mix and added chocolate chips.  Thanks for the recipe!

I made only the sauce, but will certainly try the crust too.  I used the wine option, something I have enver done before in pizza sauce, and it really did give another taste and smell to the pizza.  My husband commented that it tasted like his spaghetti bolognaise. It was certainly easy to make and I froze half for another pizza later.  Nice change to try for something a little different.

Lovely flavours,I,ll be having this again.
Just serve with rice or Naan, it was delicious
This recipe is a keeper in our house.  Using plum dipping sauce just made the whole thing that much more tasty.  Thanks for sharing JANIC412:)
Sorry, this casserole didn't have enough flavor for me.  My grandson, who loves corn dogs didn't even care for it.

We really liked this, and I might make it again for a change to our usual beef stew.  A good recipe, but I have to be loyal and like my Grandma's stew better!  The flavor was pretty good, but it needed quite a bit of salt for our tastes.  Thank you!  Update:  This stew was much better the second day!  (For the leftovers, I also added extra guinness and thickened with cornstarch.)

Lovely recipe.. simple and versatile enough to adapt to our tastes. Did not have short ribs, so I just used sliced beef. Cooked it in a skillet together with thinly sliced potatoes and mushrooms, and thickened the sauce with a little cornstarch. Thank you for sharing.
Good stuff! I served this over Whole Wheat Biscuits (#25459 - also a great recipe!) It was a very simple and satisfying meal.

You don't have to be Irish to love this...you just have to have taste buds!    My husband (of Irish descent) and I (of Polish & German descent) both loved this dish! I added potatoes and skipped the oven and just finished it on the stove, otherwise followed exactly.  Thanks, Janic412!

I don't bake...especially bread.  But this, this was easy!  I wasn't expecting it to be as sticky as it was in dough form but it turned out fabulous! Served with Janic412's Irish Guiness Beef Stew...delish!
This recipe is very delicious and easy to make.  I usually double the sauce, so I can have some for the rice.  Thanks for the recipe!

No matter how hard I tried, I could not get my funnel cakes decently shaped. With a smaller hole, they turn out thin and crispy, with the larger hole, they were thicker and more doughy. My kids prefer the softer thicker cakes. I dusted ours with icing sugar, and they were gone within hours. Thank you for sharing.

I thought this was great, but made a few minor changes. I used olive oil instead of butter (healthier) and sharp cheddar instead of muenster cheese. Next time I make it (there will be a next time!) I would scoop out some of the softened squash and mix it with the filling prior to topping with cheese. It was a nice mix of flavors, and the splash of soy sauce gave it more of a depth of flavor.
This was excellent!! I used 1 lb. ground turkey instead of beef and a can of drained stewed tomatoes instead of fresh and it came out delicious. I also used way more garlic than it called for.

I loved these!  They were so good, I didn't need to use butter.  Very easy to make, but the yield is small.  I patted these into a square and cut it into quarters.  They weren't as pretty as the picture, but the taste made up for it!  Thanks for a great recipe!

A wonderful dish I must say. The amounts stated were just right for me taste. The only thing I added was a little tomato puree for colouring. Apart from that, a wonderful side dish. Will definately make again

I just made this for dinner, it was so easy and fast, I didn't add Cauliflower (didn't have any)and added ground coriander (didn't have fresh. I added a little more salt, to my taste. It only took about 15 min of cooking which was great. I love the colour, texture and taste. Next time I might experiment with adding other spices like garramasala and curry powder for added idian flavours. I love it thank you so much.

This is a family favourite in our house. I originally got it from Cooking Light but was happy to find it here on 'Zaar. I usually use 2 cans of diced tomatoes and double the ginger. I serve with basmati rice, a big dollop of plain yoghurt, and microwaved pappadums. I sometimes partially puree this. I usually use red lentils, but see in the pictures some people have used brown. Might try that for something different!
Very good, except that I think, I will have to use ricotta cheese instead of cottage. But overall it was tasty! Thanks for the recipe

I wonder if some of the grease problems were from using higher fat meat?  I used ground chuck and cooked the burger a little before simmering them in the sauce.   That helped with the excess fat in the meat.  I still had to removed some excess fat from the finished sauce but that was easy enough.  I would actually trip the sauce next time but I used 2lbs of meat.  I also think that adding some breadcrumbs and onion to the meat would be great.  That said we all liked the flavor of the sauce a lot!  Great variation on a staple in our home.

This was a huge hit at my office. Every year we have a day when everyone brings in their baking, and the kitchen is full of sweets and pastries. I thought I would try bringing in something tangy and refreshing and healthy! This, with a bowl of tostitos, was the perfect antidote to all those sweets!
This was good, and went well in a shrimp stirfry with other ingredients and spices. On it's own, I find it a bit too vinegary, however.
This is a simple, quick and tasty dish to prepare.  Lemon and curry worked well with the lamb chops.  May even try to substitute the lemon with lime as this becomes a regular favourite.

Very nice! The quantity was perfect! The muffins filled the cups with nice crowns. skimpy little flat muffins. Light, moist, tasty muffins. I added coconut and pecans and topped them with a mix if 1/2 cup brown sugar, 2 tablespoons flour and a teaspoon of cinnamon. Perfect muffins!

This was GREAT! Super easy. Although, I had to stir it more than "frequently" as it splattered so much while cooking if I didn't. Might try it with a bit less sugar next time, but still this recipe just rocks! And the house smells FABULOUS --- just like fall ought to! I am lucky to have a neighbor a house away with a huge, productive pear tree ... and she cannot begin to use them all!
We have made these a bunch of times and love them! Great way to get kids to eat veggies!! I've added cheese before and it was great!! Thanks for the recipe! One of our family favorites.

This was my first try at a pie crust.  I made an apple pie out of it and it turned out great!  The crust was flaky and tasty.  I pressed the bottom into the pie plate and rolled the top crust between 2 pieces of parchment paper.  It was a bit more dense than a traditional pie crust (with shorting) but the trade off was worth it for using a healthier alternative..the canola oil.  thanks for the recipe, i will use it again!
This was such an easy soup to make...but it tasted like you cooked it for hours...wonderful flavor...I will be making this often...

this was an okay muffin recipe, it was missing something but couldn't figure out what, just wasn't the greatest.  Maybe I was looking for something sweeter, who knows?  I would probably add more apples if I tried it again.

Thank you for this!  I had everything I needed for dinner tonight EXCEPT for the taco seasoning, and I was so glad that I found a nice easy one that I had all the spices for.  When I tried the finished meal, I noticed a difference, but couldn't place exactly what it was.  When I read the reviews though, I realized it was salt!  It made me see how much salt really IS in those pricey little packaged deals.  Thanks for this great recipe.  I'll definately be keeping a small container of this around. :)
These are surprisingly easy to make and they taste just like Canada's Wonderland funnel cakes! Unfortunatly I'm now addicted to them!

This is so-o good.  An easy, quick meal that goes together instantly (almost!).  I used chopped roasted red peppers from a jar instead of the pimientos and thought it a good flavor addition.  thanks for posting this recipe, Opal.  I shall be using it again and again.

This is really good.... its really good... really really good...lol its really great.. thats all that I can say... I wish that my taste buds can talk because they would be able to describe how great it is... clawdeeuh... thank you soooo much for this great recipe!
This tastes even better than Olive Garden. It was super simple to make. You gotta try this one!!
Excellent and very quick and easy to make!!

I really liked them, and have my second batch in the oven now cooking.  They are simple to put together and use simple ingrediants I usually have on hand. The kids love them, and they make a nice homemade healthy snack for their lunches.
I have recommended this recipe and would like to add this was by far the easiest chocolate pie I've made.  I used 4 yolks in pie and used corn starch for meringue, they both worked great.
Made this for a side dish to Italian Meat Loaf.  Very quick and easy to prepare. Next time will add some roasted garlic for more depth in flavors.

My batter came out too thick to come out of the funnel.  I just kept adding more and more milk.  I probably will try another recipe.  Flavor was good, but texture was too tough after I'd added so much milk.
So very good and rich.  I couldn't get it to thicken up very well.  I added Ultragel and that solved the problem.  Great recipe.  Thanks!
Doubled this, added a package of frozen spinach and a tsp of garlic powder....soooooo soooo good. Served over baked chicken. Thanks so much for a quick, yummy treat.

I liked this, but did not love it.  Made it for a party and half the dip was left at the end.  Didn't go over that well.  Most guests agreed that they liked another one of my recipes better...so I'll stick to that one.  Thanks.
I made this on a cool autumn day.  Perfect!  Wonderful flavor that just warmed me up.  Kids loved it too.

this was so easy.  i dont know if ill ever by the stuff in the jar again! the bf said this was the best alfredo he has ever had :) the only problem was when i reheated it in the mic the next day the butter seperated, but it was still good!
Tom, I made the recipe and got 4 oz. of liquid, but it's watery - not like horseradish - did I do something wrong?  Also, are there any uses for the left over puree?  Can't wait to try this!

This was fabulous! I can not say it enough. My sister and I try out new recipes all the time. It looks like this will become the football staple for games to come. Outstanding! I made the dip as written, only substituting with light sour cream. Can't wait to make it again!

Wonderful and very easy.  I generally do not like long marinating times for fish, so the only adjustment I made (aside from using an entire side of salmon) was to decrease the marinating time to about 15 minutes.  I let the filets sit in the marinade for just the time it took the broiler to pre-heat.  Even increasing the amount of salmon, I had enough marinade, I didn't brush the salmon with extra sauce, and it was perfect for us.  Flavorful, but not overbearing.

I'm sure these would turn out wonderful if you followed the recipe more exactly than I did.  I didn't have strawberry preserves, just frozen strawberries.  So I took the strawberries, thawed them and put them in the blender with some honey and used that for the strawberry preserves (there was 2 cups).
