So the bars are more moist than they should be and there is not the intense strawberry taste.  But what I do have is yummy gushy strawberry bars.  Learn from me, don't do that, use the preserves.

I have used this recipe for quite a long time and my family loves it. I only add half a cup of the sugar, milk and flour to the starter each time. That way I end up with half as much batter; then I cook two loaves and have the other half to keep as starter for my next batch of bread. My friends are not big on baking so this way I did not have to scramble to get rid of the starter each time.
Flawless!!!! These babies will never go hockey puck on you......i've been using the same recipe for years-my mother and grandmother before me and -having tried others- this ones the bomb

All I can say is that I was sad that I had to split this with the ladies at my party :)I wanted it all to myself.
It is fabulous, this is going to be a standard from now on at any get together and if they are lucky I may bring it for our holiday party at work. Thanks so much Juli for sharing
I got an itch to try this after getting Blueberry buckle baby food for my son.  It was different than I had expected but very tastey.  I love bluberries so any new dessert with them is a plus.
Absolutely fabulous!  This tastes exactly like the cucumber salas served at our local Japanese restaurant! We really enjoyed the flavor.  Thanks so much for sharing, Dancer^ : )

YUM!! I'm not a huge salmon fan, but I know I must eat it. Dare I say I actually enjoyed this. As long as the salmon taste is cleverly disguised, I will eat it...and enjoy it...and that's what this recipe does. I will add this one to my collection of keepers. THX!

My husband has sentenced me to a life time in the kitchen making this chicken curry now! It was so delicious and we both enjoyed it. The results were even better than I had hoped for. I followed lovetacook's example and used a cornstarch slurry and it thickened up beautifuly. It was the nicest meal we'd had in ages!

The only reason that I didn't give this recipe 5 stars is that I'm still working on getting the cooking part down pat! The recipe is great and easy but last night when cooking, I overfilled my forms. Add that to not having my heat quite high enough and I ended up with some pretty light and a bit doughy (but still yummy!) crumpets. Now that I've made notes for my personal stove, I know my next batch will be just wonderful and I'm planning on giving them (along with a half-pint of homemade jelly) as favors at our annual Thanksgiving dinner. Thanks for a great recipe!!

YUM!  Perfect for Hallowe'en time. We made it yesterday and it is half gone! I never would have thought of using pumpkin.  

Thanks!
I used to make my acorn squash with brown sugar--now I'll be making it with maple syrup every time! You don't need the butter, but the cinnamon is a must!

I prepared this dish using chicken thighs as a quick no fuss dish. Not sure how to rate this as I did enjoy it as a meal. The chicken was moist and tender, with the high heat and short cooking time sealing in the juices and marinade.  The flavors were also good, a wee bit spicy with nice accents from the ginger and allspice.  Next time, I would consider doubling up on the spices to make the flavors a little  more assertive. A definite keeper.

This was yummy. Although I really like spinach artichoke dip, they usually don't really impress me because I think they all basically taste the same. This is really good. I used shredded parmesan cheese and followed the recipe exactly.

Thank you, Thank-you!!  I've been looking for just the right recipe for years and this is the one.  The taste and texture are perfect. Crusty bottom, slightly chewy texture with tons of tiny bubble tunnels, and just the right sharpness to the flavor.  I followed the recipe (super easy)exactly except for filling the rings with batter only 1/2 or 2/3rds. My rings are english muffen rings and are slightly deeper.  I also turned them over after removing the rings for less than a minute to give the top a slight toasted appearence.

Thanks again - Bob
Great Taste! I got a 10 from my chef Hubby. I would reccomend adding a little fresh garlic and perhaps a bit more sugar.

Juli, I just made this recipe and oh my Lord! It is fantastic.

However, I did modify it a bit.  I thought 2 cups of parmesan sounded like too much.  I used 1 cup of parmesan and 1 cup of cubed orange old cheddar cheese to make up for the other cup. I cooked it at 375 for 25 minutes. Everything else stayed as is.  

Rather than serving with toasted bread or crackers, I cut a bit hole in a pumpernickel bread, used it as a serving bowl, and dipped the remaining pieces in.

Thank you for sharing!
Fantastic!  Used green beans instead of cabbage and apple juice instead of white wine.  I put it in the crockpot and let it simmer - wonderful smell and the soup was delicious.

These are so good!  I've made them following the recipe exactly but have also made some changes to make them a bit healthier and like them both ways: You can use 1/4 c. shortening, 1/4 c. milled flax seed, 1/4 c. unsweetened applesauce in place of the 1/2 c. shortening if desired. I also like to substitute whole wheat flour for regular. These freeze beautifully!
I make these out of my mom's old cookbook. They are so pretty and delicious, but they do go stale very quickly as Aunt Cookie said.

This recipe was very simple and fast to throw together... My daughter had 8 girls over for her 17th birthday and they gave it all rave reviews... especially one who said she's very picky about spinach dips and rated this one .... excellent!!!  I even gave her the recipe to take with her.... i would have given her the leftovers too..  but sadly there were none:{  The only change i made was i actually used more spinach then the recipe called for... I used a 16 oz bag and it seemed perfect... I will make this again!  thanks for sharing... I really enjoy trying recipes that get high marks on mulitple reviews!
I loved the picture so I had to try it. This was so yummy my husband said, "Okay honey let's make this a regular." Wow, what a response from my otherwise quiet football watching hubby!! Great recipe.

A really good soup.  French onion is my husband's favorite, and he loved the recipe.  I omitted the bay leaf, caramel color, and the white wine because I did not have them on hand.  I used a homemade French baguette sliced and dried out in at 250 degrees in the oven for about 15 minutes.  I then added monzarella cheese on top and toasted until the cheese was bubbly and slightly browned.  I then added the bread to the bowls of hot soup.  
I do not own any oven crocks that I could have broiled the bread and cheese in, but making the cheese toast separately worked really well for me.  I also used the Swanson's broth.  With the Swanson's Broth the color was right on, so I am not sure if the caramel color is really even necessary.

Thanks for a great recipe.

I have this going in the crock pot right now, and I just took a little sample out as it smells delicious.  It also tastes great.  I added fresh chopped garlic to the meat and onions as I browned it.  Left out the parsley because I didn't have any left.  I used the Barilla no bake noodles and just broke them up and dumped them in (no boiling) and a tad bit more tomato sauce.  Next time I think I will try the layering method, but I will most definiely make this again.  Serving with a small salad and some cheesy garlic toast.
It didn't have the richness I am used to in a ranch dressing. Could be because I used low fat buttermilk and light sour cream.

This was my first time making acorn squash, and was looking for a non-sweet, vegetarian recipe. This was the one I went with. The results were oh-so-good! Although next time I will follow the recipe more closely, I did have to make a few small changes because in each case I didn't have fresh on-hand: I used dried shiitake mushrooms that I soaked and finely chopped, frozen broccoli, and dried basil (I also added some dried parsley). I didn't have walnuts so I had to omit those. I'm a vegan, so instead of using muenster, I used a vegan cheddar cheese that is made by Follow Your Heart, and instead of butter, I used a vegan margerine. The results were still amazing. I will make this again, next time with all-fresh ingredients.

I really enjoyed making this; it reminded me a lot of the applesauce my mom makes. I did it in the corckpot and then I did another batch on the stove. the crockpot version turned out better, but I don't know why.  next time, I'll definitely take the time to peel the apples--I just used my handblender to puree everything, and it left sharp slivers of peel. (silly me...) thanks for a great recipe, Linda!

This was really good. Minor changes: I fried up 3 slices of bacon and added those, and a dollop of clam juice, which is recommended in other chowder recipes. I also added a few shakes of Old Bay and some thyme. Just a great hearty soup for a cold day.

I had never made them before but have had them many times.  These were yummy!  I don't have a press so it was a bit tricky "stringing' them into the water.  Not by any means impossible though.  I sauteed them in some butter and parsley right before serving.  We actually had it with SOS, I know strange combo but it really was a great meal.
Easy to make.  Delicous!  Thanks for posting this recipe.

I thought this was excellent.  It wasn't as runny as the kind you get in a restaurant but I liked it that way.  I made this for game night and the other spin. dip fans said they really liked it.  I followed the recipe exactly and my finsished product looked just like Marg's photo.  Will definitely make this again.

Easy and good. I chopped the green peppers, and they were a little too overpowering.  Next time, I will finely chop the peppers and reduce to 1/4 cup.  Also, instead of the cottage cheese, use a combination fresh shredded mozarella and ricotta i.e. 1/2 cup of each.
excellent I did not use the catsup but it was easy and delicious

Being Canadian of English lineage, yorkshire pudding was always served with roast beef in our house. Also we never had it without the requiste Golden syrup!. This tastes just like my mum used to make, thanks for posting.
This is a really fantastic recipe. Subtle and wonderful. Thank you Carla!

Made this for a party I attended and everyone raved about it. One person at the party used the term "restaurant quality" to describe it. I changed the recipe a bit. Added a package of pre-shredded italian cheese, plus one cup of parmesean cheese instead of 2)

I made this last night.  Very easy and delicious recipe.  I made it in an iron skillet.  I suggest this not be done.  This is the second chicken recipe that I have made in an iron skillet and the sauce tasted burnt.
This recipe is quick, easy and has a delicate flavour.  Even though I couldn't get cod at the time, my whole family enjoyed it with the fish I substitued.

This was great and easy to make; a good one to make ahead of time. I put it in the fridge in the afternoon so all I had to do was pop it in the oven in the evening. I assume the cottage cheese was probably suggested to keep this a low-fat meal, but I used fat-free ricotta to keep my calories down and still get the Italian taste of ricotta. I also doubled the meat portions--because my boyfriend is a meat head...and we love us some meat.

A really good muffin. I did substitute 1/4 cup of shortening with applesauce. I also added some vanilla, cinnamon and dried cranberries. It's an easy recipe that is really open to variations.
Another addition to my favorites!
Thanks Marg!
this is the best I've make yet!!!

I have to say, with just a few ingredients this dish is comforting and delicious.  I made this dish with a few changes for dietary reasons. I also cut the recipe in half because there are only 2 of us.  I left out the butter, and used low fat mushroom soup and added some sauteed mushroom to get another veggie in.  This IS REALLY REALLY GOOD!!  Can't wait to take it for lunch this week.

These are very tasty muffins.  I added about 1/2 cup of raisins just because I love oatmeal and raisins together.  Plus I added about 1/2 tsp. of vanilla-cinnamon to the batter and sprinkled a little cinnamon sugar mixture onto the muffins just before baking them.  They're so delicious and not overly sweet.  Thanks for posting!
The first time I tried this, I was convinced it was the BEST THING I'D EVER MADE! Whenever my friends come over, I serve it for them, and it's so incredibly tasty and filling! Outstanding!

My family and I thought the chicken was a little too lemony and did not like the topping of flour.  If I was to make it again I would not dip it in the flour mixture and use less lemon.  Thanks for sharing.
I don't usually have much luck with biscuits, but these turned out very nice and tender. I used them on top of this recipe Hamburger Casserole. :)
My family makes thi sat Thanksgiving except not with the vanilla pudding.  The only problem is it tastes so light its easy to overeat.

Pretty good, though too much work for me. It took me about an hour of prep to peel/grate/squeeze the oranges, chop the onion and skin the chicken. Oh yes, I used thighs instead of chicken breasts. I also simply simmered on stovetop for an hours because other reviewers tried it and apparently like it that way. Thank you for a nice change to regular fried chicken, this would be something I would want once in a while.
I scaled it back some as the recipe makes a huge amount and used a combination of kale, cabbage and green beans for the cabbage. I was divine. Thank you.
These are very moist and they tasted great.  Instead of all-purpose flour I used bread flour.  They were very good.

Great recipe. Super easy, doubled well and was easy to work with. I"m going to try using it for a bread today. All my piza dough recipes must double as bread dough. I didn't try to sauce cause I had already bought the sauce. It baked well and I also tried 2 with some pre-baking, and 2 without. I didn't notice a difference at all. I"ll definately use it again.

This was very good. After reading the other review, I decided to increase the seasonings and to combine it all while the couscous was still hot (thanks, Toni!). I used about 1/2 tsp each of thyme and oregano, and I used garlic-stuffed olives. A nice and quick side dish...thanks!

This is wonderful and I have made it soo many different ways.  I always omit the nuts as I do not like them.  Omitting the cinnamon, I have made using chocolate with 1 cup choc. chips.  It's probably my family's favorite.  I've also done pumpkin, cranberry, strawberry, pistachio, vanilla, and butterscotch with butterscotch chips.  The only variety I haven't liked has been the pistacio.  Next I'm planning on trying it lemon or Chocolate with peanut butter chips.  This is such a great versitile recipe!

If you love chicken and rice this comes together for a wonderful meal. Delicious! I have to thank Liara for  being so helpful when I e mailed her for some advice in the making. I made as posted - started with two tablespoons of fish sauce - and yes Liara three is good even for the uninitiated! I want to try this with chicken breasts. Thank you Liara for a recipe that will be   used again and again.

I really didn't care for this recipe, however, my sister and her boyfriend loved it.  It came out very dense, which turned me off.  I also didn't think it had much flavor.  I couldn't even eat the leftovers.  I thought this recipe was a goner, until my sister's boyfriend raved about it, so to each his own!
these are rather good, not the best brownies but definitly tasty. They are not bad at all.

I made this for some neighbors who have a family member in the hospital and they really liked it. I myself did not get to try it but they liked it, and it was easy to make and smelled great while cooking.

We had this growing up every year during the holidays. But no one could remember the recipe. I some last week and it made a huge batch, so I took some to a party and it was gone within an hour. Some have said they grew up calling it "snowman poop", I never heard that before.

I really like this recipe.  I have been using something similar to this for years, but this is a little better.  I did add an extra half box of spinach and used an italian blend cheese instead of straight parmesan.  I find parmesan only is too strong for my taste buds so I just sprinkle a little of it on top.  Excellent recipe! Very easy to prepare and always a big hit.

I have been making pie crusts for many years using the standard shortening recipe. We love this one. I used extra light olive oil (no canola) and chilled it before rolling. To keep it from falling apart, I layered it between sheets of overlapped cling wrap. After it was thin, I peeled the top wrap off, turned the pie plate over the crust, and pressed the crust into the pie plate. Then I gently peeled the wrap off and pinched togeter the gaps. Also, I used Healthy Choice flour that has more whole grain in it. Great recipe!
This was easy and excellent. The chocolate part is a dense, rich pudding, not fluffy. I used 1/2 tsp of white vinegar since I didn't have cream of tartar.

We love this!  Made it for second Thanksgiving in a row.  This year I made some changes - used maple syrup instead of the corn syrup and put a tablespoon of bourbon in the sweet potato portion (which I doubled to fit into a 10 inch deep dish pie).  Fantastic!

I made this for Thanksgiving 2006, and the pleasure it gave my 93-year-old grandmother was delightful.
I served it warm, as suggested, and we all enjoyed the flavor and texture of this simple pie.
i enjoyed this, though I did make changes, I used whole eggs and also added more vegetables and lesser cheese. this will be made again in different avatars! thanks!
I made these biscuits as a side to beef stew and they were terrific.  I read some of the reviews and cut down on the salt. Thank you for posting this recipe.

This is a really good and to the point recipe.  I have made six pies already. They were very easy to make and they taste fabulous.  I changed a few things but it was still the same format.  Next time I will be trying it verbatum. Thank you very much for sharing this with us.
Great Recipe. I made it as an appetizer for my Thanksgiving guest and had it with Ritz crackers and it was a total hit. Thanks!

A BIT HIT!!!! This is absolutely fantastic. I made this for Thanksgiving guest and served with different types of gourmet crackers. Everyone kept saying how wonderful this was. Needless to say it went fast. I doubled the ingredients to make twice as much and all the measurements worked fine. I did add a little more cheddar cheese to the dip...just about 2 more TBSP because I love cheese and apparently so does everyone else. This is definitely a keeper. Thanks!
excellent
My kids loved this punch. They are constantly asking me to make more!

This pie was beautiful.  Everyone loved it.  I did have a syrup-type liquid at the bottom of pie.  This may have been from my meringue or something I did wrong.  I will make this again as the pie was delicious and I liked that it was from scratch, not a pudding mix.

I made this for our Thanksgiving luncheon.  I followed the recipe exactly.  My only change was that I warmed it in a 1 1/2 qurat crockpot.  This recipe fit perfectly in it.  I will will use this recipe again.  Thank you for sharing your recipe.
My sister looked up a taco seasoning recipe because I can't stand how salty the seasonings are that you buy at the store. I loved it! We're making it again. Thank you so much!

Great bread, just a bit on the sweet side for me though. That is just a matter of personal taste though.  I think I may cut the sugar back next time and see if I that helps.  I did substitute half of the oil for applesauce and the bread was still quit moist.  I will be giving these as Chritmas gifts and it is SUCH a nice change from the typical banana bread.  :)

Very good soup,thick and hearty.I used leftover chicken breast,so I used canned chicken broth,which was easier.The only thing I changed was to add carrots,which gave it more color.It was delicious,perfect for a cold,snowy night.I served with sourdough bread.

This soup was very good. I added carrots and potato to mine that I had boiled in chicken stock ahead of time. Very creamy, hearty, comforting soup. Next time I will probably cut the Mushroom down a little bit. It seemed like alot for my personal taste. It was pretty easy to make too. Thanks for posting it!
Well, I am surprised these cookies are great! I used chocolate fudge cake mix, added 1/2 teaspoon of vanilla and a handful of chopped walnuts.

I made these today with the help of my 5 yr old. They were so easy and I loved the texture. I tried a different meringue recipe earlier today and they did not hold their shape as well as these did. I added a bit of green food coloring as well as mint extract and then piped them onto a cookie sheet with a large star tip. They looked so pretty and tasted great. I made 50 cookies approximatelt 1 1/2 -2 " in size. I will definately make these again. Thank-you for posting an easy but wonderful recipe.

The lime taste was very strong. I added garam marsala, diced green chilis, a cup more lentils, more salt, black pepper, Louisiana Hot Sauce, a can of stewed tomatoes, and extra diced tomatoes, and served it over jasmine rice.
I've make this recipe for years - everyone loves it.  The only difference is I use a teaspoon of baking powder instead of soda.
Very good muffin recipe, one that could certainly be "added to"...I added 1 cup of raisins & 1/8th cup each of chopped dried apricots & chopped dried apples....very tasty:)

I kept thinking while I was breading the chicken about what a chore it was, but with this recipe, the end result easily justifies the amount of work involved. This chicken is spectacular. It came out fork-tender and perfectly done. The only criticism I have is that the coconut wasn't really browned to my liking by the time the chicken was done, but this was easily remedied by about a minute under the broiler. This dish is easily worth five stars.

I gave this 4 stars but maybe should be giving it 5.  I think it's a great recipe and I just had trouble because of my own inexperience with dough.  My husbands friend helped me with the dough because it was sticky and I had to add a lot of extra flour to make it work right.  I used all purpose flour but no wheat flour.  The pizza turned out really good.  The sauce is so good I think I'll use it for marinara sauce sometime.
A wonderful salsa recipe, which I definitely do not find too hot.
Everyone flipped out they loved it so much!  Followed the recipe exactly and it was perfect, perfect, perfect..Served it with homemade Pita Chips #51116...thank you so much!

I made some small changes. Olive oil instead of canola and apple juice concentrate instead of sugar. It is great! My husband laughs about this mayonnaise being filled with vitamins and minerals. I use this recipe all the time. My son-in-law who claims to hate tofu, devours this. Thanks so much for posting.

Excellent soup!! My hubby is crazy about OG pasta fagioli soup & said he couldn't tell the difference except for the texture of the ground beef. A fine grind might be better. I used a garden vegetable pasta sauce, made it more interesting. I halved the recipe & it was still a good sized pot. However, the pasta turned mushy after several hours. There is not a lot of it, though, so it didn't ruin the whole soup. I would use a slight less bit of tabasco than 3/4 tsp unless you like it really hot. This soup is even better the next day!  Very yummy comfort food !!!

Real good recipe and easy and quick to make. With the sage, it tasted like cornbread stuffing with hot dogs.
I questiond the 2 boxes of Jiffy Mix since mine were only 8 oz each, but it worked out perfectly.

I didn't have any sage in the house so I didn't put it in and this was still good.  I saw this recipe on another website and some people complained it was a little dry. One of the reviewers said they'd added a can of creamed corn and it made it much more moist.  I might try that next time, but we didn't really have issues with the texture.

Was very nice, i made it today and my bf and me liked it very much. I love corndogs but as they usually have to be fried and i try to not do it, when i found this recipe was very glad that was baked instead. I made some variations though, I used polenta meal with baking powder and all-purpouse flour, instead of the cornbread mix. It's already in my favorites and i will make it more, but i guess will use something else like mushrooms instead of celery :).Tnx 4 sharing

These are very good.  I'm not much on plain hamburgers, so these were nice and flavorful.  I made them with ground turkey to deal witht he grease problem that some members had.  I made them according to directions one time with 2-3 times the sauce, and it was good, but the next time I took someone else's advice and mixed everything together.  I ate them on a bun without anything else.  Very good!

Since coming to Recipezaar I've stopped using cake mix for making cakes so I have a stockpile of cake mix and THIS IS JUST THE RECIPE FOR THOSE! These are so yummy, soft, moist and the possiblities are endless. Thank you so much!
Just what I was looking for! This was so simple, I got it right the first time.

I took you advice and tried almonds instead of the pecan halves. It came out fantastic!  So yummy, just the right amount of sweetness, and not overpowered by a cinnamony taste. The amounts of ingredients are  just perfect!
Tnaks for sharing this yummy recipe, Marg!

We've used this recipe for years for kids birthday parties, etc.  We use Hawaiian Punch instead of HC.  We,also, substitute sherbert instead of ice cream, great for lactose intolerant guests or those with milk allergies.

Made this up for the Thanksgiving dessert table this year, but instead of using the glaze I made a sour cream/cream cheese frosting.  It worked out very well and everyone commented on how delicious and moist this cake was.  Will post picture as soon as puter is fixed to accept my camera disc again.  Thank You for a wonderful recipe, definately a keeper.

Garam Masala was essential. It was lacking something without it, I also used fresh jalepenos. I served coriander chutney available on the side as well and I made home made naan to go with it. I also used yellow split peas instead of lentils a little less lime juice and after everything was suatee'd I threw it in the crock pot.
Very tasty crab dip!  I liked the flavor added by the Worcestershire sauce.  It was good cold too.
Holy Cow Wonderful!!!
I find the Evap. milk ( I use no fat skim) whips up much easier if it is very cold. This is similar to the old days of school dinners in UK !

This is a fabulous recipe if you are looking for a change of pace.  The coconut and garlic tastes really played off each other. Here is a suggestion - when you are dipping use a pair of wooden chopsticks, it is a trick I learned from my aunt when she did tempura.
My husband hates buttermilk, but he flipped over this one, I am going to make my second one right now. Thanks, T.Nelson

I tripled this recipe. I used the imitation crab meat as it was $18.00 a pound for crabmeat and you can only buy it by the pound I did not want to spend $36.00 on one ingredient. My daughter tasted it the morning I took it out of the oven and told me, "Mom, they are going to LOVE this."  Sure enough they did. I took it to monthly birthday celbration at 8:00 AM by 8:55 AM it was GONE! People were eating it like it was a cassarole. I didn't even get to taste it! It was fantastic, evidently!!!I a ton of emails asking for the recipe. I followed the recipe to a tee except that I put probably twice as much cheese as the recipe called for.

Fresh tomatoes around here taste like sawdust. the store kind , you know .
So I used a 14oz can of petite diced tomatoes , Green Tabasco for the jalapenos, and 1 tsp dried cilanteo, ( I'm not a big fan ) and bottled lime jucie 
Every one RAVED. Also used it in crockpot burritos Yummy 
Thanks 
Debbie
This was the best cocoa I've ever had. It was very creamy with the perfect amount of chocolate flavor. I tried it with peppermint flavored whipped cream and it just added to the perfection.
This was so good! The recipe was very clear and easy to make! Thanks so much!

I've made this several times and realized I had never reviewed it.  This has quickly become one of my family's favorite soups.  It's super easy to prepare, comes together quickly and has a wonderful flavor.
I, too, had trouble with them being too crumbly when slicing. Otherwise, great flavor, hits all of the chocolate receptors!!
These biscuits are good and taste similar to KFC, however next time I'll cut back on the salt to 1/2 teaspoon because they were almost too salty. Thanks for the recipe!

I used a 1 lb. frozen organic hash brown mix from my freezer and halved the rest of the ingredients.  I chose this recipe because I had everything available on my kitchen shelf and was low fat to boot.  I allowed my hashed browns to defrost quite a bit before cooking, used a small casserole dish, substituted cayenne pepper powder for red pepper, and cooked for recommended length of time.  This made the top nice and brown, and under layers soft.  Served with extra hot sauce, yum!  Easy, quick, and healthful!
Wow! I had a dinner party for parents and the in-laws.  What a hit with the father-in-law.  Great recipe and easy to prepare

I absolutely *loved* this cucumber soup recipe.  Made it for guests awhile ago, and doubled it easily with no problems.  (It was still TOTALLY gone after just 2 days!)  I used a couple of green onions for the onion in the recipe and it was really good!  I plan to make this again really soon.  Thanks!!!

my Angel is allergic to peanut butter but LOVES cookies... and i LOVE peanut butter cookies but could never have any in the house dause I didn't want her tempted. I ran across this recipe and decided to try it with the soy butter that Walmart sells in the peanut butter aisle. Oh, this will DEFINITELY be be a favorite! Beautiful pb cookies, just like I remember! Next time I will try it with splenda, so my dad can try some too!

These cookies are so good I've made them twice since I found the recipe last week. It took about 11 minutes for them to set and start to brown. The second batch didn't stay soft for quite as long but they were still VERY good!

Wonderful recipe. So far I have made some chocolate cookies with a chocolate cake mix, chocolate chips and chopped pecans and yesterday I made some 'lemon poppy seed' cookies with a lemon cake mix, grated lemon rind, and poppy seeds. I am so glad you posted this recipe. I have a newspaper clipping of this recipe from Norma Bidwell's column in The Hamilton Spectator, 2005. Norma offered any two of the following additions to these yummy cookies; 6 ounces chocolate chips, butterscotch chips, or peanut butter chips; 1/2 cup coconut, any variety; 1/2 cup raisins; 1 cup toffee chips; or 1 cup chopped nuts. My DH's favorite is a chocolate cake mix with chocolate chips and chopped walnuts added. They taste almost like 'brownie' cookies. Yum. Thanks for posting.
I made this for friends and it was a huge hit.  I used fresh crushed garlic and grated my own parmesan.  I highly recommend this one.
Had lost our family recipe and find this one to be as good or better.  Thank you!

This is a great recipe, but I did alter it somewhat.  First off, I took the advice of other reviewers and turned down the temp (350 and then reduced to 325 for the second baking).  Also, I chilled the dough before baking, as it made it easier to shape it. I also added slivered almonds and dried cranberries and instead of putting the white chocolate in the dough, I melted it and drizzled it on after baking and cooling. I put these in jars and intend to give them away as Christmas presents.  Thanks for an easy and great recipe!

I made this for a holiday party and it was okay -- most of it got eaten but nobody was raving about it.  I would make it again but "tweak" it a little bit.  It was not as creamy as I like my dip so I might add more sour cream ...
I can't really comment too much since I'm a vegetarian but my husband and my guests LOVED this and couldn't get enough.  I didn't  arrange the onions and garlic around he chicken, though. :)  Thanks!

The tasete is FAB.  I skipped the almonds because my father is allergic ("Merry Christmas! Anaphalaxis). The recipe does not specify how much anisette is used, or even include it in the ingredient list, but it is called for in the instructions.  To be honest, I didn't really care, I used a tsp. of Whisky and called it a day.  I recommend dividing the dough into two flattish loafs since mine didn't cook all the way through and it was in the oven for a little over half an hour.
I will definitely make these delights again to refine my technique.  I think they will be a classic when I get it right for me.

Woweeee!!! I used Penzys shallot pepper for the salt & pepper, but otherwise followed your directions.  What a great quick recipe for those nights you dont have much time to cook, but dont want anything boring.   Its also great for all the days in between. Thank you!

Mmmm...  Just made this as posted subbing corn oil for canola (all I had) and Splenda and a few drops of honey in place of sugar.  Really good for a healthy substitute for mayo.  Plain it tastes like mayo w/ a little mustard.  I mixed it in some canned salmon and it is delicious!
Thanks for sharing!!!   :)
Update:  Made again with olive oil, added some dill pickle juice, used regular mustard, brown spicy mustard, and dijon mustard equal parts.  Used Splenda and honey in place of sugar and ground in black pepper - Tastes like delicious Honey Mustard Dressing!  Still great on sandwich with spinach or lettuce!
Very easy and fast to make.  I used a chocolate cake mix and some pink and white mint chips.  Thank you for posting this recipe.
Such a delicious snack for any occasion. I started making this in 6th grade and my family has been loving it ever since. I usually use Corn Chex, but I will be trying Crispix for a switch up.

This is Delicious and really good!  Only thing I did different was to use 2 6oz. cans pink crabmeat, no lemon juice, milk, or cheddar(don't like it).  I sprinkled top with Old Bay.  This tastes good even cold!!!

My sisters went nuts over this recipe! I adjusted the cheeses using 1 cup parmesan and 1 cup cheddar cheese. Also used low-fat cream cheese and it tasted great! Didn't have any fresh garlic left so I substituted about 1 teaspoon garlic powder. Cheesy, thick and perfect on tortillas!

We enjoyed this dolmades recipe even though I didn't serve it with the yogurt sauce but with avgolemono sauce instead. Greek or Turkish, we didn't care as long as the dish tasted good, and it did! Thanks for sharing!

I made this yesterday to take to Christmas Eve dinner at my in-laws.  It was really good and everyone really liked it.  I followed the directions exactly except I used 2 cans of lump crab meat and didn't have any dry or even dejon mustard, so I subbed a squirt of yellow mustard.  I probably used quarter cup of cheese in the dip and another 1/2 cup on top.  I took a bag of pita chips to dip and kept going back for more!  I am going to make this again for my new years eve party!  Thanks for great recipe!
I made this as an appetizer for Christmas Eve and it was a hit.  Very tasty and I'm glad I doubled it because I now have leftovers for me to nibble on!  Thanks!
Served this for Christmas and everyone love it - Thanks!
This was made for our Christmas appetizer buffet and was well received.  The flavor was fantastic but was a little on the dry side.  All in all a very good dip.  Thanks for sharing.

This was great!  I made this as an appetizer for Christmas and got a comment from almost every family member.  I followed the recipe as is, except I forgot the garlic (oops!) and added in 1 1/2 cup mozzarella/sundried tomato blend both in the dip and on top.  Even my husband that swears he doesn't like SpinDip had two servings!!

This opulent dip was well received for a Christmas day dip.  I tasted another version of this which, I do not believe, had garlic in it.  Garlic kicks this up and makes it special, though the blend of flavors is spectacular.

It's good with rye crackers/bread but also very good with raw veggies.

I made this for Christmas Eve. I had never eaten Spinach Artichoke dip before. I thought it tasted pretty good, but my Mom and sister, who both have eaten it out before and love it, said mine tasted better than the restaurant because it wasn't so salty. I tried it with potato chips, though, and found that combination extremely salty.

Thanks Angel for posting this absolutely great recipe.  I have made this particular recipe for years. They are the most tender and yummy peanut butter cookies I have tried.  Before I came across these  on the Crisco can, my PB cookies were good but always a little tough.  But not these.  They are dropped and not rolled, then crisscrossed.  The dropping keeps them tender. If you like PB cookies, try them.  You won't be disappointed.

I just made these, was a bit worried because I didn't have butter or shortning.  I used vegetable oil......forgot the sugar, but they turned out great! Very easy to make, I didn't even have to get my hands gooey since I used oil....just mixed with a spoon and dropped them on the baking sheet!  Will make more tomorrow and remember the sugar!

I made this with Marinated Grilled Leg of Lamb Recipe #73842 for Christmas dinner and it was delicious.  I have only ever made squash with brown sugar so I thought this would be a nice change.  I used salted butter and still added a little bit of salt at the table (personal preference). Very nice mild maple syrup flavor.  I also did not have any nutmeg so that was omitted and it wasn't missed.  Will make this again.
These are SOO simple and versatile.  My favorite combo so far is orange cake mix with white chips (Creamsicle!) but I also thought that the funfetti cake mix worked well as did the butter pecan.

Good recipe!! I substituted bulghur for the rice, celery leaves for the parsley, and added a carrot. The sunflower seeds really made a difference. The sauce might be better with tomato sauce, but other than that - wonderful!
My mother and I would shop at Famous when I was young, and no trip was complete without having lunch, talk about a memory in a bowl!
Found the vegetables overpowering and could not taste the potato. They made it too crunchy. Also thought that there was way too much dressing and it seemed to drown the salad.

I unfortunately couldn't get enthused about this alfredo sauce despite its numerous wonderful reviews. This alfredo is too heavy and stodgy for my tastes which is probably due to the huge amount of butter in this recipe. The recipe I am used to uses the same amount of cream but only a couple of tablespoons of butter and a third of the cheese. It just didn't have that lightness that makes a nice creamy alfredo perfect for me :(.

I usually mix a packet of the Good Season's dressing mix in with 1 pound of ground beef + 1 pound of ground pork sausage for my meatballs or Italian meatloaf but I was out today, the horror! So I whipped this up using garlic powder instead of garlic salt, added 2 tablespoons of this to the meat and it was fantastic. I don't have to worry about buying the packets anymore. Thank you so much!

Everybody Loved this!  Make sure it is really warm though. I didn't get any until it was cold and I wondered what everybody was raving about (until I warmed it back up!) I will always use this recipe! It was so easy to make.

Tonight was the first time I made an alfredo sauce. I forgot to warm and melt the butter, so I put them in a sauce pan over very-low heat and then whisked the parm, salt and pepper in, and then still whisking, heated it for a few minutes over low/med heat. OMG, it was WONDERFUL! Thank you for posting this!

Just the recipe I was looking for, thank you so much. This is the exact recipe that I used to make with my grandma and sister. We always put the coconut on top and didn't have much trouble with them falling apart.

This recipe was wonderful! I cooked it for a group of people, and everyone loved it. I simplified it by using a pre-made spaghetti sauce rather thatn making my own with the tomato sause, oregano, etc. Therefore, that made the recipe so easy that I will continue to cook this for a long time.

The other day I went to get in my car.  Lo and behold there was a baggie on the hood of my car filled with some bakery.  So, I took the baggie off the hood and got in my car.  Needless to say, when I was driving I devoured all of the bars. They were phenominal! I knew they had to be from my neighbor, so when I got home, I ran like a wild woman to her house.  "What were those bars that you left me?" I begged.  She said, "Seven Layer Magic Bars!  If you want the recipe, I can get it from my friend."  I thanked her, but refused, because I knew that one quick trip to Recipezaar and I would have the recipe.  And I was right!  They are so good that I'm afraid to make any more, because I'm trying desperately to loose weight, and with these in the house, my will power will be gone!  If you haven't tried these, you are really missing out on a taste sensation--as Tony the Tiger would say...."THEY'RE GREAT!"

I had printed this recipe for Christmas eve and then couldn't find it when the time came to prepare it so I ended up using a plain hot artichoke dip recipe from a cookbook. I liked it but I knew this would be better. Boy was I right. I took it to a family celebration yesterday and they were scraping the sides of the dish for the last little bits. It wasn't as tangy as some artichoke dips and I really like that. It's easily the best artichike dip that I have ever tasted. Thanks Juli.
Something about this dip just didn't work for us.  It lacked a bit on flavor and was too sour/tangy.  I'd have to tweak it a bit to suit our tastes.  It went largely untouched at our last gathering.
Hubby & his best friend both go nuts when I make this.  Thanks for the great recipe!
The only problem I have with this recipe is that I can't stop eating it.
yummy & simple! thanks!
I cheated and used frozen cubed potatoes and the same spices and they were really tasty. Thanks for sharing this recipe.  I will make them again.
This is the best I have tasted yet and very good when you use habinero peppers too!!
One word:  Scrumptious!  Glad you found your long lost recipe - it's very, very good!  Thanks for sharing!

Delicous and easy. I did make a few changes to use what I had on hand: I subbed Italian blend cheese (parmesan, asagio, etc) for the parmesan, used 1/2 garlic cream cheese with 1/2 regular and then subbed 1/4 tsp garlic powder for the fresh minced garlic. Served it with an assortment of crackers and some tortilla chips. It was a big hit with my family. It looked like a really big batch at first, but the 3 of us devoured over half of it while dinner was cooking. I think it will also be good spread on bagels for breakfast. A definate keeper. Thanks for sharing.

I made this dip for New Year's Eve.  Added some old bay, onion powder, pepper, and extra worcestershire sauce to give it a little punch.  I used about 3/4 lb. of fresh backfin crabmeat.

I didn't like it hot!  Right out of the oven, it seemed bland.  HOWEVER, after sitting in the refrigerator overnight, I decided to spread it on club crackers just because I didn't want to waste it.  Oh how wonderful it is as a cold spread!!!   I ate the whole thing in two days time!!  Who knows, maybe slightly heating it at this point, with the flavors all mingled, it might be good hot.  I will remember this as a wonderful cold spread!

Everyone loved these cookies! I have made other peanut butter cookies, but none as good as these. They are just the right texture and the peanut butter taste is just right. My neighbor is bugging me for more and so is my grandaughter. Big hit on my cookie tray! Thank you!
These were soft and falling apart, didn't taste as good as tater tots.
This is awesome....my hubby would give it 10 stars if he could.  Can't wait to take this to a potluck. Quick and Easy! Thanks!

This was a very good garlic bread recipe, but my family felt the thyme and marjoram was too strong.  I might decrease the quantity on those two herbs next time around.  I liked the addition of paprika, as it gave it a nice kick.

I had just about a cup of buttermilk left from making corn bread for New Years Day, so I did an ingredient search for buttermilk and this was the winner.  

Very yummy.  I did not have a pie shell on hand, so I used some phyllo dough to make a pie crust and it made a very nice and light dessert.  

My husband and I are trying to decide what it reminded us of...something from our childhoods, perhaps?

I did decrease sugar to 1 cup as well.  

Great recipe.  Thanks!
I just recently made the sauce for my own homemade meatballs and my husband couldn't get enough of it. Thanx for posting it.

I'm so happy to have found this soup!  I happily used 2 T of garlic chili sauce - I like my lips to be a little numb when I finish my Hot and Sour Soup!  I only used 1 egg and didn't have any dried black fungus.  I also used about 8 oz of tofu and that was plenty for us.  My husband and son were so impressed, they figured the local Chinese restaurant could use me for a chef. Thanks for posting!
I just made this recipe and it is absolutely wonderful.  I substituted grape juice for the red wine but left everything else the same.  Wow!
taste's just like the seasoning we buy at the store.
Everyone wanted the recipe for this punch. Thanks!
I made this for Christmas and it wsa a hit.  Thanks!

It took me some time to get the yeast and kneading part down, im new with backing and dough making, but it turned out great.
The second time i made it i played around some more and slightly spiced up the dough while kneaning it using oregeno and garlic powder. The oregeno worked good but I couldn't really tell about the garlic powder

I made this for an after-church lunch for about 20 people.. it turned out great!  Especially delicious after fridging it for the night before. I used a bit more cilantro (we love it), and ended up adding a can of tomatoes to my fresh ones b/c the fresh tomatoes here lack color.  Mmm!
Delicious! DH loves these. He took them to work and everyone loved them too!

I grew up loving my Grandmother's Chocolate cream pie. I never thought I could ever make one as good as hers. Well, this is IT! This easy to follow recipe and well balance ingedents make this a keeper! Thanks Carole Reu

Very good.  Dense and moist.  SO good right out of the oven with real butter. I did omit the lemon and almonds - only because I didn't have them but otherwise I followed the recipe exactly.  Will definately make again.  Thank you so much.

Yum! I have never had Spinach Artichoke Dip, but it sounded so good, so I tried it and I loved it!! I substituted plain yogurt for the sour cream and it was perfect! I also used garlic powder instead of fresh garlic. Excellent! Thanks!
Easy and delicious...thanks!

I made this tonight for dinner.  Halved it for the two of us.  I did make one change- instead of putting the bacon inside the chicken, I wrapped it around the outside.  I really enjoyed it, as did dh.  Thanks for sharing!
Served it for new year's party. Refreshing and delicious, everyone enjoyed it.

Being the queen of 'use what you have', I modified this recipe a bit.  Added about 2T. prepackaged REAL bacon bits to the 1 1/2 slices of bacon I had, used 3 potatoes, 4 c. milk, 2 c. turkey broth I had laying around.  Was out of onion, so used the last of my onion powder and a packet of onion soup mix.  Omitted the red pepper and thyme.  Browned 1 lb cut up pork tenderloin in 2 T. italian dressing and added that at the beginning so it would finish cooking with the rest of the ingred.  Very yummy and easily adapted for people like me! lol :)

We really enjoyed this pie. Really simple to make and mighty tasty. I made the chili the day before using more hamburger meat and beans and adding a small can of tomato paste and a small can of tomato sauce along with the rest of the ingredients this recipe called for. Then the next day using the lefted over chili and adding corn and the topping for the pie. Turned out GREAT! I made Recipe #110416 and Recipe #190454 to have with this recipe. Wonderful dinner on a cold snowy evening. Thanks for the recipe! :)
HOLY COW - what a great dish.  This was soo flavourful and filling.  Awesome dish on its own or as a side... Great Recipe
Fabulous!  I doubled the recipe but stuck with one stick of butter.  I added crab meat and shrip for a seafood alfredo and it was a big hit with all!

Crusty and hearty bread that's tender inside. Loved the whole wheat with the addition of cornmeal. Not much flavor from the small amount of sage. Used butter rather than shortening, otherwise followed the recipe exactly. I wavered between four and five stars on this one, but have a new Zo bread machine and am giving the recipe the benefit of the doubt. Due to the size of my bread machine pan, I'd probably double the recipe next time. Also wondered if the yeast should be increased. Definitely worth a go, and I'd make it again.

I increased the flour & sugar just a little based on several other recipes I'd read - but mainly followed this one due to the chocolate chips, and I really think they make the difference (along with the higher amount of cocoa as compared to other recipes).  This was excellent warm with a smidge of ice cream and excellent at room temp with a glass of milk.  I also like the addition of butter instead of oil - adds a bit of nice flavor, I think. (I think this took about 10 minutes of prep though - very easy to put together!)
This was great. I screwed up and added to much water. I didn't have Cajun seasoning so used poultry spice blend and lemon pepper. Obviously not enough lemon pepper but still was good.
This was good.  I think that it kind of lacked something but I can't really put my finger on that that "something" is.  Was a quick fix for needing a starch for my dinner.  Thanks for a great recipe!
I brought this to a party and everyone loved it and I even got some requests for the recipe! I used garlic powder instead of minced as I didn't have any. It worked perfect.Thanks!

This was excellent.  Wonderful flavor.  Perfect texture.  I cut the recipe in half but otherwise followed it exactly (using the option to cut the sprouts in half).  I was also fortunate enough to have fresh brussels sprouts from the farmers market.  The wine vinegar I have is probably not the best.  It would probably be even better with a better quality vinegar.  I might even try it with balsamic....

I decreased the quick coooking oats to 1/2 cup, used 1/2 cup peanut butter, and used a teaspoon of baking soda.  Just wanted to make sure that the bar wasn't dry with too much of the oats in the recipe.  We loved them!  Excellent!

Just took two loaves out of the oven. The recipe made 2 regular bread pans and rose to just under the top edges. Baking time to reach the toothpick test was way longer then recipe time; more like an hour at 300 in stoneware pans on top of a oven stone; bottom shelf. Turned out to cool and the first slice was warm,crunchy and full of coconut. This is a recipe (if you like coconut) everyone should have handy. I toasted the walnuts and they cut the sweetness of the coconut so I recommend nuts be added for total perfection.

Make sure you chop the onions and celery really fine.

Thanks!
Such an easy recipe that turned out beautifully... Thanks Ed, everyone loved them!

Oh my goodness! I made myself sick last night. Didn't even wait to get a picture as I could smell heaven radiating from the oven. DH didn't care for it, but he isn't a chocoholic like me. Thank you, thank you, thank you!!!
Great Dip! My 2 year old and husband love this stuff! It can also be thrown together in the crockpot on high heat for about 1 hour or until warmed through.

I have never had this soup at Olive Garden, but I can say that this recipe is very good! I made the full recipe and exactly as written. I gave some large bowls of it to 3 different neighbors and still have leftovers for my lunches this week. One neighbor asked for the recipe. The next time I make it though, I will cut the pepper way down or none at all. It was pretty darn spicey, so it didn't appeal to many of the small kids. I had to cook it longer than stated to get the veggies done enough for my taste, so next time I will add the macaroni much later, as suggested by other reviewers. Thank you for a delicious soup recipe!
What a great recipe!  Plus...I had everything I needed on hand.  I didn't sub anything.  Made the recipe just as written.  I will be making this a lot at our house!  Thanks for sharing. :)

Just what I was looking for. So easy! I made this with a creamy honey dijon dressing and Ritz cracker type crackers as it was all that I had on hand. The chicken was tender on the inside and crispy on the outside. Delicious! will try it with other salad dressing/cracker combinations.

The 5 stars are with my changes. I have been very uncertain as to how to review this recipe because in making it diabetic friendly I changed it a lot. The date amount was dropped to between 2 and 3 ozs and they were not boiled but chopped and added. The cola became Diet Cherry Vanilla Coke and it was used cold. The brown sugar became 1/3 cup of Splenda.The extracts were 1/2 tsp each of vanilla and cherry and I skipped the nuts. Even with these changes it's wonderful in flavor and light and very tender inside. I will use an 8x4" pan next time I make this as it didn't get very high in the 9x5 I used. I find it plenty sweet enough with the drastic cut in the dates and sugar. I don't even want to imagine how sweet it would be in the original form. This is easy to put together and bakes up a to a very nice color. My DH came following his nose for the second time today asking what was baking.

These are my firs muffins and I loved them! Instead of the buttermilk I used cherry flavored LifeWay Kefir, I had an instant oatmeal, added about 3 teaspoons of pure vanilla extract and used unbleached flour. Also I used clarified butter instead of the shortening. I baked them in the mini-muffin pan and now I have plenty of tiny, delicious muffins for my babies and us! Thank you!

This was good though it was much 'flatter' cornbread than I've had before and the texture was unusual, almost chewy. I think both were probably due to the flour being 1 Tbsp instead of my usual 1 cup, I think. We served it with Ham & Beans #42431 (and then dh had the leftover bread in a big bowl with more buttermilk - his favorite treat). Thanks for posting!

My husband was put on a low fat diet by his doctor. I was wondering how I was going to make low fat treats for him when I came across this recipe. I knew at once that I could tweak it to fit our needs.I made these using yellow cake mix, substituted applesauce for the oil and sprinkled them with cinnamon sugar. They came out so soft and yummy and smelled so good while baking. My family absolutely loved them and DH declared them to be even better than the usual applesauce cookies I make. I then tried a lemon cake mix, followed the recipe, and dusted them with powdered sugar. DIVINE! My MIL and I liked them a great deal but DH's grandma fell in love with them! Thank you for this recipe. It's a keeper!

This is a great tea cookie.  I did add 1/2 cup of pecans for a little crunch.  Wonderful.
Easy to make and a great way to add
blueberries to a snack.
I also added a few grates of fresh nutmeg.

Delicious!  I was reluctant to make these as I am not much of a peanut butter fan, but my son insisted.  I'm glad he did, because these were wonderful.  The bars have a chewy "crust" that mixes well with the melted chocolate chips and vanilla glaze.  It is an easy recipe.  I mixed everything by hand (with a wooden spoon) and had no trouble with lumps etc. I did not have crunchy style peanut butter, so I used creamy peanut butter instead.  Next time (and there will be a next time!) I'll make sure to have crunchy peanut butter. One note about the glaze: it seemed like it was too "runny", so I added a few tablespoons of confectioner's sugar.  
Thanks foxysnana.
Thanks, Tonkcats. This has been a Watson favorite for many years. Thanks for sharing with us.
delicious meatballs!  I served them with recipe #38164 (Chinese green beans and recipe #141737 (Simple Chinese Noodles)  Wonderful combination!
Added these to groentesoep -- excellent. Thanks!

I used this recipe for years and it was always popular. I lost it in one of our moves and was so glad to see it on Recipe Zaar.  Thanks so much.
Kathy in Naples, FL
The recipe didn't turn out good for me.I just used the topping on top of my chili,so maybe that made a difference.It seemed to need a thicked and more firm texture.

I'm not a sweet tooth so I choose to make a few savoury muffins today. The only thing I changed was I put tandoori curry powder instead of paste and I used substitute egg replacer.  The muffins taste was quite unusual but very yummy.  Thank you Alma.
The sweetness of the roasted peppers nicely balances the saltiness of the feta.  I didn't even need to add the sugar.

I have an Indian friend who made this dish for my family.  This recipe tastes almost like it, but I think some of the proportions for the spices is off.  I definitely think it calls for too much saffron (my rice was too yellow).  I think it should be just a pinch.  I will definitely try it again, but will probably tweak it!

I have used basically this same recipe for years except mine is made with self rising flour.  I am glad to get the starter recipe as I didn't have it.  I have made lots of variations and usually make them as muffins.  I take muffins to let people know that I am thinking of them.  I usually make several batches and keep some in the freezer so they are handy if I need them.  My family loves them for breakfast or a quick snack.  Some of the variations have been lemon (omit cinnamon and use lemon pudding), peanut butter (add 1 cup of peanut butter cut in the dry ingredients and omit cinnamon),etc.  It also makes a great bundt cake that is like a coffee cake.  It says that you can't put it in the fridge, but I keep bags of the starter in the bottom of my refrigerator so that I can bake when I want - just bring them out for a day ( or at least to room temperature) Everyone loves this recipe and looks forward to a plate.
Everyone in my family loved this!  It was a nice update and more grown up version of the traditional 5 cup salad.  Wonderful!!!!

Very delicious! I felt like I was at a Greek/Italian resturant. It was so easy to put together & fast, too, even with the marinating. I cut the recipe in half for 2 people & used Mrs Dash garlic/herb seas instead of lemon pepper. I am watching my calorie intake so I  cut the dressing into 1/4-believe me, it's enough for 2 wraps. I also used whole wheat tortillas & left out the lettuce. I cooked the chicken on the stovetop, too. Very filling; thank you for sharing!

I've been making whipped cream for a number of years now, but I've never made one quite this delicious!  The lemon rind and lemon juice really sets this whipped cream above the rest!  This would be excellent served with any dessert you would normally use whipped cream.  I will love using this over my special Belgian Waffles!  Thank you, Carole Reu!  I love this!
Fantastic cookies!  Easy to make and sooo satisfying!  Thanks!

Very good !! I didn't have chili  paste so used 2 large cloves of garlic and a heaping 1/2 tsp. of Italian pepper seeds. That was just the right amount of heat for us. 1 rounded Tbsp. of cornstarch was perfect. Did use about 1/2 tsp. of pepper but will omit it next time. The bite was harsh. I will also omit the egg. I don't believe it adds to the flavor and the broth would be much more appealing to the eye without it. Did garnish with chopped Cilantro. It added a nice flavor and additional color.

I followed the recipe almost exactly except, I replaced chopped apples inplace of the bananas. I also added a few spoonfuls of yogurt to replace the moisture the bananas would have added to the batter. Added pecans too...The bread turned out excellant. I just got my first loaf pan and couldn't wait to use it. I'm glad I used this recipe!! The flavor was soo wonderful, and I can't wait to have the bread for breakfast! Next time, I will try it with bananas!!
I should have rated this ages ago. I have made them countless times and I just love them!!
These muffins are really good.  I used buckwheat honey for the honey it called for and they tasted great.

I am a Biscuit lover....No really I am!!  I ONLY get the biscuits when I go to KFC!  These are SO delicious, and easy! 
I made a defferent recipe the other night, and they were awful!!  My family were afraid to try these...but gobbled them all up!  Next time I will probably roll them out a little thicker than 1/2", and I will put a drizzle of butter on top!!  Excellent!!

I haven't tried this particular recipe, but I have been making an ice cream with almost identical ingredients for years.  It's the most delicious thing in the world, and we guard the recipe jealously.  People love it and can never quite figure out what's in it.  Better than anything you can buy anywhere!
These came out perfect. I served them with mock devonshire cream and raspberry jam.  I didn't use the raisons, but next time I will try with almond slivers.

Um, amazing!  I felt like I was eating a brownie when I bit into a slice of this. If I had any will-power whatsoever, I would make this every week, but than I wouldn't eat anything else! One of my new favorite recipes for sure!  Great with vanilla ice cream too. :)
I love this dip...it's dangerous for me to make it, as I could eat it all night long!

Made this as an appetizer for Thanksgiving dinner, and everyone loved it.  Like others said, just as good as some restaurants' recipes.  Easy to put together, then just throw in oven. Will be making this again, thanks!
Recipe is not difficult.  (Just add water!) This is a great starting point for something creative.  Succotash version was well received.  I didn't see an oil temp listed, but found 375 F to be ideal.

This was really good.  I, too, used sherry, and I think it gave it a nice nutty flavor.  This is a recipe I could assemble ahead of time and make in the RV, where crockpotting is so handy!  Thanks for posting!

GREAT! Making fresh alfredo is so easy I do not know why anyone would by box mix. This was PERFECT and I will now add heavy cream to my shopping list like milk, and ceral because I want to be able to make this at a drop of a hat

Excellent recipe. This is the first time I have attempted to make enchiladas and they turned out wonderfully! My entire family devoured them. I doubled the recipe and froze half for later and also used shredded chicken. I would suggest to set out all ingredients before you start. I was a bit unorganized and it took much longer.

This is a real winner! Easy to prepare and tastes like a chowder should.  I took note of the suggestion to use olive oil and added just a little cream to the skimmed milk I used instead of whole milk. My husband gives it a thumbs up.

This is a fabulous recipe!   I didn't have caramel color, but it really was a rich color on its own.  I did add about 1/2 tsp of nutmeg to it (which I have used from other recipes).   I also deleted the salt, as I found there to be enough of a salty taste on its own (just right!)
A rich and wonderful soup that makes my mouth water at the thought of it!

First of all, this recipe needs some clarification.  It lists "zest of one orange" when I believe it is supposed to be "juice" of one orange.  I prepared the zest of one orange - which is the finely grated peel, and added it as the recipe called for in #2 of the instructions.  Then I noticed it mentioned juice in line #3 which made sense because after adding the dry ingredients the batter was much thicker than a cupcake batter should be.  I then added the juice from the orange I used for zest.  I don't think it affected the end product much though and it had a very nice orange flavor.  Incidentally, one batch equalled 12 cupcakes for me.  I will probably try again using juice instead of zest and most likely double the recipe.
No, there is an elephant in the way.
This was a great recipe..so easy and very moist..Thanks

These were just so moist and chewy.
My husband just loved these, and I am not real fond of peanut butter cookies but these are fantastic. I used margerine instead of shortning.

I've never made stuffed peppers before and had a bag of peppers in my fridge that I needed to use before they went bad. This recipe was extremely easy and quick and full of wonderful flavor. I passed them out to extended family and they loved them too.

This was really great -- and easy to make.  I pretty much did it all in my food processor.  I only used one jalapeno -- and at first thought it was going to be too hot.  But after about 24 hours in the refrigerator, it was just perfect.  I made it for a party at my son's house last weekend and it was a big hit.  Now my husband has requested that I make it again this weekend.  Great flavor -- but DON'T omit the cilantro.  It's a must.

I've been making pizzas for a long time, but I'd never found a recipe as good as this one!  The pizza sauce is easy to make and delicious.  First of all, I use a bread machine, so it's not much work.  I also put some ground flax seed in with the flour which makes it a freckled dough, and that works fine.  I have been using about 1.5 pounds of mozarella for the pizzas that this one recipe makes.  I have one pretty large pizza pan for 1 pizza, then use the rest of the dough to make 2 small pizzas on a cookie sheet.  I've frozen some of the large ones, and they take 30-35 minutes to cook, straight out of the freezer.  We have a small pizzaria in town that is one of the best in the state, but I prefer this pizza to theirs, and so does my family.  I am so grateful that this recipe was shared!
Great, cheap and easy to make.
brilliant  just made them, best i have tried

I have never heard of Famous Barr's but This is awesome soup, I halved the recipe, and I wish I didnt, I should have made the whole thing and frozen half.  I think the thing that makes this recipe work is cooking the onions for an hour and a half, the smell in my kitchen !!!!!! excellent recipe Bill,and easy to make. thanks
This didn't really tempt me at first, but I decided ti give it a try, and it was wonderful! I highly recommend it! I added feta cheese, though. How can you have a Greek salad with no feta?!

We've made this two days in a row, it's so good~! There's not that many ingredients but it tastes even better than the longer ones. We've had it with everything from eggs, rice, to cooked spinach. Looking forward to making it again tomorrow. Thanks for sharing :)

I made this for a Superbowl munchie and it was fabulous.  The only change I made to the recipe was that I used a little more garlic, three cloves to be exact.  I was afraid that the recipe didn't call for enough spinach, but one box was plenty.  Thanks, Juli.  I'll definitely make it again and again.

I was looking for a recipe to use leftover buttermilk, and this is IT!!!  I baked this tonight, and it is VERY GOOD!  I made open egg salad sandwiches using this recipe, and my husband wants to have it again tomorrow night.  THANK YOU!!
This was great..made it for a super bowl party and most thought it was super..sorry no pun..just make sure you make enough for all to have seconds..Thanks

Marg-  AWESOME, DELECTABLE, as DS said, "best bread I have made in forever!" So if I could give you 10+ stars I would.
The house smells wonderful and homey and the taste just quietly explodes in your mouth as you taste all the flavors and the textures. I cut the sugar to 1 1/3 cups for dietary reasons and it came out fabulous.  All else was followed as you wrote.  I cooked for 95 minutes at 325, (time probably increased due to the -25 degrees outside) The tops were crunchy and the inside was moist and delicious.  
I can go on and on.  Everyone should try this.  It is a keeper and will be a regular from now on!

A very tasty steak and gravy recipe. We loved the gravy. I didn't have any bock beer (a lager beer) so I used canned chicken broth. You could turn the gravy portion of this recipe into a creamy homemade gravy recipe with different flavorings such as beef or chicken soup base mix added to the flour. I served it with buttered carrots and mashed potatoes, made with butter and cream and kosher salt, and whipped until creamy in my KitchenAid mixer(preheat the bowl with hot water before adding the cooked potatoes). Yum.

All I can say is YUM!!  I made the whole recipe, the family and sis-in-law ate some for lunch and I froze the rest. It is great for lunches that you can heat up. I take bread and cheese on the side to stick in after I microwave it!!  Thanks Bill.

This is my favorite!  I've made it many times and everyone loves it.  It really is better than any restaurant!  Once, I topped it with blackened chicken (recipe #113835) and it was so good!  Made it with shrimp fettucini and not a drop was left!

I have to say sorry I didnt like it. I made it exactly as is. It tasted great before it went into the oven but to me the texture of it after it came out was horrible. I will make it again but I will skip baking it.

I loved it although I made several changes. I sauted onions and garlic with the vegs. then made the white sauce and combined them. I also put a pinch of cayenne in for extra zip.
The measurements are confusing and difficult to increase the servings for a family. I tripled it but used only 2 egg yolks and 4 TBS of whipping cream (bty double cream not available in US closest thing with that high of fat content is heavy whipping cream).  Over all, I will make it again. My son wants me to throw in some shrimp!!!
These were delicious.  We used toasted pecans and whole wheat flour.  These flew out of the pan!
Did anyone notice the ingredient list calls for baking soda but the directions refer to baking powder? I  wonder what difference anyone has noted.
I do not care for Ramen Noodles, but when I saw this recipe I had to try it. This was great! It was quick and easy. Tastes great!

This is wonderful.  I remember fried cornbread from my childhood and despaired of ever tasting it again.  My husband who is part Swede and Northerner to boot had never tasted it before and loved it.  Thanks

This is a great Trifle, and the recipe allows for substitutions of different berries, or combinations.
Thanks for posting!

YUM! This is a nice recipe for scones; one that I will always use! I actually substituted buttermilk for the heavy cream, and they came out super moist and fluffy. I also used dried blueberries, and whole wheat flour to make them healthier!  I'm looking forward to enjoying these for breakfast with a nice hot cuppa joe!! Thanks!!!

I made muffins out of this today. Don't :) Mine came out really soft inside and the top was crunchy. I loved them, my family didn't. Next time I make I will do the bread pan and do something to the zucchini to not make it so visible. My 6 year wouldn't eat them because they had green things in them. :P

This is a very good apple salad recipe. I'm so glad I tried it. I make the 4 servings and keep it the refigerator for snacks. It keeps really well for a few days. The combination of flavours is really nice. Thanks so much for sharing this recipe.

Really tasty and very easy to make.
Served with boiled rice and thought it complimented well. All my housemates loved it.
Improvised slightly on the amount of ingredients as I was serving five and didnt think the amounts really correlated with a greater number. Also mixed together a couple of the steps listed.
Couple of additions I made - after melting the butter I put a spoonful of garlic in and before adding the milk I put a dash of sherry in. Also didn't use canned pimiento as I couldn't find it in my loca store.
Overall amazing receipe, will use again.
This was really good, but made way more than I was prepared for.  I've given some away to everyone who comes to my house.

I work at a nursing home and do the activities one thing we do is try new recipes.  The residents love these funnel cakes and look forward to when we mix up and cook a batch.  We are going to try making the dough red and make them heart shaped for Valentines Day  We put them in a zip lock bag and cut a small hole in it easier to clean up than a funnel just throw the bag away

I just made this recipe and my husband and I loved it! It was so easy too. I didn't have sesame seeds so I substituted crushed peanuts and it worked great. I made a side of Asian noodles and used some of the reduced marinade as a sauce on the noodles. I will definitely be passing this recipe on!
Made this for a superbowl party DH and I went to.  Everyone loved it!  Just as delicious when it got cold!  Served with tortilla chips.  Great recipe!

Take my 3 stars with a grain of salt:   pb cookies are aren't my baking Holy Grail, so any recipe I tried that performed "as expected" would likely get a "liked it" review. I chose these cookies because I didn't have any butter, but, in spite of using veg. shortening, these were still mighty tasty.  I'll always vote 'better with butter', these were great!
Discuss the taste, how difficult it was to make, any adaptations you made or menu suggestions. If you did not like it, please explain why or provide constructive criticism.
These came out fluffy and just the right amount of crispy. I really appreciate the suggestion to save the extra skins to make potato skins. We'll definitely be doing that later this week! Thanks!

MMMM good!  Crispy on the outside, chewy on the inside - perfect!  I had a few partial bags of chips that I decided to use up so I used about 1/3 cup choc chips, 1/3 white and 1/3 butterscotch and the bars turned out fine.  So that these were school lunch friendly with our schools peanut free lunches, I also omitted nuts which didn't seem to deter the taste. Always good to make a recipe with ingredients always on hand!  Thx.
This soup is awesome. Just like Olive Garden.

Made this for New Year's Eve-turned out okay.  Too think because I used the grated parmesean cheese from a can.  Next time I made for a coupon party with real parmesean cheese--the bowl was scraped clean!  Everyone loved it.  Definitely a keeper...but is there a way to make it a little less thick?

this is exactly the way that my spanish friends taught me to make this. great recipe. make sure people realize that the high fat count is a bit lower because you drain off most of the oil after the potatoes are cooked.
I use this recipe when I make cookies except I use butter crisco shortening. Is that what you meant?

The snow is falling hard here in Upstate NY and this stew was perfect.  I adapted it a little.  We used steak only and left out the kidneys.  Just after the meat was done browning I added a touch or two of some Merlot, reduced that and removed it from the pan.  Then I browned the onions in a bit more oil.  Didn't have tarragon, used a bit of sage, basil, and thyme.  This is not the first time I've made this and it won't be the last!  Thanks!
This is the recipe that my family has used for years and everyone loves it and takes seconds.
This is a GREAT recipe. Super easy to make, and tastes better than the soup in most of the chinese restaurants Ive been to!

I too used buttermilk, and 1 cup all purpose flour, while using 1 cup whole wheat flour.  They turned out fantastic, and I'm already wondering whether I should whip up another batch for mom!  Thanks Barbara for sharing!

Very tasty soup.  Like a previous poster I used grape juice instead of wine because I have a little one at the house.  Such a perfect soup for a cold winter's day.  I also disagree with the poster who said the broth was a little strong.  I thought it was just right.

Made this for our Valentine's get together, and it worked out well!  Rather sweet and I actually had to tell some that champagne was in it!  Will definitely make it again, as it's so easy and quick to prepare.  Thanks polar!
This was better than any restaurant version I've eaten.  It's good with salty tortilla chips.
This is a really good recipe, thanks so much.

This cake turned out moist and delicious! I made substitions; sour milk in place of buttermilk, almonds in place of the walnuts. I did make the frosting but it turned out wrong but that was my fault.  This will be a regular in our house when the zucchini needs to be used up!
It got rave reviews all around. The only change I made was to change the salt to powdered chicken bouillion ( about 1 tablespoon). Good stuff!

This recipe is so close to the one that I received with my Spaetzle maker that I got from a German Store. The only thing different is that mine uses 1/2 cup water and 1/2 cup milk. My spaetzle maker is not a potato ricer. It has large holes. (like little dumplings). DH and I like them fried in butter. We had them cooked this way at a German resturant once and it's the only way we like to eat them now!  Thanks, Melody for posting.

I have eaten many muffins made from this recipe which my sister in-law is sooo good at making.  They became so popular with our family that she began to make them for the kids birthdays.  Awesome gift.  Of course we insisted that they share with the entire family.  I am so glad to see the starter recipe written down.  It sure makes you appreciate all of the effort that she goes to.

This was excellent!! I kicked it up a bit by adding more garlic (5 cloves), used cooking spray instead of oil; used Chipolte Chili Powder; 1 (4oz can) green chilis, 6oz Pepper Jack Cheese grated. Baked at 375 degrees for 15-20 minutes.  I also used different flavors of wraps- the Spinach and Basil one is delicious. Mine had a nice kick to it if you like spicy!!!

This was a hit with the whole family. My husband told me several times how good it was! I made a few changes since I did not have all the ingredients. I left the green pepper out, a jar of basil/oregano spagetti sauce, sweet italian sausage in place of ground beef and ricotta cheese for the cottage cheese. The italian sausage and spagetti sauce gave it enough flavor that I didn't need the seasonings. Absolutely delicious!! Thank you for posting this great recipe! We will making this again!!

This recipe was awesome!! This was my first time to make stuffed green peppers.  I took more than 40 minutes to prepare, probably because it was my first time.  My husband and 10 year old son LOVED this recipe.  I am making them again tonight!

I love the flavor of cilantro and lime juice blended together.  I added just a little extra of both to suite my personal taste.  My husband also loves it and requested that I keep a batch made for us at all times.  Very delicious and easy to make. Thank you, thank you!
