everyone LOVED this.  it's very sweet (even though i, too, omitted the extra 3/4 cup sugar).  i did not have fresh nutmeg, but used organic, and the spice mixture was wonderful.  it's great as a dessert with whipped cream, or as a nice breakfast with tea.  the directions do not mention where to add the butter, i just mixed it in with the other wet ingredients before blending with the dry.  thank you so much for posting this!  i will be making for Thanksgiving this year!
After struggling for years to get my Grandma's recipe to work I finally gave up and tried something new. This is how Banana Bread is suppose to be! Made me want to eat the whole loaf right away!
Lovely little meatballs!  I browned them in the oven to cut the fat a bit--otherwise followed instructions.  Next time, I think I will double up on the sauce ingredients.
Very tasty and moist - a nice change from banana bread :) A definate keeper - thanks!!!

I really liked this. Instead of boiling the potatoes, I fried them. It was faster this way. They ended up tasting cheesy. I would have never imagines they would taste this good. The reason I'm only giving it a 3 instead of a 4 or 5 is because they were very greasy.
Must  say i  am  not a big carrot cake fan but  my wife tried  your  recipe and i  must say  it was  good.  Thanks .
This was REALLY good..and hot. Just the way I like it. Better take a snow cone with ya to the bathroom if ya eat much. :)

Yum! I made the roux for the sauce with olive oil instead of butter, and didn't use Worcestershire sauce as I didn't have it -- but it was still delicious and thickened nicely after only a couple of minutes of whisking. As a quick alternative to steaming, I put the cauliflower straight into its baking dish and zapped it in the microwave for 4 minutes while I made the sauce. Very quick to prepare, the whole thing took 10 minutes from fridge to oven! The cauliflower was crispy on the outside, and tasted so good that my husband and I practically scraped the dish clean. Definitely a keeper. Thanks for another great vegie recipe!
This is the first hot day of our summer here in this part of Australia so couldn't wait to try this recipe and we sure were not disappointed. Thanks
meh
Quick and simple, but absolutely delicious! I did add 1 tsp vanilla. They disappeared right away, I will be making more soon.
Delicious! I don't know about the title ;), but it does produce a moist, delicious cake. I topped mine with crushed heath bar, just because I love it.
Very nice.  I used salted butter, but should have used unsalted.  I put these on italian nachos, and it was a hit with the family.  Thanks for sharing.
Thanks for easy and good recipe!  I used the recommended lemon juice to thin out the mayo.  It had a nice garlic flavor and made a great addition to the potluck I took it to.

By far the best Pizza Dough I've found. I recommend using the half white half wheat method, you will get the perfect texture inside and out. The sauce is also very versatile and can be modified to your needs. The best part is that after you make one Pizza you can't wait to make the next.

I just gave 2 stars the last time I tried these, and all I can say is I must have done something wrong, because these were fantastic!!!!!!!!  I lovedddddd them!  And they will become a regular in my household.  Yumm-o!

My family and I love this recipe.  When preparing holiday meals the first thing out of our son's mouth is who's making the cheesey apples.  

So creamy, sweet and delicious!  Thank you Tonkcats!
Terrific! Adds a nice garlic taste to the crust. I added a bit more garlic than the receipe called for, my family's garlic lovers.
This was a great recipe. Although, I added a full teaspoon of cumin. Came out Awsome!

I halved the recipe and used 2 large sweet potatoes and 1 egg..I should've maybe used 2 eggs though since I found they fell apart rather easily.
Definitely will make again though, simple and different! Thanks!
Very good indeed...I used butter flavored Crisco and Jiff peanut butter which I think makes a big difference in peanut butter cookies!  Hubby and sons loved them!

this is really good! easy to put together and it smells awesome while its cooking. i only had 7 hours until we ate so i put my cp on high for 2 hours then turned it down to low and it turned out perfect!  I made fried rice to go with it and voila a meal my kids and husband love!
These were good and had a nice flavor to them. I followed the recipe exactly as written but I too used frozen already chopped potatoes.

I have made this several times now and am just getting around to a rating.  This is a wonderful way to make fish!  Since I am not a fan of deep-frying and I always have trouble getting coating to stick, I was in search of just such a recipe.  So far, I have tried this with catfish and tilapia ~ we preferred the catfish.  I don't bother to separate the egg ~ just beat up a whole one.  Thanks for posting this ~ it is a keeper for us!

I didn't use the onions as DH isn't a fan.  I also didn't have celery on hand so used someone else's suggestion of chopped green peppers as a substitute.  The only thing I would change is cutting out the salt as it was a bit much for our tastes.  Very yummy recipe and I will be using it again.
absolutely wonderful recipe! Very easy to make and everyone loved it! Thanks for posting!

These were a huge hit with the family.  They are almost all gone and will be after school gets out!  I added the vanilla as recommended in another review.  I substituted applesauce for the oil.  I used Pillsbury Devil's Food cake mix and the mini chocolate chips.  Thanks a million for an easy quick hassle free yummy cookie!

My husband raved about this recipe all night long.  I have not had a morsel of sugar pass my mouth in 5 months as I am trying to lose some weight, so finally, I caved and had a spoonful and he was right.  I made him eat the last piece for fear that my will power would not hold up.  He officially asked me to throw away his own grandma's recipe and substitute it with this one.  Thanks for sharing this recipe.

It was the first pie i have ever made and it turned out.... WOW!!! My whole family who has been eating pies there whole life said it was the BEST PIE they have ever eaten. I did whole wheat flour instead and i added cin. and sugar on the top which made it even better!! Thanks a TON!!! Happy Thanksgiving!!

MMMMMMMMM this pie is delicious. I looked up the recipe only after a co worker made this at work. It has a custard look and taste to it like you are eating bread pudding without the cinnamon and raisins though. The simple ingredients make it delicious and goes great as a thanksgiving dessert which I made two of them for tomorrow. Thanks for a keeper!!

I am so glad I found this recipe again!  I made it a couple of years ago and it was a smash hit.  It is a very refreshing version of a dessert style salad.  There is something about letting the marshmallows and cranberries sit overnight that just does the trick.  Thank you!
its good

We always end up with extra pie(s) after the holidays and someone has to have their arm twisted to take them home.  This combined my favorite and my brother's favorite eliminating one pie!  Even the Pumpkin Pie Purest that my brother is, he tried it and said it was "Pretty good" definitely a keeper.  I did use really good cinnamon and added some ginger, ground clove and nutmeg to both parts.
I really like this.  Sometimes a pecan pie is a little too "much" for me and this had such a nice "layered" flavor.

Well, I took this to Thanksgiving dinner.  It got TOP ratings from the family-- fantastic, amazing, phenomenal, and "damn good."  This was not hard to make.  I only have a small processor, so I used it for the carrots, then a hand blender for the rest.  I didn't use the optional garnish, so it wasn't terribly decorative, but nobody cared.  I might add some nuts into the crust next time, pecans maybe.  Thanks a lot Cindy!
Made this for Thanksgiving and it was great.  Thanks for a great, easy to put together appetizer.  I did add some extra garlic :)
This bread is wonderful!! SO moist and yummy! THanks for posting@
My family loved these pies.  I made 4 over the holiday.  However, I added 1 tbsp of vanilla and 1/4 cup sugar.  My husband ate 1/2 one by himself.

This is the best by far --Easy, cheap, and tastes good. My dad who hates "white sauces" absolutely love this one. I rotate the meats (chicken, shrimp, or crab).  He even asked me to make the dish for his poker night.

I am sorry but this did not turn out for me at all.  I followed the recipe exactly and I ended up with a super thick mixture of goo that I could barely get a spoon through.  I think if I had used a lot less flour it might have turned out better but as written it just did not work for me.
My kids and their friends loved this recipe.  Instead of making loaves I made cupcakes and decorated them with icing.  They were a big hit.
This was wonderful!! Even my husband liked this and he hates spinich and artichokes. Making this for lots of get togethers this holiday season!!!

Wonderful.  I doubled the recipe and it was a huge hit at Thanksgiving!  I took the advice of some other reviewers and added a bit more mayo and a dash of milk since I planned to reheat my dip as needed and didn't want it to dry out.  But if you were making a single recipe and expected it to go quickly, the recipe is perfect as is!
Yummy. I used a chicken broth. It was too spicy for my daughters.. I will cut it back to 1/8 tsp red peppers. Thank you for a fast and delicious veggie dish.

WOW this is out of this world!  I made this for Thanksgiving yesterday and served it with toasted bread - it was to die for.  It's very rich so you can fill up on it fast, but no one seemed to mind.  I'm so glad there are leftovers for me to pick on during the weekend :-)  I will make this for our Super Bowl party this year also, this recipe is a keeper!

This pie was great! The name sure doesn't match the taste though.  This pie tastes like pecan pie without the pecans.  Very quick and easy to make. I found this recipe totally by accident while searching the ingredient list so I could use up some leftover buttermilk; I sure glad I did!

We all liked this dish a lot!  I will make this recipe for Christmas too, because it went over so well for Thanksgiving.  I added chopped pecans over the top of it for color.  Loved it.  Thanks a bunch for posting Ed.  Melanie

I used cinnamon swirl cake mix, add 1/2 of the cinnamon sugar miture to the cookies, put other half in a small bowl. Roll 1 inch size cookies in cinnamon sugar before baking 10 mins. Very easy, fast and easy clean up. My family ate the whole 1st batch before I could get the 2nd out of the oven!
this repicie looks very good i will try it 2nit thankz

This is an additional recipe I chose to bake in memory of CoolMonday in the bake-a-thon. I love the flavor of this cake!:) It reminds me of banana bread. This recipe was easy to follow. Another great recipe from CoolMonday and a wonderful tribute in memory of her. ~~ Chef mamma
Lovely!  Great flavor although I did alter the lemon zest to orange zest (no lemons in the house) and my two year old dumped in extra almond meal!  Nice rise and great texture.

Oh, these are VERY nice and easy traditional-tasting biscuits! I made a batch for creamed turkey over biscuits and they were just great. The next time I will double the recipe to get a total yield of 14-15  biscuits and I think I'll cut back on the salt just a tad to one teaspoon per batch. Other than that, my wife and I found this recipe to be perfect. Thanks so much for posting it! pat, the old bone man
Excellent dip!  I used the recipe exactly as written, and it was a big hit at our Thanksgiving day celebration.  Quick, easy, and delicious.

Yummy! I was looking for something easy to whip up for a dinner party. The main dish was chicken enchiladas and this recipe made a great side dish. I threw this all together and heated it on the stove for about 10 minutes. I used a can of seasoned black beans, and I threw in some ground cumin and garlic salt. I didn't use lettuce leaves since I served it hot. Come summer I'll try this as a salad!

I loved how easy it was and they were delicious. I will definitely make again. They expanded a lot more than I thought they would and I ended up having to cook it almost 15 minutes but I am wondering if that was because of my oven. All in all a wonderful recipe with so many options  to customize as desired.

I have a new rhubarb plant and made this with the first 'crop'. What a delicious dessert -- and especially nice served warm with cream or vanilla ice cream. There is absolutely no need to add the extra sugar suggested by some other reviewers, unless you have an extreme sweet tooth. Made and thoroughly enjoyed for the bake-a-thon in memory of CoolMonday.

I made this for Thanksgiving Day and it was a huge hit! I toasted up some french bread chunks which I slightly basted with olive oil and rosemary. And the last 5 minutes before it was done I spinkled more parm. cheese and put it under the broiler till it was melted. I can see why this recope was so famous. Thanks!
PERFECTION!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  This is now officially my FAVORITE potato recipe. I too cooked it in the oven and it was delicious.  Thanks for an outstanding recipe.

Thanks for a lovely addition to our holiday table.  This turned out so pretty, has easy to follow directions and the tart taste of the cranberries was a welcome surprise.  Everyone was requesting the recipe by the time dinner was over.  I didn't change a thing.
Wow, I never thought this could be made w/ something other than sour cream. Sounds wonderful!
I made this for the bake-a-thon for CoolMonday and I am so glad I did! It was so good! The banana and chocolate go so good together! This one is going to stay in my cookbook!
so yummy..light inside and crunchy outside, thanks for the wonderful recipe, a joy to add to my collection !!!
Loved it! Comfort food at its best!
best peanut butter cookies ever!
I made this recipe a couple of years ago and then had to make 20 batches. Everyone loved it and could not believe it had cheese in it. I will be making about 15 batches this year. Thank You

DH & I lived in STL for 5 years before moving to FL and the Hill was where we most often ended up when we were out on a Saturday night looking for a place to eat!  I will admit, I bought fresh gnocchi from the market so I didn't use that portion of the recipe but the sauce is amazing!  I now use this on pasta for my lunches quite regularly.  So fresh tasting and simple.  I must admit, though, the combo with the gnocchi (my favorite) is still the best. DH says I can make this ANYTIME!  Thanks so much, Cheryl, for sharing!
Surprisingly fast and easy: the times suggested are perfect for those without natural cook timing.  Delicious as well, a good staple for any veggie.
Yummy! We made this with french bread and ate the whole thing!
Very delicious and great combination of sweet potato and pecan. Perfect level of sweetness.

"Its a party in my mouth" is how my daughter put it!  The first experience for both her and my husband for stuffed green peppers and it was a hit.  I used fresh diced tomatoes and some canned salsa to spice it up.  Delicious!

Brilliant recipe. Didn't last long AT ALL. I added 1 tsp of vanilla though. But I'm a vanilla freak.
I'll defiantly be making these again :) Two thumbs up

This is really good.  It's a little sweet for my taste, but the crust is amazing.  The meringue set up nicely and it looks very pretty.  Probably wouldn't make again for myself, but to take to a gathering it definitely has appeal.
The taste was very good. Makes alot. Make sure your plastic containers are large enough to hold all the liquid. It was really great!

I keep this in ice cream buckets in the freezer all summer --well, winter too. We prefer strawberry jello, but the rest of the recipe is the same. I originally got the recipe from a friend in TEXAS, she called it Baptist Punch.  Seems it appears at all gatherings at her church! My bunch likes to scoop out some of the frozen stuff into a glass and add ginger ale for a cool treat anytime.  We use the pampered chef ice cream scoop that thaws as it scoops.  I recently moved and haven't replenished the supply.  Better get that in the freezer before the kids come for Christmas! They'll be expecting it!
Wonderful!! I don't usually like pecan pie (too sweet for my taste) but added with the sweet potatoes, this recipe is excellent!  It will definitely be a holiday staple at my home.

I am sorry to give such a low review.  We were dissapointed in these cookies.  They were lacking in sweetness and were a bit hard.  I adjusted the cooking time up and down to try and get the right texture and they never turned out soft.  Anyway, again- so sorry.
I brought this dish to a party and everyone loved it.  I used Dubliner and Parmesian cheese and lowfat ingredients.  Delicious!

I've been experimenting with making this recipe in loaf form, so that it can be sliced and buttered.  Turns out quite well, with a rich, creamy sort of interior.  I had to add a fair amount of extra milk to get the dough to come together - maybe an extra quarter cup. To make this in a loaf pan, just press the dough into the pan gently, cook for about 15 minutes tented with foil, and then cook another 5 minutes without the foil.
One word: YUMMY!! This is a great recipe. I would have to agree with the other reviewers here, though. I waited until the top got brown and took it out of the oven. It was great!
I love biscotti, and this recipe has the perfect texture and flavor! Thanks!

I loved this recipe! It is definately going in my box. 
This fits perfectly into our healthier eating plan.
When I first mixed the dry stuff, I didn't think it would be enough to coat the chicken but it turned out to be just enough, which is awesome because I hate to have to throw the leftovers away.
This is the recipe that is in one of my NZ cookbooks and it is reliable and tastes great. A favourite for school lunchboxes.
This isn't kahlua!  IT'S AWFUL!
this was my very first cake i ever made homemade and it was great

This cake was truely OUTSTANDING!! The combination of the almonds, almond extract, chocolate and banana was a slice of HEAVEN! WOW!!! My hubby took this to work with him, so I didn't think I was going to get any! LOL! But he surprised me with a piece that he saved back for me!! SO GLAD HE DID!!! I will be making this recipe a lot!! (The cake was done perfectly in 45 minutes exactly. *Also, I greased my pan with butter-flavored crisco, and dusted it lightly inside with cocoa powder. The cake came out EASILY with no trouble at all! :)) Made for CoolMonday's Bake-a-thon.

These were delicious, easy and fun to make with my three year old. We made them with lemon cake mix I had in the back of my pantry and frosted them with the lemon frosting that was also lurking back there.

They are tasty, with a bit of the "chemical" taste you find in baked from a mix items. Very soft, puffy, tender cookies, perfect for a rainy day.
I made this bread at thanksgiving time and it seems I am baking loaf after loaf to keep up with the requests!  Great recipe!

Loved this pie the flavor was just what I was looking for.  DH wanted a chocolate Meringue Pie and this fit the bill.  My only problem (and it's probably my technique as I'm new to this) was that it wasn't firm enough to hold it's shape when cut.  I'm thinking maybe I didn't cook it long enough but will be making this again and I'm sure perfection will come with practice.  That said the flavor of the rich chocolate can't be beat.  Thanks Carole for a wonderful recipe.

I read the comments of some of the reviews before I started. I prepared exactly as listed except I decided to add a little more garlic. All the other ingredients I made at full fat level :). 

The only thing was, the recipe didn't say how to prepare the artichoke hearts, so I just rough chopped them, since I don't imagine they were to go into the mix whole. Turned out great this way. Could someone please comment on how they prepared the artichokes. Thanks!

This was really very good! I was skeptical because of the sour cream, but since I didn't have heavy cream in the house, I tried this. It came together and tasted great! I like the twang of the sour cream, and I added 1 cup of parmesan cheese (the bottled kind). With real parmesan cheese, I can see this having a deeper taste, but bottled was all I had on hand. I love that this has less butter, so the end result was creamy w/o the added oil. But because of maybe that lack of extra oil, I had to thin the sauce a little bit (I like my alfredo sauce a little thinner than most). I used soy creamer (yes!), but you could have used half and half or milk. I added extra cracked pepper instead of crushed red pepper flakes and threw in a 1/4 tsp of finely chopped onion because I had to use it up. Very tasty! I had shrimp, bacon and peas over capellini with this sauce and it was just right! My oldest son loved it, my sister took home the leftovers! Definitely going in the tried and true cookbook.

DE-LI-CIOUS!!!!  Loved this recipe and we especially loves the "sauce"...may even make for a good addition to my home-made salsa???  This recipe was really easy to make...I want to try it with pulled chicken next time.
This is a good one!

I decided to make this on our Friday Pizza night at home. I love it. I love ordering this at restaurants (as a meal in itself even though its supposed to be an appetizer hehe). This stuff's dangerous if you're eating it alone! :D I served it with toasted sliced Molasses bread and Doritos since I didn't have tortilla chips. I better hit the gym tomorrow..

I have also used this dressing - known to me as "grandma's souper french dressing" it's delicious and i've used it for years... and it's the only dressing my husband will use - otherwise he won't eat the salad.

I have to admit this fudge is great! Did I mention I don't even like fudge. I was skeptical when making this, the thought of cheese in fudge is just gross. Everyone in my family loved it. They didn't know there is cheese in it. My husband is the type to say "I knew it tasted funny". What he doesn't know won't hurt him. I did find that I used a small 8x8 pan, my 9x9 was way too big for the amount of fudge this makes. Thanks Myron this will be on my holiday tray every year from now on.
This recipe consistently yields tender and delicious scones. I have added cranberry/ white chocolate chips to one batch, and semi sweet chocolate chips to another. Both turned out delightful.

Only a few ingredients... simple to do... and very, very tasty!  
That makes a perfect recipe in my book!
The only draw back is you have to plan in advance so it has time to marinate.

I served this to 8 guests - and it was my first time cooking fish!  Everyone raved about the meal. Thanks Jacques :o)

Just made these and they remind me of potato latkes or pancakes.  They were quite tasty, but I really try to avoid frying, and that is the only criticism I have.  I wonder if spraying a broiler pan with Pam and putting them in the oven would work?  Maybe I'll try that the next time I want to make these when I have an extra supply of squash.  A friend dropped off a box (maybe 100 small squash)and I chose a bunch of Zaar yellow squash recipes that appealed to me.  The only problem is that I still have half a box left!  I already made three different recipes which I plan to rate, but there is a limit to how much one can eat......In putting the recipe together, I used a Vita Mix machine to mash the squash and mix all the ingredients.  I just chopped the onion roughly, and the machine did the rest.  It makes one life a lot easier.  Thank you riffraff for the tasty and savory recipe.
This fish was very yummy! I added some chopped preserved lemon to bring out the lemon flavour a bit more!
It was sooooooooooooooo good :)

The combination of meats makes a lovely flavored meat ball- this, in combination with the herbs, gives a WOW performance.
 I made a couple of changes - First I made the whole recipe up to adding the onions-peppers etc.  I froze all but 8 meat balls - these I browned but did not simmer them in the wine nor the broth.  I served them on a bun like my regular Saturday night special burger -  It rates at least an 8 out of 5.    Thanks Kenk for posting
Made for one of my girls' nights. So easy to make and now they won't let me bring anything else!
Made this today and it was very good.  I will be serving at my family christmas party on the 14th and I am sure it will be a total success.  Thank you.  Glo
I added a few white onions
WOW! WOW! WOW! These are better than any shortbread I have ever made or bought before!

This is a very good side dish! I didn't peel my spuds and shot them through the salad shooter so they were all sliced the same thickness. I used fat free half and half and fat free cheese too. I also used the oven method and sprayed my casserole dish with Pam first. (The directions didn't say to.) I took a picture but it didn't turn out too pretty. Next time I'm going to make these in the crock pot. Thanks! :)
This was WONDERFUL and wonderfully easy!  Got rave reviews at a potluck, and was asked for the recipe!  Recommended!

Well, I am also glad you found your recipe, this is a wonderful pie and a good way to use up leftover buttermilk if you don't drink it, I don't, I just use it for recipes and always have leftover, and if you don't tell anyone only the people who know buttermilk pies will know there is buttermilk in it. I made it exactly as written and will be making this again and again, thanks!

Wonderful! Followed the recipe exactly, except, I only had shredded cheese.  I really had to shove it into the chicken and secure it really well, so it didn't fall out. This was very yummy. Everyone really loved it. Kids had seconds.
This was delicious.  Fast to put together, and the chicken was so juicy and tender.  Thanks for a very good recipe.

Can you stand another 5 Star Rating?  This certainly deserves it!  So easy, fresh and tasty.  I used some Old El Paso jalapenos (had them in the fridge) and they worked fantasically.  Thank you for the recipe!!  I'll never buy jar salsa again!!
PERFECT!!! My family loved this soup. I liked the thicker consistency this soup has. This is "my" onion soup from now on, thanks brother William!!!

I liked the recipe but I didn't LOVE it. I thought it needed a bit more salt and pepper, but I did enjoy the fact that it was a recipe with no sour cream. Definitely pre-bake the shells for a bit to crisp them up prior to filling.
Minimal effort for maximum taste...my favorite kind of recipe!  And very addicting too, I might add.  Thanks Cheryl!

Would also like to agree with Heidi... Not sugary or sweet enough. You can taste the brown sugar too much. Perhaps white sugar in the ingredients could do the trick? And when baking- they wouldn't go downward as shown in the picture- and did what was said, slightly crisscrossed.. Weird. Not sure why mine didn't turn out the same. I used margarine instead- taste was about 3 as I'm rating, but needs improvement... 3 rating~!
It turned out fabulous! My first one! Thanks for the great recipe now if only I can figure out how to keep bananas from sinking to the bottom....
Simple recipe and my family loved it.  I added more sauce and used vegetarian meat, and it was a wonderful, quick meal.

This will be a favorite. I used buttermilk instead of regular milk, 2 t. baking powder, and melted 1 or 2 T. butter in the brownie pan before pouring in the batter. Best cornbread I've had in a long time. Cut up nicely too & not crumbly!

Just made the jar to give as a gift.  I am taking the word of the other chefs who actually made this recipe and hoping the recipient likes it too.  I attached an ornament to the jar along with the hang tag for the directions.  Very cute and can't wait to give it away.  I have to make 3 more for my DD's teachers.  They are sure to be a hit.
This is the best! Even my picky 5 year old liked the "candied salmon"
Oh my goodness.  Thats all I can say to express how delicious this was!  I made the dip, baked it and put it in phyllo dough cups for a party.  WOW!

My husband started the day a week or two ago saying he wanted sweet potato pie so we went looking for one to make.  I took a Pillsbury crust from the freezer and let it defrost while we searched.  We came across this one and he decided instantly that it was what he wanted.  We really enjoyed it, but thought that there was not enough sweet potato filling.  Next time we'd double the sweet potato part and leave the pecan topping the same.  It really is the best of both worlds, though!

This was really good.
I halved the recipe and I didn't have any cornmeal but it still turned out great. Tastes just like an english muffin and excellent toasted.
Thanks!

Rave reviews all around! I made this for THanksgiving, friends insisted I make also for annual Christmas Party. Made double-batch, none left! I did add some mozzarellla in addition to the parm. THanks, Juli!

The house smells gorgeous. I found this recipe today in the midst of a Toronto snow storm. I had been making this stew for a number of years until I lost my recipe. What a delight to find your recipe on this very day! I add parsnips rather than carrots and add an entire can of Guinness as well as one small tin of beef broth. My original recipe called for fresh thyme and no rosemary. I add three stocks of thyme while it cooks and then add picked thyme leaves at the very end as well as the parsley. All in all a fantastic meal. I serve it with Perfect Traditionally English Roast Potatoes by Kellogs recipe number Recipe #109070. Absolutely lovely!

very good, like a very thick peanut butter cookie. The glaze is soooo good. After reading some other comments, I decided to double the amount of powdered sugar. That made it "thicken up" on the bars, not wet or runny at all. Thanks for sharing this one!!

I made this cake for my MIL2B's birthday a few weeks ago in loving memory of *CoolMonday* The amaretto was a wonderful addition to this recipe! It is like a sweet banana bread elevated to cake status.... simply delicious! I wouldn't change a thing and I will be making this one again!  Made for CoolMonday's Bake-a-thon.
Loved this didnt have full 2 cups parmesan but all else the same... chopped the artichoke in food processor with spinach...thanks. Will make again. served with crackers.

These taste very good, and are a nice way to use up the yellow squash abundance from summer gardens.  They don't taste like squash, which would be appealing for those who don't care for yellow squash.  I agree that they could work nicely as a substitute for hush puppies.

Made this for Thanksgiving. Everyone loved it. My son even goes, this is better then a co-workers of his. That is a true compliment coming from him, due to the fact that he's still a picky eater. Very easy to make. Can use any apples, I used Empire.
The best spinach artichoke dip ever!  Have made several times and everyone loves it!  Equally as good with french bread and tortilla chips.  Thanks Juli!

Absolutely to die for! I lost my mom's recipie for these. Thank you for posting this. The only thing we do sifferent is I don't use butterscotch chips, I use white chocolate and dark chocolate chips.We always used chopped walnuts, but I picked up chopped pecans by accident so I used them and yummo! My childhood revisited!

It was below my expectations. It tasted somewhat....sugary. To make it somewhat pleasant I added oregano, A LOT of pepper, and garlic salt. I could still taste the sugarnness. I'm not hard to please and don't mean to be unkind, but this recipe wasn't that good.

This was warm, filling, and delicious!  I am not able to use the kidneys, and didn't even have any steak on hand, so I had to modify it somewhat severely and use ground beef and some chicken breasts.  I also couldn't use the dairy milk for the pudding part, so substituted coconut milk.  That said, if you can accept that it was the same recipe made as posted, this was a wonderful dinner!  I served it with mashed potatoes, as suggested, and broccoli on the side.  The pudding puffed up beautifully and browned to a nice crunch around the edges.  The gravy was divine.   I would also add that at least in my family, this made 6 hearty servings and not just 4.  Thanks for adopting this recipe, Honni!

I made these for a 4th of July party from a TOH magazine I believe...Everyone loved them, just be sure to not overbake the crust. It will look like it still needs to be a bit browner, but overcooked crust makes the bars too crunchy.

This was my first attempt at fish soup. I read some of the reviews and was afraid of it being too bland so added both cayenne pepper and red pepper flakes, next time will only add one or the other. Also threw in garlic and thyme. Thickened with equal parts butter and flour roux. Found this to be a wonderful basic recipe and a great way to get some of those fish eaten. Thanks for posting!
Very good.  Very easy.  I just loved how this came together.  Easy to roll out.  Brown sugar was a nice addition.  Thank you very much, I will make these again.
I am giving this 5 starts - even though I have not tasted the brownies.  I am basing it on the responses I have received after giving jars of the brownie mix as gifts.  Mary

Well... It might be a good recipe if I could figure out how she did part of this.  I didn't have a clue what a "moderately low" oven temperature was, I went and read some other carrot cake recipes to see what the average cooking temperature was and used 375 degrees F.  The cake was dry and overcooked.  I didn't have a ring pan so I used a square one.  That is my fault, not hers.  It tasted like it'd be good but it's hard to tell with an over baked, dry bread.  Sorry, I wouldn't make this again.

It's good! I didn't have enough powdered sugar, so mine didn't set up as firmly as I would have liked, but it still had a great flavor and consistency! There was a "tang" to it that I can only attribute to the cheese, but there was no hint of it otherwise. I also added about a 1/2 cup chopped pecans. I'll definately try it again when I have the correct amounts of all the ingredients! :)
ETA: Tried another batch -- it set up firmly and was superb!!! This is definately a keeper! :)
Really good! I made this for a girl get together and it was gone pretty quickly. Very, very good! I made it just like directed and it turned out wonderfully!

Wonderful!  This is now my favorite moussaka recipe - delicious as is, and also a great base to add to and play with.  The detailed instructions are very helpful.
Thank you!

I think I'm the odd one out. I was disappointed after all of the rave reviews. I followed the recipe exactly and I felt it was really overpowering with the 2 cups of parmesan cheese. I ended up adding some medium cheddar cheese to try and help. It tasted okay. Some people at the party liked it. I ended up having quite a bit left over. After it was heated up it became really cheesy which is nice. I would NOT recommend anyone bringing this to a party because it cools and does not spread well when cooled. It tastes much better when it's hot. I think it would be best to serve it right out of the oven. DH did not care for it, so it was wasted. I thank you for the recipe but this just did not do it for our family. Might make again with some serious changes. Just my opinion though, Thanks!
My 21 month old and I tried this bread today and love it. After eating almost all of his big slice, my boy fell asleep with a little piece of it in his hand -- so sweet!

This was my first attempt at biscuits (other than with Bisquick), and I was so pleased.  I used the recommendation of the previous reviewer and cut the salt back to 1 t, and it worked out well.  I was surprised how quickly the shortening was incorporated just by using my hands.  Next time it will be a double recipe for sure.

Wow! this was great! Yeast scares me - and remarkably this dough came out very easy to handle and more like what i think dough SHOULD act like! I used it for calzones and then got a little crazy and mad the second half into 'tortillas' both were very good. Thank you!
I made this as a gift, so I haven't tasted it, but it smells great and I think it will be appreciated. I added a bit of salt, and also rosemary, thyme, oregano, and white pepper.

Fabulous dip!  I made this for our office party, and it was the first dish that was wiped clean!  I used a 6-ounce container of grated parmesan cheese that was just slightly less than 2 cups, and it was plenty.  I also added about 1/2 cup finely chopped onions because we like the taste of onions in our dip.  I baked it in a pyrex dish before taking it to the office, and just reheated it in a small crock pot.  I served it with large wheat crackers.
These were okay.  They were lacking something for us though.

I have made this SO MANY TIMES since finding this recipe. EVERONE loved it!! Even my hubby that doesn't like artichokes, spinach etc. :) I added a few things. Didn't hurt anything but the waistline I'm sure :) I added some sauteed onions and garlic, a big splash of heavy whipping cream and OH MAN!! YUMMY!! I also used an Italian 4 cheese blend in place of all parmesan! Thanks for an awesome recipe!!
My husband's two favorite Thanksgiving pies all in one!  I have been making this pie for years - I originally got the recipe from Taste of Home.  Thanks for posting!
Mt husband loved this recipe! I doubled the recipe which turned out fine. It also re-heated well the next day. Next time I will use bread for dipping.
This stuff is so fantabulous!!!! First time I ever made anything like this and it was such a HIT!!!! Even with the people who claim to HATE spinach. Thanks alot!!!

Made this for the office and it did not last long at all.  Made with fat free cream cheese and you could not tell the difference.  Also divided parmesan cheese and added an Italian cheese mix.  This was soooo good will make this again and again.

OH MY GOD!  I just made this soup to serve for Christmas dinner and just off the stove, it's divine.  I know I have to let it sit overnight to let the flavors meld, but I couldn't help getting a crescent roll left over from last night and dipping it in some soup that I didn't put in the refrigerated container :) -- so yummy.  

I made French Onion soup years ago a different way and it wasn't nearly as good as this.  I didn't add the caramel color or the kitchen bouquet, it seems to be darkish without it.  

I also halved the recipe for 8 people, but I think that if you're serving 8 you should just make the entire recipe.  It made about 4 qts of soup but if I put it in my crocks w/the french bread/cheese, they may look a little bit low.  

Just make the whole recipe and you won't be sorry.

This cake is awesome!  I was wondering if it would rise, but it did!  It was simple to make.  Since I was going to be serving it with berries I decided to try Cherry 7-Up and I think it gave it a little something extra.

This was easy enough for ME (and I'm very, VERY lazy), but what's more- it was good.  Even my roommate was impressed.
I've tried a few billion pizza dough recipes and this was the best.  Thanks for sharing!
Great, I added green onions and used pepperjack cheese to make it spicier.
Very good! I used fresh broccoli and added some sliced mushrooms. I served it over white rice. Next time I will make extra sauce. My husband had several helping! A definite keeper! Thank you.
This came out perfect - followed to the letter!  A very heavy bread that I served with Irish stew.  Now we all need a nap!
I've made this a couple of times for some parties the past few weeks, and it was a hit every time!  Awesome recipe!  I will definitely use this one over and over again!

This recipe is missing something.  I felt that the filling was a little bland.  Any suggestions on what spices to add to give it more of a kick?  Also, I found it was difficult using the muffin tin.  I used too much dough and my lids did not completely enlose it.  I think it would be easier to make it into a sealed taco, rather than a personal pot pie.

This was an OK stew, but I had to add many more vegetables and double the base to really make it a meal, which is what I expect when making a stew. Left out the pearl onions and used a white onion, sliced thickly. The flavor of the base may make it worth trying again.

OMG!  It was so good!  Light and fluffy and it went perfectly with the prime rib, creamed spinach and mashed potatoes.  I was afraid they would not rise, or they would not turn out but they were perfect!  My roast produced very little fat (because we like it rare) and I used a small amount of purchased beef lard in the bottom of the muffin tins. It didn't hurt them at all.  These were delicious and I am already planning on making them tonite again! I am going to serve them with a leftover beef, diced potatoes, roasted carrots in leftover gravy as almost a deconstructed pot pie.  I can't wait!

Did I miss something? I did exactly what the recipe said, and it was thick and dry, and very grainy with parmesan. Not creamy or dippable at all, I had a feeling 2 cups of parmesan was a lot for the amount of wet ingredients. It had the consistency of stuffing.

I made these for Christmas.  I used all chocolate chips rather than chocolate and butterscotch.  I also poured some of the condensed milk over the crust, added the other ingredients, then poured the remaining milk over the top.  They were delicious and everyone loved them.  Thanks for posting!

Oh! I.ve triesd it for 2 times and it's so good. First, I just tried a couple of breast to see what it gonna be. Then I let my kids and husband taste it, they all love it. Then my kids ask me to cook again for they really love it. Then I cooked again on our family special dinner. And they still want me to cook some more. Thanks for that recipe.
We loved this.  It was so easy to make...especially when you don't feel like cooking.  Simple and Delicious.
Wonderful dish, very visually appealing as well, my husband and I loved it. Thanks so much for an easy, flavorful recipe!

Fantastic!  Every time I make these cookies everyone raves about them.  I follow the recipe exactally and no one complained they were not sweet enough.  I like the fact you don't have to refrigerate the batter as you do in some peanut butter cookies.  Thanks for sharing.  I have made these several times.

Nancy, this was a super recipe!  We made our Christmas Dinner this year an Asian theme.  (Each year we do something different, to make each year memorable).  This year was so successful.  My sons thought the soup was divine!  Everyone raved over it.  We did add the left-over pork filling from the egg rolls to it, as we did not want to waste anything.  It actually gave some additional texture and color, with the grated carrots.  We did not use 4 eggs, but cut that amount in half.  Also, we substituted the red chile paste with cayenne pepper.  All of it tasted better than any restaurant we have been to in the USA and abroad.  Thanks again for the great and  fairly quick recipe.
I like these a lot, have made the recipe on several occasions with various different spices.
maybe add a bit of ground nuts, didn't taste too peanut buttery. :p but nice and soft cookies.
Unfortunately, this did not work out for me. The consistency didn't seem quite right.

This soup is outstanding! I was tempted into making it after ordering a terrible FOS in a Cheltenham restaurant last night. 

I had to cut the receipe down quite a bit - used 2 very large onions, reduced amount of butter and seasoning and then one part beef stock, one part dry wine and one part Joubere beef gravy instead of the flour.  Probably sounds like a hatchet job, but it has turned out to be absolutely delicious!  Did not have to use the caramel colouring or the kitchen bouquet.  I'll be serving it tomorrow for lunch, with the bread and gruyere, and I can't wait.

IMHO, what makes this recipe is taking the time to slow cook the onions and adding a good, dry wine like Sancerre.  Thanks Brother William!!

Mmm, yummy!  My sister made this for lunch the other day, and I think I'll make it for supper tonight.  She skipped the shredded coconut & onions, and used canned ginger.  Turned out very tasty, a nice change in pace for chicken salad.  Sweet and spicy.
Delicious!! My husband even liked this one and he's the pickiest eater I have in my house! I will be making this one again!
I made this for Thanksgiving this year as an appetizer and it was gone before the meal was ready!  Definitely a huge hit.  I've had several requests for it since then!
Cubed the potatoes--everyone loved them!!! :)
Made 3 batches of this for christmas baskets, but used small pans.  Snuck 1 for myself, it was awesome.  I added a streusel toppong on half of them.  Delish both ways!  Great recipe!

I have made these twice now.  My husband is from the UK, and he really liked these a lot.  He requested I make them smaller on the second go, and they came out much nicer.  I would have thought the larger size would be more appropriate for filling with gravy, but everyone liked the smaller ones better.  I think I used vegetable oil both times. Thanks.  :)
My whole family loved it. Thank you.
This is sooooo good.  Very rich but so delicious.  We made this for Christmas Eve and it was gone in no time.  I will be making this many times over.  Thank you for this yummy recipe.....Stephanie

May I add my kudos to this outstanding recipe!  Until I tried this one I had little sucess getting my Yorkshire Pudding to rise enough in the oven.  This recipe produced the lightest, mile high puddings I have ever seen.  Flat puddings of the past are over.

Here are a couple hints to make your Yorkshire Pudding-making experience even more successful:

The 1:1:1 ratio of ingredients makes this an easy recipe to double or triple, etc.  Measure the eggs first and make the other ingredients match.

For a smoother batter, mix it up and leave it on the counter at least a half hour before putting it in the oven.  Give it one final whisk before placing the batter into the tins and into the oven.

This was outstanding! I followed the recipe as directed, but I did add a little more soy sauce because it was a little sweet. My whole family enjoyed this so I will be making it again soon! Thanks for a terrific recipe!
Delicious and easy to make. It tastes like apple pie. I used Granny Smith apples.
Great scone recipe!!  I added some whiskey soaked raisins and they turned out great.  I baked them for 13 minutes which was a bit too long.  Next time I will check them at 11 minutes.

Love, love, LOVE this recipe.  I made it for a birthday party and everyone has been requesting ever since.  Perfect for football games and holidays. You have to use Parmesan cheese...if you use real parmesan instead of the grained parmesan it doesn't taste as well.  Mix thouroughly, it's delicious! Better than my favorite, Old Chicago.
This was great. I have some really picky eaters around, so I didn't tell them what was in it until they had tried it and loved it. Will make often!
This was wonderful!  My family doesn't like a lot of spinach so I added another can of artichokes and halfed the spinach.
i did not evan try it yet.

This was great and easy.  I used ground beef and pepperoni. I used mozzarella and parmasean cheeses, no cottage cheese and it was delicious.  In four hours, we were ready to eat.  YUM.
Thanks!

5 stars!  I've never made French Onion Soup before, but enjoyed it out at a restaurant. This was easy to make and my husband and I both enjoyed eating this on this cold winter night.  I think next time I will make this using home made beef stock.  The addition of the wine really makes this superb. We both agree this is better than we've ever had at a restaurant!  Thank you so much Brother William for sharing this wonderful recipe!

yum! Definitely a hit. I actually was making this in a prepared 9" pie crust so I halved the recipe and it was the perfect amount. I thought the glaze needed a little extra something, so I mixed in some spices (nutmeg, cinnamon, etc) and lemon juice. Really great recipe, thanks!
Super delicious winter warming soup! Great recipe for a classic! Make much more than you think you need, it will all be gone!

I made these potatoes for our annual Christmas party and they were a hit.  Everyone was asking for the recipe.  They were very cheesy & the potatoes were done to perfection.  I didn't change anything in the recipe.  I followed it exactly.  This will be made often in this house & for other parties in 2008.  Thanks for sharing.

My family loved this soup! I didn't have sherry, so I omitted it, and I substituted fat-free evaporated milk for the whipping cream. I used Eatzi's seafood rub for the seasoning. The result was very smooth and creamy, with a slightly sweet undertone. Delicious!

This was a delicious cake although I find this can't be served without a frosting (not sweet enough). As for the previous reviewer who turned this cake into a hockey puck that will happen to any cake baked at too high of a temperature (anything over 350 is very unusual when baking a cake) and for too long. My cake turned out moist and good.
Strong flavor that I didn't care for...I'm not a picky eater and I love spinach artichoke dip.

Delicous!
Im Australian so I just guessed how much an Oz and an lb was... but it turned out pretty good. Was cooked nicely at 180*celcius for half an hour
These were very good.  Good for using up squash.  Thanks for posting.

The cookies themselves were kind of dry... The dough was crumbly and hard to work with, but I put it in the freezer for a while and that helped. I iced them with a lemon icing (2 cups powdered sugar, a few T. lemon juice to taste) and they were pretty good. I don't think the cookies would have been nearly as good without the glaze.
I thought this was just okay. Don't think I'd make again.
One word...YUMMO!!!!!!!

This was pretty good. I used canned Spinach and doubled the recipe and also ran the whole thing through the food processor. It made a ton of dip which I froze. When I was defrosting it later, I added some mozzerela cheese just because I thought it needed more cheese and it was wonderful the 2nd time too!! Next time, I will add more cheese to begin with and maybe use fresh spinach.
I made this dip for everyone on Christmas Eve and was getting complimented on it all night, I will be sure to use this recipe everytime I make Spinach Dip!
Great!  I didn't have the green onion and it was still awesome.  This is just as good, if not better, than a Chinese restaurant.  Really easy to make.  Thanks!!!

Wonderful added a little crushed red pepper great great with hard crusted bread and butter and Red Cat Wine from Senaca Lake Ny 
Perfect winter Supper
This tasty, creamy soup made for a decadent first meal of the new year.  Excellent recipe!  This is one of our new favorites.
This was a huge hit. I used a local parmesan style cheese, other than that followed the recipe exactly. Lots of compliments and lots of requests for the recipe.

Great recipe and super easy to remember. I made it in muffin tins and two eggs made 12 puddings. I had the left overs with golden syrup like someone had mentioned and it was ohhhhh so good. Thank you!
We loved this pizza.  Very easy to make and my kids say its the best they've ever had! We put the leftovers in the freezer - can't  wait to see how well it freezes.

Thank you SO MUCH for posting this!! I had lost this recipe years ago, and I'm thrilled to have found it again!! One of my favorite bar cookies!! Rich, and just pure HEAVEN!!! My neighbors thank you, too! ;) :)

Fresh tasting, delicious, not too sweet, festive, and serves a crowd inexpensively... exceptional!  I made this punch twice for Christmas gatherings using $4.50 a bottle champagne (or more correctly, sparkling wine) on sale, and liked it so much, it will be my go-to punch recipe from now on.  Along with its other attributes, men and women alike enjoyed it.  Thank you, polar-express, for this classic recipe!  Lynnie
Love this soup. Simple, but great comfort food on a cold winter's day

These muffins are phenominal! They just melt in your mouth - probably because of the shortening. I substituted sour cream for the buttermilk and added some chocolate chips to make them more appealing for the kids, but otherwise followed the recipe. Thanks for the great recipe!

This is a great recipe that my family has made for as long as I can remember. The only difference that I do is that I press the crumbs into the melted butter to form a crust and I save the condensed milk as the last layer that is drizzled in an even coating to bind the other ingredients as well. This is very addicting! Next time I am going to try this recipe with chocolate condensed milk.

This was excellent! My family and I loved the flavor, even my 4 year old son gobbled it all up! I just left out the sesame seeds because we didn't have any on hand but next time I'll definately get some just for this recipe. We will be making this one often, Thanks!

Just wonderful. Tasted very much like my friends Polish mothers tasted.
I cut some of the beets into slightly larger chunks. I also added 1 tsp of vinegar.

This had the potential to be fantastic but I suggest some changes. I found the spinach too stringy and the artichokes too chunky, so next time I'll chop them up. Also, the type of container to bake this in wasn't specified - I used a small casserole dish and found that it didn't heat properly all the way through before the top became quite browned. Next time I'll bake it in a glass pie pan. I will be making this again though, the flavor was great!

Just perfect, exactly what I was looking for.  I omitted the sugar from the sauce, and added a little crushed red pepper for a little bite.  Added some sliced black olives and frozen chopped onions, and it was a hit!

This was a total hit at my new years eve party.  I only bought enough stuff to make one and could have bought enough for three. This was the first to go.  Thanks, this will be added to my appetizer recipes.

This was GREAT!!! Even dear old Dad
(who hates dips) said he could make a meal of this.  The only thing I did different was to use a little fresh garlic and fresh lime juice (didn't have lemon on hand).  Thanks of a wonderful appy recipe!
Traditionally, Pasta Fagioli does not have meat in it and I did not like the addition of meat.  I also did not like the switch from chicken to beef broth.  This is not real pasta e fagioli.
Fantastic!  I didn't have any paprika, so I skipped it and I didn't add the carmel coloring, I just cooked the onions to a deep golden brown. This recipe is definitely a keeper!

I used this as a batter for deep fried Reese's Peanut Butter cups.  I think it would work well with Mars Bars, too.  Just in case you need more sugar, fat, and calories in your diet, and have the urge to shop for bigger pants. :)

Thank you so much for sharing this recipe!  My DH loves hashbrowns and orders them any time we go out to breakfast.  But I have never been able to make them well.  This is the closest I've ever been to what he likes.  Thank you very much.
Very Good!

This was the best alfredo sauce I've ever had!  Next time I might reduce the parm. cheese because it didn't melt and made the sauce a little chunky.  But the taste was still amazing and creamy.  We all loved it!

I only made the sauce, and it was very good and oh so easy to make!  I think next time that I will simmer the sauce for about 5 mins to evaporate the alcohol from the wine and allow the sugar and salt to melt.

The crust that I used is:  http://www.recipezaar.com/80617  I wanted to try it because of it's ease.  It uses baking powder rather than yeast, so there is no kneading and rise time.
Very tasty and easy. I agree that the artichokes need to be chopped up; I also used a pie plate and let the cream cheese soften before mixing.
Excellent cheesecake! The crust was very crumbly though...i am not sure if my grahm crackers were stale or if perhaps there was not enough butter. Overall it was still an excellent and simple recipe!
The recipe is great, but it doesn't make enough sauce. Also, you will need to add something else to give it a kick. I used crushed red pepper.

Mmmmm... These were so yummy.  I will be making these again.  There were very easy too!  Just one thing... It doesn't tell you what temperature to bake them on.  I cooked them on 350 degrees for about 7 minutes.  They came out great!

i really like garlic bread and kind of hooked up to.i only use dried thyme and don't put the cheese also.i put it in the oven without wrapping until it is well toasted and when i don't have italian bread i simply cut pita bread into wedges and use it instead, it works too

we made this as the recipe is written, not making any changes.. apparantly we read the directions wrong, and didn't do several layers. My husband said that he was a bit confused if he should just do the layering once or over and over.
With the cheeses just on top it created a cheese cover and hardly any melted down. My husband wouldn't eat it, but I did. I think had it been mixed up or something it would've been way better.

My first impression of eating scones wasn't good. They were the one's you get at Starbucks, so I was a little aprehensive on trying to make my own, but since I keep hearing how good scones, are I figured I'd give them a whirl. AND AM I GLAD I DID!!!  These were wonderful. Very flavorful, fluffy and not too dry.  Simple to make.  I'll definatly be making these again....and again.  Thanks Mimi!

This was very good and super easy. I cant say enough about how easy this was. (Total cooking time maybe 15 minutes with salad already prepped.) I marinated 2 pieces of salmon for about 8 hours. One piece was larger and thicker than the other. My wife who is not a salmon lover (trying to convince her :), said the small piece was excellent but the larger piece still seemed fishy to her. It was fine for me and my 9 year old son! So like other posters I would agree with a longer marinade time being better. Or maybe next time I will use a vacuume canister for marinade! That said I was using store bought frozen packaged salmon not fresh caught. (sigh) I did use the sesame seeds and they are a perfect compliment to the soy sauce in the recipe. They add a nuttiness that goes perfect with the saltiness of the soy sauce. I had baked potato's left over from the night before, but did'nt want to serve baked potato's again. So I sliced them about 1/4 to 5/8's thick, and in a medium hot skillet with about 3-4 Tbl spoons olive oil I lightly fried the rounds about 4-5 mins then flipped. They were perfectly golden. Just before the second side was done I added a little shredded cheddar to each one (not smothered just a little) and covered them so the cheese would melt. I plated them, put a dot of sour cream in the center of each and garnished with fresh chives. They were crispy on the outside and creamy on the inside. They went over huge! OMG perfect dish salmon, potato's and salad! My son wanted to know why we were eating so fancy lol!

Very very tastey and easy to make.
Thanks for sharing :)
Great taste and light enough to enhance the salad itself.

This review is for the sauce only.  It was easy, inexpensive and tasty.  I reduced the sugar, but it was still a little too sweet.  I will cut it in half next time.  I added garlic and used water rather than wine.  I simmered it on the stove for about five to ten minutes before using.  I'll never buy premade again. :)

I love anything with Alfredo Sauce, and was so happy to find this recipe.  I used the sauce to make a scallop and pasta dish and it went over well with my company that I had last weekend.  Thanks Marg.  It was a BIG hit!  Debbie

this was a staple from childhood that my Grams always had on hand and shipped to me in college. She passed before I could get the recipe. When I tried to make it, there was always something missing. It was the coffee! Thank you so very much I can now share this with my family. :)

We stuck quite close to the recipe, and the 2 of us gave it mixed reviews.  I thought the flavors were marvelous, and would easily award 4 stars.  The blend of tarragon, thyme and rosemary in the breading is sublime; it's the first time I've ever liked anything with tarragon, possibly because we used fresh not dried.  We substituted about half the oil in the vinaigrette with white wine instead, and I thought it tasted a bit like commercial salad dressing; no idea if that's due to the substitution.  I thought it might have been brighter if it used fresh-squeezed lemon juice instead of rice wine vinegar.  The horseradish in the breading practically disappears, but that's a hazard of cooking horseradish; it's always strongest uncooked.  Our big change was that we left our 1.3 lb salmon fillet whole w/ skin on the back, seared both sides, but only breaded the skinless side.  We baked 20 min, and it was still cold raw in the middle.  So then we cut into smaller fillets and broiled about 7 minutes and it was finally done just right.  My SO didn't like the breading... there was a lot of it, and we caked it on heavy since it was only on one side.  She said she might prefer a lighter breading, something Japanese-style, or only use 1c. bread crumbs.  She'd only give this 2 or grudgingly 3 stars.  Probably a recipe we'll experiment with... the herbs were wonderful!

My Dad drives to the nearest Outback every other week (about 1 hour away) just because he LOVES their french onion soup.  So I surprised him and made this when we had my parents over for dinner last night and he LOVED it!  He had 4 bowls of it! I wore swim goggles while I cut the onions!  I made according to the recipe but omitted steps 8,9,10. I also did not use the bay leaf. We served this along with a pork loin and 4 sides and no one hardly touched anything besides the soup!!! We served with Pillsbury Crusty Rolls. LOVE IT!
Very good.  I loved it, but my husband thought it was too sweet (he doesn't have much of a sweet tooth, anyway).  I may tweak it a bit next time....add more soy sauce and less sugar.

I don't like to leave less than 5-stars for a review, so I'm not going to here.  I did think this was just ok.  It was much better after I added a bit of nutmeg to the mix and tons of Powdered Sugar to top.  It's a great basic recipe for a really awful dessert. (Why does everything that tastes so good have to be so bad for you?)  Thanks!
I made this, and it turned out very different from what I was expecting. However, I think that was my fault - my yeast was very old - and the result was still quite tasty.
Nice flavor, really nice color to the soup without using the coloring.
very good cake. I didn't have any lemon cake mix all I had was plain yellow cake mix,so I added the juice of half a lemon to batter. I didn't use the icing and it was still great.

I have tried and failed with previous Yorkshire pudding recipes. This one is so easy to remember and easy to make. I think it is worth noting that 1 cup of eggs is 4 large eggs. Also, I use about 1/4 cup of batter per cupcake tin. It took less than 15 minutes though.

Very moist and tasty.  I didn't have buttermilk, so I used a mixture of milk and sour cream.  I also replaced the sugar with honey and used whole wheat flour.  For half of them, I added cinnamon and raisins (to suit my taste) and for the other half, I added chocolate chips (to please my kids).

I think next time I'll lower the heat a little - they're nicely cooked in middle but a little dark on the outside.

mmm thank you~!
its the first time ive made anything with rhubarb, but it turned out lovely.  i made it in a lined pound cake tin; with half amounts, and also added honey where there was sugar.  baked for 40mins and it came out perfectly done.
I tried this receipe I truly loved it.  I would have seasoned the vegetables a bit more.  This is a new family favorite.  Thank you for sharing.
This recipe works just as well with mixed berries. A tablespoon of vanilla adds a nice touch.
I am making gift baskets for Christmas and thought this would be a wonderful addition.  Great taste! Thx Carrie!

This worked great for us! Next time I will use plain granulated garlic & leave out the additional salt - but this is a fantastic mix with red wine vinegar as well as balsamic/water mix. Thank you Carrie for a great recipe I will use often (ps - DH actually mixed this one up - knock me over with a feather! LOL!)

Great easy mix to have on hand.  I have used it dry to season a roast to cook in a crockpot (yum) and also with the vinegar, oil and water as a DELICIOUS marinade for chicken breast kabobs that we grilled.  Thanks!
Wonderful recipe.  It is so spicy and refreshing.  I had some dry white wine vinegar I used instead of regular.  Sooo good.  Gloria
Wonderful to have the "real" thing on hand without having to start from scratch every time.Tastes great.

Great dressing recipe and so easy to mix together!  I followed the directions for the mix exactly, except that I reduced the amount of salt. I used regular vinegar and vegetable oil for the dressing.  Next time I might try red wine vinegar and olive oil.  Thanks Carrie in Indiana for a great recipe!
This is what is called bannock in New England.  Delicious with butter and a little sprinkle of salt. Great with stewed beans, fried tripe or fried fish.  Love it!  Sally

I loved this dish. My dear old dad found it on here and made it for my boyfriend and I for supper. It was so delicious! Dad likes it better the next day after it has chilled in the refrigerator over night and all of the flavors have blended. Served hot or cold its a hit!

WONDERFUL!  This was actually my first time making spinach artichoke dip and I loved the results.  I cooked ahead of time and added a splash of milk (like others suggested) because I reheated the dish once I got to the party.  I also added a little extra cheese - personal taste.  Served with garlic toast from the bakery.  Thanks for sharing.
This dip was so delicious- better than most restaurant versions! Iâ€™ve taken it to a number of holiday gatherings and have gotten rave reviews. Thanks so much for sharing!
I don't understand how this recipe got such high ratings. I found it totally tasteless. And I followed the recipe exactly. I was really dissappointed.
Oh my god!!! This recipe is so good, light and airy, I love yorkshire pudding and I finally found a recipe that works!!! Thank you!!
quick and easy, but no one would know it!!! Serve over vanilla ice cream and it is to die for! I will make this over and over again.

Wow, I'm gonna have to keep this in freezer this summer.  So refreshing and tasty.  I made this on a whim on day and we all loved it.  This is in the winter so I bet in the summer this tastes great.  I want to try different kool-aid flavors too. Thank you for this yummy treat....STephanie
This is just delicious and such an impressive presentation.  I was surprised how easy it was to find mango sorbet.
FANTASTIC!!! Added some oranges because we didn't have enough lemons. I think I'll be making this for my daughters birthday party!!!

I made the dough for a chicken pot pie and it turned out GREAT! I used butter flavored shortening. I doubled the recipe and saved some aside to make biscuits and gravy for breakfast. Lookin forward to it!!!

My daughter and I love this soup at olive garden so I was anxious to try it...It was better than theirs we thought! The only thing I changed was to add 2 tsp of minced garlic (we love garlic)!!! For the spaghetti sauce I used Classico Spicey tomato basil.  I am making it again this weekend for company! We also cut the recipe in half and it was just fine. Thanks so much for posting!
Great!  This was my first attempt to make Greek dressing and I don't think I would change anything.  It went very well with feta cheese.

Loved the  soup. Recipe was easy to follow.  Didn't use coloring, mine was dark enough. Only change I made was cut out 2 cups of the broth, I like it a bit thicker, and added a splash of worchestershire sauce for a little bite.  Other than that, it was awesome!
Thanks Brother William for a wonderful comfort food.

This is the exact way I make my Alfredo sauce. I think originally, I found it via Kraft. It is so easy, quick and tasty.  Sometimes I add cooked chopped chicken to the last step or sometimes cooked salad shrimp. It is just good as is. Always a green salad dressed with Italian vinaigrette. I do think the canned parmesan cheese is best for this recipe. Perfection!
This is a perfect recipe. Simple, fast, cheap (you can sub canned parm and margarine) and the flavor is sublime.
Excellent soup.  The whole family really enjoyed it!  BTW there was no left overs for tomorrow.
Very good! Easy to make & was loved by all who ate it.

First things first, I DETEST cauliflowers. I do make them for DH and DD but had never reached my mouth.. this recipe made me want to try it. I did't bother with peeling or seeding the tomatoes, I added in a minced garlic clove and a generous pinch of mixed herbs.. I have to admit, it did taste nice... so 5 stars for making me eat cauliflowers! Thank you, Dancer!

Since I'm new to Zaar, I am having so much fun cooking up a storm.  This is one of the recipes I made this past week.  The only change I made was I used Cheddar Jack cheese in place of the Swiss cheese and as part of the Mozzarella.  This dish was delicious to say the least! Excellent choice. If you love pot pie and you love lasagna, this is the recipe for you! Comfort at its best. It's going into my recipe folder right now! Thanks so much for sharing Libby. Karen

Incredibly moist, rich, and yummy.  Easy to make, too!  So it's not terribly healthy...but it's sooooo tasty!  Next time I think I'll try using applesauce and add more walnuts than called for (I like walnuts).  Thanks for such a great recipe!

This meal couldn't be easier to fix, and it is yummy as well. Versatile too -- any dressing or crackers will work.  I used chicken tenders and cooked for about 12 minutes.  The ranch dressing gave the chicken a twist, a nice change from the breaded chicken sauteed in olive oil that had been the usual in my house. Definitely one for those busy weekday nights!
great, best ever!!!

This is a very easy recipe to make.  My husband, son and myself all loved the muffins.  I made nearly 2 dozen, and they didn't last the day, lol. I don't like oatmeal's texture as a cereal, so I am always looking for different ways to get my oats, this will be one of them.  Thanks so much!
excellent.  i also added a bit of worcestshire, and also added a little garlic. used Riesling white wine and dipped sour dough bread.
Family loved these.  Thought they tasted just like the fair ones.  Will add this to the "deserts" on our list
its was good and simple
first off, i replaced cornmeal w/ cornflour, so maybe this is why i had creamy centers...but, it just didnt work for me. Hardly any flavor. :(
These are really great and easy to make.  When I was simmering the blueberries I just cooked until the liquid became thick which was longer than 2 minutes. I will make these over and over again!!!

I found the directions to be a little cumbersome and unclear.  Although the  rice did turn out pretty yummy.  In the ingredient list you did not put the garlic or the celery even though it mentions those items in the directions.  I kinda of improvised a bit.  Thanks for sharing.
Loved this. Melted a little shredded cheese on top w/a little more bacon.

Absolutely delicious.  I used 4 egg whites and 1 whole egg, added one extra banana and cut down on the butter a little bit because of it, used 2/3 cup of Amaretto and omitted the almonds because I didn't have any on hand.  Even with my substitutions the cake still came out so moist and perfect!  To make a glaze I boiled 1/4 cup sugar and 1/8 water with some almond extraxt and then poured it over the hot cake; it gave it a nice crispy, sugary glaze on top.  The only change I'll make next time is to let it sit for a day before serving because I found the almond flvouring really came through when I had a piece a day later instead of the day it was made.  I think this will definitely become a family favourite!

My changes: (1) used 1 cup mozzarella and 1 cup shredded parmesan cheese, (2)chopped the artichokes in the food processor, (3) used 2 tsp. garlic powder.  Awesome!  I made it the night before, then just heated it in the oven right before serving.  Easy and awesome!
I made these a while ago and forgot to rate them then. I remember thinking I wouldn't make them again.
very yummy.  I thoghut it was just sweet enough and my daugher, with the healthy sweet tooth nearly finished the dish.  I don't like sickly sweet stuff.
A very inexpensive meal option.  I only added a little chopped red pepper (I don't keep pimientos on hand)for color.  We served over toast and had a salad to round out the nutrition.
Absolutely fantastic soup.  Impossible to mess up, even better, it makes itself.  Referred this to many friends who have trouble in the kitchen and it continues to please.

I let it marinate for 8hrs and it was great.  My DH said it was the best salmon he had ever had. Definite keeper! I didn't have sesame seeds so I ground up some hazelnuts and the flavor blended perfectly.
I also used this to make the Crock Pot Cream Cheese Chicken recipe #12458 and it worked perfectly.  Thank you very much for posting such a useful mix.

I made this last night, and we really enjoyed it.  I had no idea 'real' alfredo sauce was so incredibly easy!  I used margerine, whipping cream, and unfortunately had to use the 'fake' parmesan cheese.  The flavor was excellent, and the sauce wasn't too heavy, but my 'cheese' never melted and made the sauce extremely grainy.  I served it with fettucinni and broiled chicken breast with a side of broccoli and garlic bread.  Would have been perfect if not for the sauce texture!  We will definitely be making this again, with REAL parmesan cheese, and at that time I hope to upgrade my rating to a 5!  Thanks for posting!

This is the recipe I already had and have used for about two years, but I saw the picture made in the bread bowl.  Awesome idea!
The dip is everyone's fave at family get togethers!
Loved it!!  Made it twice this week and ate both batches myself.

Excellent! Two people asked me for the recipes, which is a lot bc most people won't make pizza dough from scratch.  I added herbs when I kneaded.  I made lots of personal sized pizzas and put out toppings and let my 16 adult guests make their own pizzas.  I was a great success.  I had two batches not rise bc I made the water too hot.  I made those batches also and we ended up with a decent crunchy crust.  Thanks so much for sharing.

This was soooo good.  I used chicken stock for the water, and added some cajun seasoning and lots of black pepper.  I also thickened this with a roux of bacon grease and flour.  No lack of flavor.  Served with green salad and homemade warm french bread this was a great dinner for my daughter's 19th birthday.  We will be having this again.  And I saw some large shrimp in the freezer so that will be a last minute addition next time...

Great fried rice, we enjoyed it very much! i would like to give it the 5 it deserves but I don't feel I can because just as i was puting it on the table i noticed the eggs on the counter, "set aside". The recipe does not mention what to do with them after setting aside.  I added them at the last minute to the serving bowl. I will be making it again, we loved it, thanks for posting it!

This was really, really good. I baked mine in a sourdough bowl like Jenlyn did, and it was awesome. I replaced the 2 C of parmesan with 2 C of reduced-fat mozzarella, and added a bit of shredded parmesan to it after that. I also used reduced-fat mayo, Neufchatel cheese, and light sour cream. It tasted wonderful; just as good as you would get at any restaurant. Thanks for this recipe!

This recipe is very good. I used Heart Smart Bisquick instead of the biscuit mix and I used Splenda sugar blend to help cut down on the fat. Next time I will use diet 7-up to help in that area, other wise the recipe was great, family loved it.
This cookie baked up nice and fluffy.  Looked and smelled wonderful.  My daughter loved the cookie dough. Very easy, to make.  I added a whole bag of chocolate chips.

A big hit and easy to make. I mixed everything but the spinach and artichoke the night before. I then added them and put them in the quiche dish and placed it in the oven. It cooked while I set up. Everyone loved it too! Thank you

Yummy muffins! I cut the recipe in half, used whole milk and a whole egg.  DH is not fond of blueberries so I filled 3 muffins cups before folding 1/4 cup berries into the remaining batter. Topped the plain muffins with cinnamon sugar.
This was wonderful! Reminded me of these delicious desserts I used to eat as a kid, but can't find anymore. Thanks!
wonderful & easy!

OMG!!  I made this with corn on the cob and twice baked  potatoes.  This was easy to make, and VERY, VERY tasty.  I will definately make this again.  I would not be ashamed to fix this for a big family get together, or friends over....yummy.

The perfect soup. My whole family loved it. I had to triple the batch the second time I made it so people could have more. When I serve it I sprinkle just a little bit more cheese on the top with the parsley.
Loved this Pie!  So easy and very tasty!

To us the soup "was missing something".....we added a little onion powder, and some cumin, and some garlic salt, but it still was missing something.
We didn't add the White Wine, as we forgot to pick it up at the store, so maybe that was it...
Otherwise it tased pretty good, onions were sweet and not an overpowering onion flavor, and once we ate it with some cheese and croutons it was even better...
still trying to figure out what its missing though.....hmmmmmm
Delicious!!  Absolutely loved it!  I used the chocolate icing from recipe #27144 & sprinkled slivered almonds on top.  Went together perfectly!

I've never had Lentil Dal before. It was fairly bland to me, from my experience with curry type dishes. I do love the idea that it is a healthy vegetarian dish.  I would make it again for myself since I love to eat healthy, but I would never make it for company or a hot date.

This recipe was so simple.  I used chicken thighs instead of boneless breast, and added a little chili powder and it was just perfect.  Thanks for sharing.  I will definatly make this again.  My boyfriend said it was dynamite.

Outstanding!    I too traded the garbanzo beans for Great Northern, and I cut the recipe in half.  I also opted to cook the pasta separately, then add as served.   Easy prep work too.   Have been looking for a good Minestrone for a long time.   I'm done looking!     Thank You Joy.

This was so good.  I doubled the batch.  I only used two jalapenos because other reviews said it was too spicy.  I added one more jalapeno because there was no heat to it at all.  This is like authentic mexican salsa.  Thank you WildlifeDi!!
this was a great recipe
