I used white wine vinegar instead of the cider vinegar.  I increased the salt by 1/8 teaspoon and I added 1/16 teaspoon ( 1/2 of an 1/8 teaspoon) of dry mustard.  It even has an eggy aftertaste - where did THAT come from?!  I'm not sure how convincing, to me, it would be on a mild sandwich like turkey.  Maybe with a more intensely flavored meat like salamis or ham.  Add a little horseradish to it and I think it would make a very good spread for a roast beef sandwich.  I can't wait to try this in my potato salad recipe!  I'm very glad I tried this recipe!  Thank you for posting it!

Just recipe. The batter just swelled up right away as soon as it hit the oil. Got my kids excited just  to end up throwing it all in the trash because the inside was nothing but a gooey mess. I absolutely do NOT recommend this recipe.
Delicious!!! I added a small minced red bell pepper, then poured it over chicken breasts with some panko breadcrumbs on top. Covered with foil and baked for 15 extra minutes..so good!

I am watching the dish bubble in the oven right now. Thanks for a good way to feed the family some of the fruits of the garden. I tweaked the recipe some, but nothing worth mentioning here. I will likely try this recipe again.
This is probably the best spinich artichoke dip I have ever eaten. Both my husband and I agree on this; and we rarely agree on food. Lol
Awesome just as is. Sweet and succulent. My husband approved. Thank you for sharing!
should the flour be in ounces or grams , not mls lol

I used organic brown rice and quinoa pouche instead of rice. The rice and quinoa is  precooked with additional seasoning. Added finely chopped brococoli and carrots for nutrition. My picky husband liked it?

Very nice way to avoid pasta, if one chooses. I felt like there was excessive tomato paste and not enough water. I also added a little sweetening to offset the acidity of the tomatoes. Put more cheese on top and a little Parmesan. We enjoyed it paired with a green salad.
Fantastic. Just finished a dinner of these. Wifey says this recipe is a keeper. I found the filling was just right for 3 1/2 peppers which is great cause there's only 2 of us.

First time making stuffed peppers. I'm very new to cooking anything! Been at it only a few months. Strong recipe.  I made a few modifications to mine to suite taste - 

1. Used 1 teaspoon of soy sauce instead of straight salt. It gave some additional flavor to the meat with less salt.
2. Instead of chopped bell peppers in the filling. I used chopped serrano chillies. We like our food very hot!
3. I Added 2 teaspoons minced garlic to the filling.
3. After baking, I topped with a spicy maraneria sauce and Mozzarella cheese and placed back into thr oven until the cheese was melted.

I FINALLY got cudos from my guy for my cooking. He said it was the best I have cooked to date. Usually he throws away my left overs... Tonight he packed the left overs for lunch tomorrow!

Thank you for your help!
Great - v useful for the brown rice/stock ratio for over baking. Thanks

These are amazing. They are so simple, yet the flavour is fantastic. Brought me back to Holland as a kid. Have made them several times since finding this recipe. The grandkids are picky eaters and they love them.

Love that I can now have funnel cake whenever I want with this recipe :) It's so easy and I always have the ingredients on hand. I made a slight mistake and poured the wet ingredients into the dry (not the other way around as stated), which made a big clumpy mess :S However, a little extra milk smoothed it all out...Thanks for posting the recipe!
We add fresh sausage and cheater ,Also sauteed in 1teasp bacon dipping . Totally awesome.

These are best when hot out of the oven. We didn't enjoy the cooled muffins nearly as much.   The texture was perfect, not too crumbly with the perfect density.  If I make them again, I may add just a touch of sugar.  I felt they may be improved with just a little added sweetness.  Served with skillet okra, tomatoes and rice.
Wasn't sure if I was going to like this but went great with Wasabi salmon cakes.  Loved it.
I've done this recipe many times. Best of all. I add citrus zest for more taste. for VEGAN version: 2 flax seed "eggs" and I used almond milk with 1 tbs of cider vinegar. Raise well.

I like this recipe quite a bit, and it's great for low-carbers who can eat it with celery or a spoon, (or a shovel)!  I've made numerous artichoke dip recipes, but I've always been partial to recipes that include cream cheese.  I put the cream cheese in the microwave for 1 minute to soften it before mixing it.  With this recipe I also added 1/4 cup of onion and 1/4 tsp crushed red pepper for a little "kick".  You can also get that kick if you add more garlic or even a little bit of jalapeno, but I just thought I'd spice it up a bit.  It's very good on its own, but try variations and see what you like best.  :)

This recipe was awesome.   Did add extra garlic by previous reviews.  Also added mushrooms ( had to eat them up). But even my pasta loving husband loved it.  Told me to please make it again.  Thanks so much for sharing.

GREAT RECIPE!
I used buttermilk & brushed the tops with buttermilk before baking.
I cut mine very thick - 2-3" and increased the baking time to 17 mins.
They're light, fluffy - look the way you want biscuits to look.
This is an addictive snack! Make sure to cook for a large crowd, otherwise you will eat it all yourself.
This is so yummy!  Great for both adults and kids...and extra points for a creative name.

The creaminess and texture of this was good but it was a bit bland (and I had added a good bit of black pepper). You wouldn't think something with this much cheese would need any salt, but it does. I'll be adding salt and red pepper flakes to the leftovers!

I have only ever used frozen yorkshires or the packet you mix with egg and water , I always assumed they were hard to make since that's what I've been told, but it's a holiday and all the stores were closed so I decided to try this recipe, it turned out perfect! The Yorkshire puddings puffed up beautifully and tasted amazing. The only thing I did different is follow reviewed advice and use only 3 eggs and mix the batter an hour or so before I needed to use it. I will be bookmarking this recipe!

I am not one to bake or make bread, but I came across this cornbread recipe and was so delighted with how easy it is to put together. It is crispy, light and very tasty.  My Portuguese friends loved it, too!

Awesome. The beauty of this recipe is its simplicity and adaptability. As other have mentioned, they made their adjustments. I used butter, more salt, half and half and some fish stock along with the water(I also made about 1.5X the recipe). Classic chowder that you can adapt to your liking.

Just made this bread yesterday and I had to make more today. I initially made this for my picky eater son for a snack. But once my husband got a hold of it see Ya later. This bread is amazing and the batter is enjoyable as well.

I just made this, and am another delighted fan! I substituted plain Greek yogurt and a pinch of stevia for 1/2 cup of the mayo, and I used chives instead of the spring onions. DEE-lightful! Certainly a keeper, thank you.

I made this for dinner last night in an effort to get DH to enjoy baked squash. He is not a fan of winter squash.  I cut the squash in half instead of thirds and used I can't believe it's not butter light.  I goofed and put 1 tablespoon of maple syrup in each half but it was delicious and perfect that way.  I chose not to add the cinnamon and nutmeg since I mostly wanted the flavor of the squash.  My husband likes a sweet taste but I prefer just butter, salt and pepper on my squash.  This was a simple, tasty solution to please us both since the maple syrup gives a lovely flavor with the butter without all the sweetness of brown sugar.  We both ate an entire half, I call this success!  It took much longer than  45 minutes to bake and I also put a small amount of water in the bottom of the baking dish and did not cut a piece off the bottom, they sat at only a slight angle and were fine.  I took a fork at the end to each half and blended the squash and pool or butter and maple syrup together for the perfect marriage in every bite!  I also added a touch of salt to my half.  This is how I will bake my squash from now on!

I switched up and used a can of diced tomatoes with garlic...basil...and oregano....and some sharp cheddar I had in fridge ....also used red, yellow nd green peppers came out great will definitely make again.

Having tried many meatloaf recipes, my family liked this traditional one best. For a moister version, I cook 10 mins less. I also use Italian breadcrumbs in the meatloaf and substitute minced garlic for some of the onion. For the gravy,  I also decreased flour and upped the wine for a thinner, more flavorful gravy. It made great hot leftovers and was also yummy for cold sandwiches.

Lovely. I've made this twice now, and will certainly make it many more times. :-) Once I did not have the bean sprouts, so I substituted cucumber and celery for them. This is so light and healthy. Thanks!
The filling is good but my mirange didn't set up. I followed the instructions.
Greatly disappointed. They were rather blase and flavorless. Even added cinnamon and vanilla to give it some flavor and it still didn't work. I was hoping for more.

Me and fiance both loved this! I cooked the rice for about 25 mins. Still wasn't fully cooked but the oven finished cooking it. Also, my can of diced tomatoes had zesty green peppers in it :) would be good to add queso fresco on top.

This dip was fantastic! Not a drop was left! I did take the advice of other reviewers, and I added a little, Italian blend, cheese for extra creaminess. I will be making this dip for every occasion from now on!

Following someone else's advice, i added quote a but more salt to bring out the flavors. Also added Chipotle Tobasco sauce. Abt a tablespoon I guess. It turned out so amazing. YUM YUM. too bad ground beef doesnt photograph as well as it tasted! :)

Delicious, but I added fresh garlic mixed with cooking the beef, onions and chopped peppers. I also used diced tomatoes with chili peppers as I didn't the regular tomatoes. Both ingredients were a wonderful addition.

I made this last night for a get together and there was none left because it was so good. My favorite is Chilis Artichoke Dip so I made a few slight changes. I wanted a slight bite to it so I added a small pinch of red pepper flakes. Once the dip was spread in casserole I sprinkled shredded mozzarella and cheddar on top so it would have a crunchy gooey top.  I served with tortilla chips. Perfect combination of cheesey, spice and salt. Enjoy!
Very yummy and so easy!

I assumed a single batch wouldn't make a lot so I doubled it. Boy was I wrong! I had so much dip it was coming out of our ears. Lol. Thanks to the previous reviews I froze more than half of the dip. This is a wonderful recipe and has awesome flavor.
I need help I'm making the starter mix and following the instructions, but this morning I found mold on the inside of the bowl. now what.
Very blan. I was hoping better I'd give it a 2 out of 10
Like another reviewer I have also made this recipe for years.  The recipe was in my Better Homes and Gardens cookbook.  It is the best recipe I have ever found for stuffed peppers.

I hate being negative but I found this dish quite flavourless and (sorry) very boring. It definitely has potential with a serious adjustment to the spices used and their amounts. The dish need not be spicy but it does have to be flavouful and unfortunately, this one missed the marked.

This recipe can either be 5 stars or 1 star... depending on one ingredient: the parmesan cheese. I've made this recipe countless times. The very first time I tried this recipe, I used that dry parmesan that you find in the pasta aisle instead of the refrigerated cheese section. It was so gross, I had to throw the whole thing out. I didn't get why so many people had reviewed the recipe so highly. Years later, I thought I'd give it another try but use fresh shredded parmesan instead... 5 STARS!! It's my no fail dish for potlucks, always a guaranteed hit!! I usually have to double the recipe because it finishes so quickly.
This is amazing! I definitely will make it again!
Absolutely great!

I made this recipe and my family loved it even my picky teenager.  I didn't save it unfortunately and I have been trying to find it and now I have.  Trust me this is one you will make over and over remember to SAVE IT!.  It's easy to make, tasty to eat, and beautifully appetizing.  I am made them for a potluck dinner last weekend and they were a big hit,  Top them with a little parsley and finely diced tomatoes.  Yumm ? a must try
I followed this to the T. While I thought it to be OK, to me it's not worth all the work. I can get just as good or what I consider better with a lot less work.
This was a great sauce to put on pasta when I had little time to make dinner. So quick! I also added crushed garlic to the sauce and garnished with parsley. SOOO YUMMY!

I made this salad because I didn't have all the ingredients for my other salad.  I'm glad I got to try this recipe out!  I am not leaving stars because I used cool whip and didn't add grapes. The apples were a nice addition; everyone that tried it liked it.  Thank you!

This is a very good recipe. I'm not a fan of sweet potatoes.  I made this for DH and he ate a whole pie (over the course of a few day:).  Took one to work and got rave reviews.  I like the addition of orange zest.  Gave it a nice subtle flavor.

What with the wine/vinegar, jelly and sugar, this recipe is reminiscent of German sauerbraten.  I did make a number of changes but nothing that would have substantially changed the outcome.  This flavor does not appeal to us.  The recipe itself is straightforward, except for the omission of the vinegar among the ingredients, and the recipe does work.  There's no accounting for taste, I guess.

My only problem with this recipe is that I now have to try really hard to not be a little snot when someone else makes a chocolate pie; I want to tell them their pie is alright but my new recipe is so much better. WOW!! 10 stars! I like pie, but I love this one, and it is now the pie I have to make for every event because it's just too good to pass up an opportunity to eat it. So rich and thick. Had no trouble getting it to set up. Very easy to make if you're handy with a whisk. I was careful to add the mixture to my yolks very gradually. And keeping my whites refrigerated seemed to help the meringue set up better. I've made it with and without crust and love it both ways.

So disappointed. I've made this pie before with a different recipe. Decided to try this one for a dinner party because of the high star rating. It was far too sweet and I followed this recipe exactly. The sugar completely drowned out the buttery flavor that this pie should have. I could hardly eat it and I noticed many left portions of it on their plate. I won't bother to modify. Going back to my original recipe.

I am not the best chef but this was easy to make and was the hit of Thanksgiving appetizers. Everyone loved it and ate way too much! Will definitely become my staple party contribution from now on. 
I did use fresh spinach just because I forgot to thaw my frozen spinach. Came out delicious!

I made this yesterday, having purchased a beef/pork ground meat mixture, although I have not made meatloaf for years. Since it would just be my husband & I, I decided to halve the recipe, which accommodated the approximately 1 pound package of ground meat. I also halved the breadcrumbs, but left the rest of the ingredients unchanged. As the mixture seemed a bit dry, I also added 1 more egg. Unfortunately, I didn't think to reduce the cooking time, with the result that the meatloaf was a bit blackened around the edges (the dog enjoyed those bits with his dinner). The gravy was excellent (I messed up the directions, but was able to salvage it). I would recommend this recipe unreservedly, with just a word of warning about the cooking time. We really enjoyed it!
I just used broth and cream for a little richer flavor, it turned out wonderfully.  Thank you!
YUM! I spooned about 1 tbsp of this mixture into mini fillo shells and baked in the shells. Made a super yummy finger food!

A friend has made this twice recently for get togethers.  Parmesan is WAY too overpowering for me.  It's the only thing I can taste.  It's also way too rich and heavy for my liking in an appetizer.  i notice many of the 5 star reviews subbed half or all of the Parmesan...which makes it a whole different recipe IMO.  Sorry I'm not loving this more.

Hate to disappoint everyone, but this is not the original Famous Barr's French Onion Soup Recipe. Living very close to St. Louis, I had a friend who worked downtown making the French Onion Soup.  It was a (2) day process to make, but well worth the time it took. I have the original recipe but promised my friend I would never give it out.

Tasted awesome except rice was not all the way done. I even added more time and more chicken broth instead of water for rice to cook. I used turkey instead of beef. Yum! Will cook again but precook rice I think.
I'm made this pie a number of times.  Just made it again tonight.  Love, love love it!  No changes necessary to this recipe!  The author was right in that pies are supposed to be sweet!!!

plan to try this tonight, the stars are for your great intro and my anticipation of using your recipe and mine (Mother's Clam Chowder - Manhattan Style). She grew up in New York and talked about the FFM. Thank you for sharing all this!
Perfect recipe! I use red and yellow peppers instead
Quick and easy recipe. I added a crust (par-baked pie crust)  and used 1 C Mushrooms and whatever shredded cheese I had on hand.  Looks good so far, it isn't out of the oven yet.
Love how these turned out, i wanted them to have more of a Mexican flavor so I added some red enchilada sauce and a bunch of cheese. Love this so much!

I've made this delicious Steak and Kidney Yorkshire Casserole twice and it is becoming a favorite. I love the flavor that the kidneys add and am fortunate that my hubbie does too..truly a great and filling dinner..comfort food for the cold winter! Thanks for sharing! I added peas and served with roasted mashed turnip..yum!

I really do not like to cook. Very rarely do things "taste good" when I cook. I'm a very lucky woman because my husband does like to cook. So I know we won't starve. But I did it! I actually made something that tastes great and was really easy. That's another issue is that I lose interest so it has to be easy and quick! Yummy stuff.

By far the worst directions of any recipe I have ever seen.  I'm assuming that these have to rise?  How long? No, you can't just add the dried yeast to the dry ingredients!  Why does thus take 1:13 minutes?  If you are going to post a recipe, actually post enough information to be useful.
not a good recipe.....no butter...just sweat onions....add burgundy wine and fresh garlic cook untill wine gone....add BEEF stock...simmer and add sherry and brandy ....simmer and taste season
This is a no fail recipe!!!! I made the original recipe and it was absolutely delicious!! Had leftover and mixed w/pasta, shrimp, olive oil, white wine, and butter....wow??????

I made slutty brownies with this cookie recipe and it turned out even better than when I make cookies from scratch! I used yellow cake mix and Hersey kisses morsels. I'm recommending this recipe to anyone who asks :)
Delicious and easy! Though not particularly healthy

I am glad this recipe taught me how to blanch the peppers, but aside from that and reading all the reviews for how to liven it up, this recipe was not great at all.  As other reviews suggested, I used precooked rice. I tasted the meat mixture before stuffing the peppers and was very disappointed. I added some garlic and a TON of taco seasoning to try and spruce it up. Even after that, it still felt like it was missing something. Good try but it was very boring as the original recipe.
This was very good. I used Rotel tomatoes, and my rice was still a bit crunchy, so next time I will be cooking the rice seperately.

This is great, but I have to deduct a star for the sauce amount.  I had doubled the sauce for the marinade and it was sucked up almost instantly when thrown in the pan.  Did another double batch of sauce, threw it in and it was still not enough.  Next time will just do 6 times the amount of sauce, which I think would be perfect, especially if your serving over rice.  Great flavor though!!
very good simple recipe. I also had a small amount of allspice and i top it off with 1 cup of mozzarella.

Thank you, I use to to eat at Famous Barr every time we visited my aunt in St. Louis. In 1984 I moved to St.Louis from Calif. and the first place I went was Famous Barr and left there with a job.I have tried for to many years to get this recipe with much failure. I wont try any one else's no one can compare and I only got disappointed so I stopped. I have waited 32 years for this I have Cancer and so will cook this ASAP again thank you if you stay with recipe dont change a thing you will never try another.

I've tried this one previously and just changed the vegetable oil to peanut oil.  Everyone loved the cornbread muffins and came back for more.  Some drizzled honey over the buttered cornbread muffins, too.  YUMMY!
The batter was way too thick and  lacked flavor,  disappointing:(

Yorkshire Pudding, as stated by Chef is authentic when you don't measure the grease left in roasting pan, and just pour batter in pan. Never open oven door until at least ten minutes into cooking. Remember to take the roast out of the pan first though, as I have heard of that.
My nanny Watters even made it out of roast chicken, and it was great also. This dish was made as far back as the early 16th Century, as Elizabeth 1 cooks had the recipie on file. I call it Glasgow Pudding personally as Elizabeth 1 was one of the meanest ladies of that era, along with her step sister Bloody Mary. It originated up in the Highlands of Scotland when England gave us flour.

I just made this last night and everyone really liked it. We are trying to reduce sugar and carbs where ever we can so we cut the amount of sugar in half and used 1 cup instead of the  2 cups speceified in the recipe. It was moist and still sweet enough for us and completely satisfied our chocolate craving. I also used while wheat flour and coconut oil instead of vegetable oil. Will definitely make again.

Great recipe, I made just a few minor changes. Increased the carrots to 4 cups (grated) and used nutmeg and allspice in addition to the cinnamon. I had a crazy idea and cooked the batter in my WAFFLE IRON. It turned out wonderful.
I'm a complete scone addict and these were some of the best scones I've ever tasted!! Soft, not too sweet and jam packed with plenty of juicy blueberries. Perfection!

Awful. Didn't hold together. Made recipe to the tee. Yes. Oil was hot. Added more flour. The ones that held together we're so bland. I was more disappointed than my kids. Still on the hunt for a good recipe.
Simple, easy and versatile. This recipe suits everyone from pros to beginners like me.

I made these using Rotel tomatoes 1.5 cans using the original and the mild. I also added Mexican cheese in the dish. Before placing in the oven I sprinkled cheese on the top of each one. They were great.
I love the authentic alfredo sauce. I also like to pack a little extra protein in there for my kids by blending a couple soft-boiled eggs into the sauce, which also makes it a bit thicker.
Perfection
This recipe is delicious! Very creamy and easy to make. However, I used mozarella cheese instead of parmesan but it still was great, would definitely make it again!

So yummy...I never stick to the recipe, thus added a couple cloves of garlic and corn to meat mixture, 8 oz can tomato sauce, 2 TSP of Montreal steak seasoning (spicy) which had me eliminate salt and pepper, pre-par cooked Jasmine rice by using 3/4 cup water instead of 1 cup water, 1 TSP Italian seasoning, 3 TSP Worcestershire, a mix of parmesan and Colby jack cheese, and Italian bread crumbs on top. My boyfriend requested I make them weekly now!

So good, I made it 7 weeks in a row and never got sick of it. I use ground cumin, frozen cauliflower florets, canned diced tomatoes and add 1 tsp of veggie Better than Bouillon to the water. I also let it cook on med-high for 15-20 minutes and the lentils turn out nice and mushy like at restaurants. I rave about this recipe to everyone I know.

Good, but needs tweaking. First of all like one of the reviewers said, start out slow with the sugar. I began with one tablespoon of sugar and instead relied on the salt content to bring out the sweetness of the tomatoes. I also added some red onion and together with the additional salt, it was fabulous; no need for all that sugar.

I feel great about feeding this to my family and even my veggie hating, picky child liked it! We did modify the recipe by using venison instead of beef. We didn't add any other spices but did use more of the spices the recipe called for. After putting it in the baking dish, we decided ours needed more veggies to complete the second layer so we were able to use some pre-steamed leftover veggies from a frozen mix we buy including yellow and orange carrots, and red bell pepper. We sauteed fresh green bell pepper along with the meat, onion, and other ingredients. I can definitely see us making this again.

I didn't have ground beef, so I used ground turkey and just added more seasoning. I also had to use a bit more water for the rice to cook thoroughly. I also added some chopped jalepeno peppers and a dab of hot sauce. and some grape tomatoes. First time ever making stuffed peppers and I think they turned out really well
I made this earlier this evening. Delicious, I added 1 cup mozzarella cheese. Toasted a baguette. I didn't bother eating what I cooked for dinner, I had a big bowl of the dip instead.

This is my go to base recipe for stuffed peppers. I give it 4 stars only because it doesn't have enough flavour. To the rice mixture I add some extra seasoning - italian blend, dried basil, fresh cilantro, some pasta sauce, a bit of sugar and a healthy dose of sriracha hot sauce. I have no problem with rice cooking, but I will also note I use 19oz can of tomatoes, which may give the rice the extra liquid to cook. I love to make this at lunch and pop it in fridge till supper time for an easy meal later, so this would be great to bring to a family potluck and just pop it in oven when you get there!

I also tweaked it a bit... i used 1.5 cups of mozzarella and 1 cup of pamersan and after i put it in the casserole dish (which i buttered the sides of) i topped it with more mozzarella. Its amazing and i have made this about 5 times already!

I have made this recipe and sautéed the green onions with the mushrooms. Then removed and sautéed the chicken breasts which I did not cover during cooking. Made my sauce in the same pan and poured over my chicken. I just had the butcher cut chicken breasts in half. Did not pound them. I baked for approximately 30 minutes covered and they came out great! The sauce is excellent!
I made muffins instead of bread, because I don't have a bread pan. I baked them for about 17 minutes, and they turned out terrific!
This turned out great!! I'm hooked! Thanks for posting this quick, easy, and satisfying recipe.
My whole family really enjoys this meal! We add carrots to it and it is fantastic! It taste great and you taste so much healthier than eating out....

WOW! This. Tastes. Amazing! I didn't have two loaf pans, so I baked this as a sheet cake (for 39 minutes) after adding an extra 2/3 cup or so of shredded zucchini. The cake had the perfect consistency throughout and was unbelievably moist and delicious. I don't typically like cinnamon with chocolate, but in this case it actually gave cake a deeper flavor profile with a very subtle spice undertone. Then I frosted the cake with regular creamy peanut butter and the taste went from amazing to EPIC! This recipe's definitely a keeper!

I made this today for the first time, I improvised on the recipe. I used some leftover Spanish rice from the other night. I added dehydrated onions and garlic instead of chopping them up. I used petite diced tomatoes 14oz. I also added in a little frozen corn. Cooked it 30 mins covered with aluminum foil. Then I took off the aluminum foil and turn up the heat to make the cheese a little crisp. Next time I might make with Ground Turkey to lower the calorie content.

Excellent zucchini bread recipe that's not too sweet. I did add 3/4 cup of chocolate chips to one of the loaves and enjoyed the added texture (and additional chocolate content! :)). One hour baking time was perfect.

I have made this recipe maybe 20 times and it is always a hit! If I am lazy or super rushed I substitute the minced garlic for garlic powder and it is just as good. 5 stars.... Thank you so much for sharing this recipe!
I wish I could give 0 stars. This is a horrible version of this and was a waste of time and money. The proportion of Parmesan cheese is way off. It should be more like 1/4 cup than 2 3/4 cups
Delicious! I used one of the adaptations I read and added fresh chilli and rosemary to give it an extra kick!
Pretty simple. Surprisingly good for the few number of ingredients.

I made these blueberry scones for a high tea for young girls 8-12 yrs old. They are very tasty and look nice, but my large fresh blueberries burst while baking. When the scones cooled they were fine, but quite a bit of blueberry was left on the parchment paper. I agree w/Chef Swifticus suggestion to up the lemon zest & sugar. I added lemon glaze to the top of my batch.
This was just okay. Needed salt, and a little more heat. Ended up adding some extra spices.
All I did was just add a bit extra water and juice out of the 24 oz. can of diced tomatoes, the rest of the tomatoes I froze. Added season salt, steak spice and pepper. next time I'll add more salt.

These were delicious! I added many more seasonings that the recipes states while cooking the ground beef in the skillet because I prefer well-seasoned food (i.e. Soul seasoning from Shoppers, garlic powder, garlic salt, season salt, etc.). Also, I incorporated both mozzarella cheese and cheddar cheese in the beef mixture and on top. **Helpful hint: Make sure when you arrange the peppers on the baking sheet before putting them in the oven, that you pack them tightly side-by-side or else they will tip over. A couple times while they cooking I had to open the oven and reposition them, which all could have been avoided... Although this may have only happened before I packed so much beef mixture into each pepper. I wanted so much of the deliciousness in one serving! :-)
This was a really good recipe. But what I would do is make a double batch.
We looooove this recipe...easy and delicious ��

This has been my go-to recipe for the past 6+ years! It's the perfect accompaniment to crab...not too overpowering. Good bread is necessary! The only two additions I make are 2 tbsp grated onion mixed in with everything else and a sprinkling of Old Bay (or J.O.'s) on the top before baking. NOTE: If you pick the crabs yourself and they have been steamed in Old Bay, DO NOT add the old bay or garlic salt or it gets WAY TOO SALTY!) If you want to freeze to save for another night, be sure to bake it but not for the whole time—closer to 20/25 mins—then you can reheat in the microwave or toaster. If you don't cook it it ends up separating. I usually split the recipe and have half that night and half the next weekend. Enjoy!

I have made these twice and they are wonderful! Both times I used the exact ingredients and "eyeballed" the measurements. I would highly recommend mixing the cheese into the rice/tomato/meat mixture near the last few minutes of the simmer. It really helps the peppers not rely on just the cheese on the top :)

I struggled with making biscuits most of my adult life. I used this recipe and they were delicious!! The only change was reducing the salt and sugar because I used salted butter instead of shortening. I made mine a little thicker and it made 6 large biscuits. I am so thrilled with this recipe.
I added a tin of tomato paste mixed with water. This made the sauce thicker and a very nice tomato flavor. I also added some additional spices.
I love stuffed peppers...the ONLY NEGATIVE is that it says use uncooked, long grain rice. I did and they were very UNDERCOOKED. Please precook your rice or are we supposed to use Minute Rice?
I made this a couple of weeks ago and we loved it. Making it again tonight. I did not use the tomato paste and we grilled the zucchini. It was awesome! Great recipe.

This recipe was great. I used 3/4 of suggested sugar and red bell pepper. Wanted a thicker base for accompanying lyonnaise so added canned tomato sauce and tubed tomato paste. Got rave reviews! Definitely a new staple. Will add red onion next time based on the other reviews. One question, has anyone frozen?
Good recipe, but they tasted bland to me. They need more flavor.
I lerterally just made this sauce before I read this post. I made coffee bbq sauce and googled it and this is the exact same ingredients minus I added home made hot sauce. Mind blown

This is a verbatim ripoff of a recipe published by Taste of Home magazine. It is disappointing. The result is a pie that is neither a good apple pie nor a good pumpkin pie, but a mediocre blend of the two that you wish were just one or the other. Do not waste your time. It's a fair amount of work for something middling -- in the same amount of time you can bake a fabulous pumpkin pie AND a fabulous apple pie.

I recently returned from Ireland and loved so many of their dishes . So this was my first attempt to make something Irish in my Kitchen . As always I follow my first try at a new recipe to the letter. Results : The flavor was great ! The liquid should have been more so the beef stew could have cooked longer since it was not tender enough . Next time I make this yummy stew I will cook it in a slow cooker using more Guiness and broth ( also I will use chicken broth since I feel it offers more flavor )

So easy to make and so delicious! I absolutely love this recipe and it's always a huge hit with everyone. I got a medium sized funnel from the car parts department at a store. It smoothly goes through the funnel to make perfect cakes. Just add a little extra small splash of milk if the batter seems like it may be a bit too thick.

Highly recommend this tried and true recipe. I substituted Monterey Jack cheese (1 C.) for 1 C of the Parmesan cheese and added about 3-4 dashes of hot sauce, but other than that, I followed the recipe. It's always such a hit! I usually put it together the day before, cover and refrigerate it and then let it sit out on the counter for about 30 minutes before I pop it in the oven the next day. How easy is that?

My memory of Famous-Barr Onion Soup is wonderful -- it was always good. I have found, however, that using only beef broth or stock can make the soup a little bitter. I make onion soup following an America's Test Kitchen which calls for only chicken broth. It is an extremely good soup!!

I made this recipe for a BBQ this summer. It was a big hit everyone loved it. I altered the recipe just a bit, I used half mozzarella and half Parmesan instead of using all Parmesan. My artichokes where from Costco they are packed in oil and simple seasoning, I was worried they would change the flavor but they worked perfectly. I added a bit of Tapatío hot sauce and more garlic then the recipe called for. I scooped the dip in wonton cups I made. Super Yummy, and super easy! 100% Recommendation
These didn't turn out as I'd hoped they would, they were soggy when I pulled them out of the oven. The tomato flavor was a little too over powering for my taste, I won't be making these ever again.
I made this yesterday 10.26.2016 my family and I loved it! Will be making it again in the near future! Thanks for the recipe!!

One of my favorite recipes. I did change it slightly. I precook the rice, and use brown rice, and then skip the water. I used 2 tsp. of Worcestershire sauce, and add 1 tsp. of chili powder, which makes a huge difference in flavor. I don't mix in the cheese, and only top the stuffed peppers with cheese. I used seasoned diced tomatoes with garlic, basil and oregano.
Love this recipe! So moist. I made a glaze to spread on the loaves while still warm. Sooo good!
Love it! Just pulled it out of the oven and dug in. Was worried when I bought the artichoke hearts and tried to chop them up and it got messy, but turned out great!

Great, basic instructions. For the rice, I used 1.5 cups water instead to thoroughly cook rice, put toothpick holes at bottom of peppers to avoid over saturated peppers with fat juice, and added spicy black beans with corn to add flavor. Everyone was quiet at the table!
This is my all time favorite recipe! Thank you so much for posting this! I didnt nees to change one thing!
This dip was all the rave for an office birthday. I put the dip in a bread bowl and baked as recommended. Great eat & easy clean up!
this is great for food projects and only takes a few minutes good luck!!!!!
These were great. I added about 1/2 c white chocolate chips and a little more cream to make them more moist. Enjoy!
This was an amazing and easy recipe!

Waaaaaaay too sweet!!?? Why do people always use so much sugar? Too much butter as well. Too much of everything. This sweet potato pie turned out nasty for me. That's what I get for trying to find good recipes on line.

If you like pecan pie then you should add pecans to the top of this pie before baking. The pecans will toast while in the oven and you won't believe how good this it. I find the usual pecan pie too sweet, but this is GREAT and the pecans add such a great flavor. Put a little dab of whipped topping on it and enjoy!!

My first time to make a Buttermilk Pie and it was a success as well as a favorite at our Thanksgiving meal. I did not make any changes to original recipe--also using a homemade pie crust makes it even better.
It's the most delicious I've ever had!!
Very dry.
You forgot to add the Buttermilk

I have made this recipe twice now. Usually, I am known for trying new recipes out and only seldom do I repeat a dish (for a party /gathering) but this recipe, and my friends agree with me, might need to become a staple. I love this one. This is my first experience with buttermilk pie and I'm pleased to find that it is delightfully sweet and comforting in texture and taste, while having such a mild flavor as to appeal to most people.
All time fav , for those of you fussing about the rice not being done it's right on front of you , just see and test for doneness, times are always approximate with rice
Got everything ready and realized there wasn't any diced tomatoes.
Very good recipe. I too didn't use 2c parm, I used 1 cup parm and 1 cup mozzarella. I also added mozz, parm, and black pepper to the top before putting in the oven.
It was pretty good. We decided to double the chocolate, and that made a difference!
I really liked this! I made enough to freeze, and used as a base for veg beef soup. It's a keeper, thanks!

These were amazing and simple. You can make some small tweaks to suit your own taste, too. We've made it subbing caramel for butterscotch, and we've used slivered almonds for the nuts, too. You can mix and match how you want. Just make sure you get the Condensed milk spread evenly. My first time making it, I didn't do this so I had some spots harder then others and some soft, When I made sure it was even... no problem. Also, pressing it all down firmly is IMPORTANT. If you don't press it down, the top layers won't be "stuck" to the bars. I almost forgot this step, but remembered as I was putting in the oven.. I know I read some reviews that said their top layers didn't stick, so they may have missed this (not sure)...

I used 2 lbs of meat (1 beef, 1 sausage) so I also added a 15 oz can of tomato sauce. I knew I'd like it better with more seasoning so I also added onion powder, minced garlic, basil, oregano, salt and pepper. I put the cheese on top instead of mixing it and I cooked for 25 mins and then finished with 2 mins under the broiler.
This is a great recepie! I love it so much. Tip: add a little extra powdered sugar for the perfect combination. ????
Followed the recipe exactly, and the outcome was deliciousness!! The family finished off the entire batch in short order. Used chopped frozen spinach in a bag and shaved Parmesan cheese. Wow!

This.is.the.recipe.my friend.from the Haag uses, except after browning she would.turn up heat and quickly pour in hot water and put on a tight lid and then simmer them. Juices.served over boiled potatoes. YUM. I like.to serve cranberry sauce or.sweet and sour.red.cabbage on the side.

This dip is amazing. The whole recipe was two much for two of us so I froze a bit over half of it as another reviewer did before baking. Then I baked the rest, and we ate it with bagel crisps. Yummy! Will look forward to making the rest for company.
I make it exactly the same except for the powdered sugar - wow! I only use 2 cups and it is perfect.

Used the butter to cook shrimp, heated the cream in the microwave, added to shrimp along with the Parmesan cheese. Pasta (started first) finished cooking same time, tossed it in, gave it a good stir. On the table in 20 minutes, quick, easy and yummy. Other than the shrimp, the only thing I changed was I added garlic when cooking the shrimp, we love garlicky shrimp.
I finally made the time to make this afternoon. THANK YOU FOR SHARING IT! The family was impressed and our bellies happy. We will be making this again!

I've made these at least a dozen times! We're a gluten and dairy free family, and these are so easy to adapt to fit our needs. I use GF oats, Krusteaz GF all purpose flour, and Earth Balance margarine. I've also ground some oats into flour and used that before too, but they end up a little more crumbly. I've made these with blueberries, mixed berries, canned cherry pie filling, and homemade apple pie filling. They're a hit at every potluck and ladies night I've taken them to! I always double the recipe to make a 9x13 pan.

Create a thick sauce without using flour or cornstarch. Instructions are from a site referring to Alfredo's original recipe. 1. Don't use cheap cheese, Parmigiano Reggiano is a good option for flavor. 2.Melt the butter in a sauce pan low heat to prevent separation. If it does, start over. 3.Slowly whisk in the cream and let simmer for about 1 -3 minute until mixture starts to thicken. The real thickening will occur with the addition of the cheese. 4.Add drained pasts to creamy, buttery mixture. 5. Remove from heat before adding the parmigiano to the Alfredo cream mixture and toss. Sauce will quickly thicken over time so wait at least 1 min before deciding to add more cheese to thicken. For thinner or thicker sauce adjust with amount of cheese but every time I follow these instructions the sauce is thick and sticks to the pasta. A pinch of fresh ground nutmeg gives subtle flavor.

In all, to make 2 cups, I used 3 zucchinis and 2 carrots. I only have 1 loaf pan, so I decided to make mini muffins first, then I poured the rest of the batter into my loaf dish. I am a fan of French Onion Soup and have wanted to make it at home for quite a while. I made this with a few tweaks and think it excellent. I cut Paprika in half based on a review I read here, figuring I could add more during simmer if my taste buds suggested it needed more. Also, based on comments here, I cut the flour to 1/2 c. It is still just a bit thick for my liking, especially after soaking into the baguette. But thinning is pretty easy using that magic ingredient. During simmer tasting, I felt something was lacking. It was a bit bland. After reading other recipes to see what it might need, I settled on adding Worcestershire sauce and Thyme. I added 3 generous pinches of Thyme and started adding dashes of Worcestershire, probably about 15 dashes total, and they did the trick. Don't know if the Thyme did anything, but the Worcestershire did. I know some don't like it when you review a recipe you have tweaked. But hey, who doesn't take a recipe and make it their own by from time to time. I give it 4 stars as written, 5 as it turned out.

Just like I said for my home state of Illinois, I'll say here for my neighbor across the river....Iowa. This doesn't represent Iowa at all in the area where I spent my life. I was born and raised in Illinois, but we crossed the bridge over the Mississippi and were in Davenport, Iowa. People in our neck of the woods live for Pork. And the favorite dish in the bi-state area where I'm from, is the Pork Tenderloin. A piece of pork loin is flattened out so it's as big as your head, fried in a crust like you'd use for chicken fried steak, then put on a hamburger bun which makes it look ridiculously small when the pork is as big as a dinner plate! We always ate ours with yellow mustard, onions and pickles. Now THAT is Illinois/Iowa where I'm from.

My dad (a chef) did things slightly different. He 'blanched' the peppers to soften them so that they would not break when stuffing. He also made a rice and ground beef filing first. You can add spices and other ingredients as you please. He then would take the uncooked ground beef and rice mixture and gently line the inside of each pepper and fill the bottom of the pepper to about 1/4. He then placed a large piece of WHITE extra sharp cheddar (use Kraft Vermont or other but it must be white). He finished filling each pepper with the raw beef and rice mixture. The poured about 1-2 TBSP of pasta sauce over the filled pepper and then placed another thick slice of white cheddar on top of that and pour more pasta sauce over that. He cooked it in the over covered for about 50-60 minutes where the rice would could in the ground beef drippings as well as the cheese inside would melt. Of course the cheese on top would also melt. I would recommend 90% - 95% beef versus the usual 80/20. You do not want too much fat. But the juices continue to cook the pepper as well as the rice. When served have a side of pasta sauce. When you cut open the pepper the White Cheddar cheese mixed with the ground beef and rice would just run. The White cheddar has a different flavor and chemically creates a very different flavor than the orange cheddar. I've made it like this 1 C.Cornmeal,1/2 C.Bread Flour,1/2C.Sugar Opt.for sweetness or drizzle in Honey,1 tsp.Baking Powder,1 C.Milk or Water,1 Tblsp.Lemon or Lime Juice.Mix all together get a 2"deep Square baking dish line with Tin Foil.Spray with Butter Spray all over it.Now add your batter.Then I add 1/2" sliced Turkey Hot Dogs I use Oscar Meyer NOT the White looking ones NO TASTE YUCK,these ones look like regular hot dogs full of flavor.Yesterday I boiled the hot dogs then placed in oven 425 for about 10 minutes.They plumped up.Also if you use beer instead of water it reall plumps the dogs up.Do this b4 adding to your batter.Bake in oven 350 til done about 15-30 minutes give or take check on it.Then you don't have to mess with the scewers & their better baked than fried.Oh & I use alot of Turkey hot dogs.You can also cover the turkey hot dog batter with cheese & then bake.Also with that recipe instead of dusting in flour dust with Cornstarch.I saw this on Foodnetwork.It made it stick to the hot dogs better & flour.

I have to share how this recipe gave me ideas to create a salsa from what I had in the kitchen, for an emergency. I had no cilantro and was kicking myself, so I tried half Italian parsley and half fresh marjoram. Marjoram is a good substitute for cilantro in a pinch. We don't like onions and garlic, so I always use ginger and jalapeno sautéd a little, then water added. This time I also used some chopped cherry bomb red pepper w/o seeds of course (that I had frozen from summertime). We have low-sodium requirements in our family, so I never use salt. It worked great without salt! Lime juice, olive oil, cumin and black pepper is a truly genius combo. When I added those to my chopped cooked tomatoes mixture, it tasted a fantastic salsa. Thank you so much for turning me onto using those four items. It turned my mash into a true salsa flavor, even though using ginger not onions. I have finally figured out the key ingredients. I am so grateful for this site. I have to share that all I had were some cherry salad tomatoes and chopped up those with a half of a regular tomato, simmered, and it worked out ok. I added the parsley marjoram raw at the end. This recipe base seems very flexible. My family likes it warm and cooked, not chilled, so tossed together and cooked till soft enough to mash takes little time.

re: Storage Just figured I'd share a storage tip. If you've ever heard of a Brown-Sugar Bear, it works on the same principle. I got a Brown Sugar Bear in a kitchen-specialty shop/probably available on line. It's a molded piece of clay pottery (just like plants in clay pots)... The directions were to soak the Brown Sugar bear in water for 20 minutes - and afterwards, dry it off and place it in your bag of brown sugar - it literally keeps the brown sugar pliable...so you never ever have to throw away the rock-hard brown sugar. If you should ever find your brown sugar getting hard, you repeat the soaking process and your hard brown sugar will soften again by storing it with the Brown Sugar Bear. Now, as far as cookie storage, you could either get another brown sugar bear, or you can just head down to Lowes or Home Depot and get a clay saucer - the small one will suffice. Just be sure it's never been used and that it's clean/free of debris (but do NOT use soap: just rinse it off. Then soak it just like a Brown Sugar Bear for 20 minutes... and then dry it off and tuck it in the bag with your cookies - whether these shortbread or any fresh cookies (our friend gives trays of home made cookies at Christmas, and they always go stale before we get to the last ones, but I remember my Brown Sugar Bear and used a clay saucer soaked in water as I've said and they stay wonderfully fresh! You won't be disappointed, trust me. My hubby delivers a nationally known brand of cookies, so we are somewhat cookie snobs, usually preferring his brand -vs- home made, but ever since we've employed the Brown Sugar Bear clay-soaked pottery trick, we've learned to appreciate home-made cookies as fresh as the day they were made!

Someone already posted this wasn’t Mississippi Mud. They are 100% correct. While there are variations, a true traditional Mississippi Mud always has marshmallow creme. This is a quick delicious layered Jello pudding pie. I’ve made it since the 90’s. It’s also delicious using Pistschio pudding. You can also use lemon pudding using a lemon pie recipe. All flavors are great for summer events. My daughter actually made this and told me she made Mississippi Mud. I told her sorry but it’s not. I can’t believe people misname or rename things wrongly but maybe they accidentally didnt really know. I told my daughter I would be embarrassed for her if she served this Jello recipe (which is delicious too) and called it Mississippi Mud out in public. Yes, I’m old and 50. I just want the younger generation to know the difference. Don’t take this wrong. Thanks so much. Amber

We pretty much love ANYTHING "apple," & that definitely includes this delicious, super easy & quick to make cake...(It's one of my absolute favorites) I use 1/2 Cup granulated sugar & 1/2 Cup packed dark brown sugar (to enrich the flavor a bit) & leave the peel on Granny Smith apples...(It's even faster & more nutritious) I love adding raisins (I find it doesn't matter a bit whether you use golden or dark raisins...I always "plump" them up first in a dish of hot water) I use whatever kind of nuts I have on hand which is usually either pecans or walnuts, but almonds work as well...& I always toast them first...We love cinnamon so i always add an extra 1/2 t or more...For all you "desert-aholics," I'm not ashamed to admit that I never make this TERRIFIC cake recipe without finishing with a homemade, rich, & buttery caramel frosting...Thank you for sharing...

This is an AWESOME recipe! So easy and surprisingly my son enjoyed it. I did not use rice to make it low carb and when I stuffed the pepper I would alternate between beef and cheese -- so it is like a pasta but inside of a green pepper. Also I bought spicy pasta sauce and used that instead as it gave it a bit of a kick without it being overly spicy. Also I do not boil the green peppers, but put them straight into the over at the tempterature stated and let it cook for longer. Doing it this way softens the pepper just enough without it becoming mushy (which frankly, is disgusting). Oh and you don't have to use green peppers, if you want some color try red, yellow or even orange. One more change, I don't use cheddar cheese but either a two or three cheese blend. I find cheddar doesn't melt very well and using a two or three cheese blend you get better taste.

I grew up in the St Louis area and ate this soup at Famous Barr dozens of times. For years they had the recipe printed on a table tent on every table. Refrigerating overnight is absolutely crucial. This Five Bean Salad is just like my Grand Aunts version which brought back childhood memories of my family holidays from over 60 years ago, but this version is sweet as was my Grand Aunt Pearl’s version. However for a more modern taste, I substituted Butter Beans for the Lima Beans (I like them, but most don't). Also, I added 1/2 each diced red pepper and green pepper, 1 diced serrano chili (adjust per your taste), 1/2 diced cucumber, 8 cloves diced garlic, and 1/2 bunch chopped parsley. To boost the flavor profile, I infused the oil with a 1/2 tsp. each garlic powder, onion powder and dried basil, combined with the 1 tsp. each salt, black pepper, dry mustard and the celery seeds. As for the Sugar, I used brown sugar (to add a little carmel to the flavor profile) for half the adjusted (1/3 to 1/2 cup) sugar in this recipe.
I added 1/2 tsp nutmeg to the recipe. It was delicious!!

This cake was always a staple in my grandmothers pantry as well as any other pantry around. Moist and delicious, at times it had a light drizzle frosting but mostly it was plain. I still make it using my Nan's recipe and during the Christmas Season I add glaced Mixed fruit, Red and Green Cherries etc and of course I add a little Cheer-up ( Rum or Brandy), Makes a beautiful Fruit cake. Love this recipe but found out one thing. If using Dutch process cocoa the baking soda should be omitted and in place add 2 tsp of baking powder. The recipe as is, calling for baking soda only, indicates it calls for natural cocoa. Not making this change in ingredients in a chocolate cake results in a soapy taste. Thought I'd pass it on - fabulous cake!

If you want it to tast like cake, bake a cake. It’s fried dough.
I got super excited when I found fresh rhubarb at the store and so I tried these bars and they're seriously addicting!

I have tried this type onion soup and think it is just.............OK. Real French Onion Soup though is sooooo much better. Again simple ingredients, water, onions, lots of Guyere cheese. NO WINE....and I love wine. Includes broiling the top of the bowl of soup with the slice of french bread on top and more cheese.
amazing recipe! loved having this with coffee every morning.
I've never made spaetzle before and it's so much easier than I would've thought. Super delicious!
This is the OLD recipe from the 1976 edition of the Better Homes & Gardens cookbook, except they called for American cheese instead of cheddar. I've used it for years, and it is absolutely delish.

Good mix for Italian dressing. Use powder rather than the salts. They aren't necessary. I used this mix when I ran out of Good Seasons Italian dressing mix for a Sweet and Sour Italian dressing. One of the best recipes I've ever had. Found in "Matter of Thyme" cook book.

This soup is so delicious, you will be happy it makes a ton! I very much enjoyed the soup with garlic breadsticks, which made for a hearty and filling meal. The leftovers freeze well. The soup did turn out a bit thick, so I just added some more broth to get the consistency I wanted. Another reviewer recommended cooking the pasta before adding to the soup and I think that's a great idea to prevent the soup from getting too thick.
been making spaetzli for years...also love it with the chicken paprikash. I use a 'spaetzli maker' that I bought maybe 40 years ago, inexpensive and works terrific!

Very good and healthier than other recipes. We were able to get 24 muffins from this recipe -- some to have right away and some to freeze -- my type of recipe! Made as directed to use up some buttermilk and other items that were on hand. Thanks for sharing!

I learned this recipe from my German mother in law 40 years ago. She uses a bit more egg per cup of flour and we boil them in chicken broth (or use bouillon cubes in the water). Tastes great in soup or as a substitute for potatoes as a side dish. Sauté in melted butter or margarine with a little salt and sprinkle with Parmesan Cheese. My son used leftover spaghetti sauce over the top, though I have not yet tried that.
I've made this many times, it's delicious!
A classic, simple and tasty salsa! The perfect spice blend and loved it with tortilla chips but was great in tacos and fajitas as well!!

Best meatloaf recipe, my family was impressed, and loved it ??. I tweaked it a little, I added some fresh herbs and I soaked bakery bread in milk and used that instead of bread crumbs, it made the loaf very moist. Flavor is outstanding on this meatloaf. I will be making this again. Yumm ??

I've been making these 'magic bars' for 30+ years. I melt the butter on a stove burner slowly, mix in about a tsp of vanilla, sprinkle the graham cracker crumbs evenly over the butter, layer the chips, nuts, and coconut, then drizzle the sweetened condensed milk over all. Holds everything together nicely. Bake as directed. Always a big success at gatherings.
It was really good! Loved the idea to put it on toasted bread too!

Very good recipe. I did make 1 alteration. I added 2 of the french vanilla liquid coffee creamers ( like the ones you get at a coffee kiosk at the gas station) Gives it a little vanilla kick. I also do this with my fench toast and pancakes. Everyone loves the addition.

Could benefit from some sugar. Had 'State Fair' corndogs recently and was inspired to make some, so I chose this recipe. Could had been puffier. Less oil apparently necessary if fried in skillet rather than deep fryer.

This is a great basic recipe. Over the years I have adapted it by swapping the margarine to butter, onions to a leek, water to fish stock, milk to half & half and adding fresh thyme and a bay leaf as the veg simmers.
I liked this, but it was too sweet for me. The next time I will cut the sugar by half, as other reviewers did. Thanks for sharing!
Too liquid and too bland

I remember visiting my Aunt and Uncle in St. Louis in the mid 60's. We went to Famous Barr for lunch. I had no idea what "french onion soup " was. I was convinced to try it. I seriously was in love with something a pre-teen should NOT like! I have tried others, but always come back to this one!
Delicious! The peppers were perfectly cooked and the rice to beef ratio was perfect. Thank you!
I absolutely LOVE this meatloaf recipe. I searched for one that didn't contain ketchup and this is IT! Delicious and perfectly paired with the Onion Gravy.
Super easy and a huge hit with everyone. My only advice is to make sure you use a good quality Parmesan.
The best I’ve ever made

Was very good! I added bell peppers and since one reviewer said they used gluten free bread crumbs and it was slimy I added an extra egg and it turn out great. The gravy is what makes it so don't pass on that part! Will make again
Wow! I made this tonight and it is stupid good! We loved it! We will definitely make this again. I did use boneless skinless chicken breast and 50 minutes was just right. Really yummy!
This recipe was easy and turned out awesome. My family loved it. The only thing I added extra was two raw diced jalapeños.

I made this recipe exactly as it is written and it was absolutely delicious. I wish I could give it 10 ??S!! Really easy to make and didn’t take much time at all. I think this could be made a day in advance and baked on the day of your event. Definitely a keeper!

I had leftover buttermilk and a pie shell in the freezer, so it was the perfect time to make a pie. I have been teaching my husband to cook since I had surgery a month ago and can't stand in the kitchen too long. I talk him thru recipes and supervise while I sit and watch. He has been doing a good job and actually loves it. He left it in the oven too long, it over browned, but it was good. I disagree with those who say it is too sweet. I think it is perfect like it is. Is there such thing as too sweet? I am going to reserve the last star for when we do it again and don't overcook it. We think it is a good, light pie.
Even with the addition of garlic and onion powder the outcome was a bit bland for us. Blanching peppers is a must though. Going back to my own recipe w/ground beef and pork.
Delicious! One of the best I've had outside of Applebees! I'll definitely make this again.

I make these quite often. To soften the peppers before filling, I microwave them whole for a few minutes. I don’t cut the tops off, but instead cut them in half lengthwise, as this recipe makes more than enough filling and this gives more room for that. Instead of ground beef, I use mild Italian sausage, thus taking care of the lack of spice problem. I use quick-cook rice and fix it separately, then add it to the sausage mixture at the end. Also, instead of the canned tomatoes I use a can of Rotel. Turns out great every time! I would welcome suggestions for side dishes though.

This was easy and good. I only used 2/3 cup of brown sugar and raisins each and that seemed like plenty to me. I used 1/4 tsp of allspice instead of cloves and would probably add another 1/2 tsp cinnamon next time. I also added 1/4c rum. I baked them in large muffin tins for 20 minutes and it made 8.

As I didn't have Worcestershire sauce on hand, I substituted that with Kitchen Bouquet. I also accidentally topped with cheese in the beginning; so covered with foil during baking, and uncovered them during the last minute or two on the broil setting to brown the cheese. These are the best stuffed peppers I have ever had.

This is my second time making this recipe. I've had stiffed bell peppers before, but not these! This recipe is amazing. Best stuffed peppers I've ever had. No joke! The only thing I do different is add a can of rotel. It gives it that extra flavor
Excellent recipe easy but yes needed something, so I added crushed red pepper, fresh garlic and garlic sea salt. Topped with tomato sauce and grated cheese. <3
This is such a light tasting salad. So easy to make and so delicious. The vidalia onion brings this salad together. Definitely will make again.
Fantastic! So easy to make, and absolutely delicious

I am not a fan of stuffed green peppes, but hubby loves them. Found this recipe and it was a total game changer. I loved them and hubby immediately asked for me to make them again soon! Used ground turkey and it was still nice and moist. This will go in our regular rotation and it was a nice simple recipe with simple ingredients!

The directions in this recipe were so vague. For instance, I would have preferred if this recipe explained to cook the vegetables before adding in the meat so they were tender. This was my first time cooking stuffed peppers and I didn’t feel prepared compared to other recipes but the flavors caught my attention. I’m sure these will turn out well!
Delicious my wife's new favorite stuffed peppers

I love this recipe - best. easiest recipe to follow and they were delicious! I did add a little bit of dill weed for extra flavouring because I have done that in the past and i like it! These were a big hit for all who tried them! I also used yellow, orange and red peppers instead of green - just because.

This dip was excellent! I loved it. The only thing I did a little different was I put in on broil for an additional 5 minutes to get some crisp on the top of the dip. Next time I want to try making it somehow in a bread bowl - we'll see how that goes!

I love this recipe. I have fried green tomatoes like this all my life, but have never tried the sugar on them. Since I love the tart green tomato tang I don't think the sugar would be for me. I can easily eat a whole pan full of these tomatoes accompanied only by horseradish sauce & bread & butter.

Delicious and easy to make. We steamed the peppers instead of boiling them and used red, orange and yellow peppers to clean out our fridge. I was worried the mixture would be too simple but it was perfect. Will definitely make these again. They would probably be great with any cheese of your choice, too.
Very good! Makes a large amount.

I just made this dressing for a tomato cucumber salad after discovering I was out of Good Seasons. This is a pretty close approximation! I took a cue from the comments and used all powders instead of salts and just added the 2 TBSP of kosher salt indicated. It turned out perfect! Thanks for saving me!

I was given four large green peppers and needed a recipe that was simple, but had good flavor. This is my first time making stuffed peppers, so I didn't really know what to expect. It was so good. Everyone in my household was happy with dinner tonight. This will be my go-to stuffed pepper recipe from now on.
The flavor was great. However, a 13x9 pan is much to large for the amount of fudge. It was extremely think.

I have made these for years. I usually use a dark chocolate cake mix and add chocolate chips. My daughter made these (the chocolate ones) for an office pitch-in once and she was ordered (jokingly) by her boss to bring them in at least once a month!!
Love it, just finished baking. Tripled the batch, no tweaks, no adjustments. Perfect as is!. I'm eating the biscuits as I'm typing ??.

Delicious...and I have disliked stuffed bell peppers since childhood. Cooking every meal because of the pandemic is forcing me to expand my meal rotation, so I tried these last night, and loved them. Next time, I’m going to try these using red peppers instead of green.
Made last night!! Delicious!
Perfect!!!!

This is the soup, as I remember it! As I read through comments/suggestions I made a couple of tweaks. I used red wine, this caused no need for kitchen bouquet. I also used have beef broth and chicken broth. This makes me feel like I’ve found home! Thank you

Although these were nice & fudgy, the cookies flattened out so much that they looked like ice burgs on my cookies instead of a cracked ice effect if that makes any sense. The taste is great! Just wish they didn't spread so much....I used 2 different pans (teflon & baking stone) to see if that would help, but to no avail. I also read the reviews and made sure that the cookies were covered in icing sugar & the dough was kept in the fridge overnight for about 22 hours. I think I did everything right! Guess they are iceburg cookies this year! :)
